name: STK - NYC - Midtown
addressComponentsLongName: 1114 Avenue of the Americas,  New York, NY 10036

reviews.reviewsText:
The appetizers too 45 minutes to arrive.
The service was underwhelming. I asked the manager if my waiter needs help because we haven’t seen him. Apparently she did nothing, just asked him are you good and moved on.
The steak was over cooked, the 10oz was closer to a 6 oz.
Not going back to that location for dinner ever again.
Loud music. Subpar food. Over priced everything and horrible service

Overpriced steak house with good food but really disappointing service. Our table was not stable, needed to ask twice to please help. Sides for the kids (despite several friendly reminders) came after they finished their meals (kind of waste as we said once they were done we did not need them anymore). They were still on the check but removed after my comment that we did not have them. My wife and I waited over one hour on our food. Generally, the waiter needed being reminded of everything albeit being very friendly. The senior colleague/ manager (?) was great though and everybody is entitled to a bad day once in a while but if you sell steaks for around 100 USD this is more difficult to accept than in some diner.
The ribeye, which cost $81, was the worse ribeye I ever had. It looked like it was cut in half. Fortunately, the restaurant took the steak off my bill. I would never go to STK in NYC again.

Food was delicious. Was a bit disappointed by the service since I was celebrating a birthday and they didn't prepare anything, not even a small ice cream with a candle. They would only provide a sparkler if you ordered dessert separately. It felt obvious that they were trying to cheapen the overall feeling and service to cut costs here and there but it does hit the reputation in my opinion and is not a good business decision. I will definitely not be back to celebrate anything in the future.
The customer service was so awful it was nasty.  Will never send any of my executives back here again.
Wish it was better. Food was ok. Service was pleasant. Location was great.

I really enjoyed STK pre pandemic! I’ve been to both NYC locations since and each experience had its issues. My coworker and I were excited to have lunch there as the weather got warmer. Firstly, the glassware on our table was filthy. They moved our seat, unnecessary but we welcomed the offer. We ordered two of the same lunch menu items and upgraded to truffle fries. My coworker complained that the fries weren’t cooked. I didn’t share her sentiment until I bit into one of my own and found that the fry was in fact not cooked through. From then on it was hit or miss as to which fry was cooked through. A waiter (not our tables waiter) who I knew from another dining experience spoke with a manager for us. They offered a new order of fries. What came was fries that were scorching hot and practically burnt. I’ve had their truffle fries in the past… and they were cooked all the way through and not burnt. I was so displeased that I didn’t even finish my sandwich. Overall it wasn’t a pleasant lunch. I judged my brunch experience in meatpacking harshly thinking it was unique to that location. Apparently the lack of attention to detail and basic care in preparing food is across the board for their NYC locations.
Yum yum yum yum yum very good and good service. Good atmosphere and location. Mashed potatoes went hard

Tolle Steaks, tolle Drinks, sehr zuvorkommend und freundlich. Ein Steak war ein wenig über der bestellten Garstufe und wir haben auf Nachfrage darauf hingewiesen. Uns wurde sofort ein neues Steak angeboten. Wir haben dankend abgelehnt und daraufhin hat der Kellner uns auf dieses Steak 50% Nachlass gegeben. Einfach nur Wow!
Die Preise sind sogar für uns als Frankfurter hoch, aber alles in allem war es ein toller Abend und alles war super lecker. Absolut empfehlenswert, aber teuer!
Food was excellent. The music is great addition to the atmosphere, but too loud.
We had a great Easter Brunch. Our server was great.

Celebrated my moms bday and everything was perfect. Food was good drinks were good and service was awesome. Beware that if you bring a cake, they will charge $5 per person to cut the cake. We ended up just cutting the cake at home. Other than than that great experience and great ambiance. Definitely will come again
Amazing food, service and vibe.  We were glad to get a same day reservation as we will dine here again.  We visited with my 16 year old who thought it was cool.
You book at 8pm, you get the table later! This is not correct

Love this restaurant, the food is excellent and the atmosphere is great, its always nice to visit this restaurant.  Two points about our visit yesterday....the service provided by our waiter was not good - appetizers came with the entrees and he was happy to argue with us when we said that wasn't what we expected, he had to be reminded to bring extra drinks that we had ordered a couple of times, and generally we felt that he was trying to rush us through dinner, which for us was a 50th birthday celebration.  Not what you would expect from a quality steak house.  Secondly, the music was very loud, felt that it could have been a little quieter that early in the evening.

My drink order or DIET COKE was messed up 3 times. My allergies that I informed my waitress ahead of time about were not accommodated for. Food was brought out that I never order. The food was really bad except for the steak.
Beautiful restaurant, very unusual inside, the food was great, service friendly and attentive. Is a bit pricey though. The music gets quite loud late evenings as they have a DJ there.
Service was the worst ever it was like no one wanted to serve us food was under cooked or over cooked and they forgot a couple of side dishes

My steak was delicious but please expect to pay between $75-$100 per meal.   All menu items are a lacarte the price range listed here is wildly inaccurate.  Music is very loud here but we were seated in the back where it was tolerable.
This restaurant was great.  The food was delicious. Highly recommend this restaurant!

Ambiance is amazing but food, not so much. You’d think a “steakhouse” would get your steak order right. My husband and I ordered medium well. His came out medium and mine came out well and both were warm. Steak comes out HOT! Food also took a long time to be served. We experienced it but we won’t be back. Very disappointed, thanks.
Food was excellent. We thought the music was a bit too loud, but it didn’t spoil the night.
The music was very very loud. Lots of bass. Like a club. Could not talk and left with a headache. Not the atmosphere you would expect for such a nice restaurant. And on a Wednesday night.

The food and atmosphere were excellent. I was there for a very important business lunch. Towards the end of the meal, the server kept interrupting us to see if we needed anything to the point of annoyance.  As it approached 4pm (the lunch started at 2) the server again interrupted and when we said we were fine, he said that his shift was ending so could we close out the bill.  My colleague said I guess no desert, the server rudely said you want desert?  My colleague asked to see a menu and the server said, “what do you want”.  And when asked what do you have, rattled off some deserts.  Clearly he was just worried about his tip, very unprofessional.

The bread they bring out and the lobster mac and cheese were incredible. The sides, drinks and desserts were also very very good. We all thought the steaks were ok but not something amazing that we could not get from an average steak house. We thought in general it was overpriced for the level of food being served in the city.
The biggest issue we had was the loud music. Our group has no issue with loud music or a high energy atmosphere but when you can’t hear other guys at your table when they are shouting it is too much. We could not hear waitress and she could not hear us without shouting. Even then we had to repeat ourselves.
Overall, really good in some areas but miss the mark in other areas. They should not be missing the mark for the prices.
Amazing food and service - and buzzy vibrant ambiance. The only downside was it is very very expensive.
Dodd was good, service was ok and noise was loud . Not value for money too expensive for what you get . They want $20 for tator tots to go with over priced steak .

Extremely loud, but our Waiter was great, seating staff put us  at a terrible table so loud we couldn’t hear the waiter to order. Had to ask to be moved. They did accommodate which was nice and provided champagne and free drinks with dessert . Pretty good experience but if your going out strictly for the food i would choose a different steakhouse because of price.
Ok food, very loud ambiance and outrageous prices: $19 for six boiled asparagus is simply unacceptable! Will never go back!

A bit pricey but we’ll worth it. It was a great upscale experience paired with the beat waiter around. The service and food were top notch. The steak was surprisingly good after reheating the next day (leftovers).
The food was great n music was on point would love come back here again
Love there short ribs and steak was amazing . The music and ambiance was wonderful and servers such as Artomnd which was my server made my birthday extra special thank you stk. 👏❤️

6 of us came to New York to celebrate 2 birthdays. The location was good, the ambiance was nice, great DJ but everything else was terrible! This place is not organized at all! For the money you spend on the food/service - there’s NO way you should be treated like crap. We get there 15 mins before our reservations and ended up waiting 45 mins to an hour just to be seated. The waiter / servers / managers kept moving us around asking to stand in different places because we’re in the way. Some were more rude than others. When we sat down things were a little better. Food arrived pretty quickly. Our bill was about $700 so to be treated the way were was horrible. I will never go to a STK in New York ever again
Too loud. Steak came out cold and over cooked. Overrated wish I could get my money back

Waited over 20 min passed my reservation. Saw endless tables be seated before me. Instead of apologizing hostess told me it was because the size of my party. Reservation was made Tuesday and we were a party of 3. Rude and a waste of my time.

This is my first review I have ever written. Top to bottom was by far the worst experience I have ever had. I have worked in midtown and in the restaurant industry for 13 years. My dad is a bit handicapped and hard for him to walk and the amount of times we were cut off by staff and no allowed to walk first was surprising. Kahn seemed to be pretty clueless from the beginning, we always had empty glasses of wine, I ordered shellfish, apps and entrees and had a conversation where he asked if we wanted to do 3 courses I said shellfish and also can come together then entrees. When the food came everything came at the same time. Shellfish/apps/entrees, I told Kahn about it and his response was “oh yeah I see that” with in 30 minutes of being sat we were on entrees. We weren’t even given different share plates so we were eating the filet mignon and pork with the plates covered in cocktail sauce and oyster juice. To say I was livid is an understatement as I was there to celebrate a bday and I put that in the notes but when I ordered dessert so candle or any acknowledgement about that either. At the price point this restaurant is at they should 100% have higher standards. 5 adults 1 kid bill was over 1k so we we spending money and probably would’ve spent more of wine wasn’t on empty all dinner. I will never be back.
Horrible food and terrible service . Place was too loud with DJ playing hip hop..
First time, it was a great experience. Food was good atmosphere was great

This was the worst dining service experience we’ve ever had. We go to fine dining restaurants regularly and we needed a place to eat late night. STK had an opening and we took it.

The server was absolutely terrible. He never checked on us. He took so long to bring a check we ended up not ordering dessert. He was extremely rude. His name was Jay and honestly he should be fired. This was the worst service experience I’ve ever had in my life and that’s saying a lot considering how many reservations have been completed in the past year alone.
Glorious and iconic, the Russian Tea Room is a must for anyone wanting a unique NY experience.  So much history and grandeur. The food is excellent. The caviar and vodka tasting divine.
Definitely worth the experience, the food was average considering the price…but worth it nonetheless.  Like taking a step back in time.  🥰
Great service. Our waitress was wonderful and made the best old fashioned.  Building was a little too warm. The High tea was just good, lol not fantastic.  Had a good time.

Such a gorgeous place to visit after a tour of Carnegie Hall. My niece and I had the High Tea and we had a wonderful time. Too much food though- we each had our own trays- but we brought the extras back to the hotel. We’ve decided to make the Russian Tea Room a tradition when we visit New York.

FISH OVERCOOKED, CAULIFLOWER UNDER COOKED
SALAD SPARSE
Delightful food, wonderful Vodka and beautiful ambiance.

Unfortunately, the waiters we’re having off-color conversations within earshot of the dining experience, the food truck 40 minutes and overall felt like nobody really cared about. The Decour was beautiful, but I don’t sit up front near the bar.

Really disappointing. Service was slow and unfriendly, portions were small given the price points. And this will sound totally petty, but the side order of toast was one piece of toast which I've never seen! Additionally, 1 of the waiters spilled coffee all over our table (which has no big deal, it happens), but then he simply put the coffee pot on the puddle to cover it up! This is a restaurant that's clearly living off if reputation and history period.

This was an iconic experience in New York. We would highly recommend. Extremely accommodating for children with several options. Portions for some of the lunch dishes were quite small, but others were well apportioned. Not very accommodating for food, allergies.

The server seemed annoyed with our existence, lol. We might have looked broke, but we spent all day shopping and sightseeing and we were exhausted. Don’t judge a book by its cover. You could have had a much bigger tip if you cared.
Balance quality price was not good, specially the tea menu. Staff was slightly rude, careless to us. We were disappointed.

I have never been to NYC before. The Russian Tea Room has been a bucket list item for me for years. I did the afternoon tea selection. The tea was great. The sandwiches, bellini, pettifores, scones, all of it tasted amazing. Atmosphere was quiet which was very nice. Lots of artwork to look at. I asked several of the wait staff what their favorite was and they all had a different one. The decor is a bit dated but it also adds to history of the place I feel. When I go back to NYC for my next trip I'll definitely be sampling else on the menu as well.
Restaurant is beautiful! The food was really average. And it’s not Russian food.  Service was ok. It’s not the type of restaurant you will come back.
Very good food, teas, and deserts. Staff is extremely polite and the atmosphere is classy and nice. I’ve been there twice during lunchtime.
Massively disappointing. The bread tasted stale and the sandwiches had hardly anything on them. This place is purely a tourist trap and not worth the cost.
Very special experience. Perfect ambiance and delicious food

Sweet 16 for my daughter as we flew in from Pittsburgh to see PHANTOM before it closes next week…I have longed to eat there since seeing the film TOOTSIE in the early 1980s. Our experience did not disappoint.
Excellent food and service. Would recommend to anyone looking for a fine dinner.

We loved our experience at The Russian Tea Room.  Beautiful restaurant, outstanding service and delicious food with a wide variety of offerings. The largest selection of Vodka I’ve seen in the United States-INDULGE. Our bill was not for the faint of heart, but well worth every penny of it.

Lovely mid-afternoon meal with my family. We did not experience the tea sandwiches but ordered meals off the menu. Everyone enjoyed their meal, the staff were very patient as we took our time overlooking the menu and chatted away.
Do NOT order the lobster salad.  The Beef Stroganoff (short ribs) was excellent.  Cocktails were $30.  Way too expensive for the quality of food.

I was excited to visit The Russian Tea Room. 
The atmosphere was nice and cozy. Food was good but a little disappointing. I had the eggs Benedict. One egg was hard but the other was gooey and delicious. For $35 i hoped it was perfect.  My daughter had a French Onion soup which she said was very good. Was disappointed it has no bread inside bowl and none served on the side either. $28. I asked for a raspberry danish. What I got seemed like a very small croissant with not much raspberry inside. $7.  Thoroughly enjoyed the Russian Country Tea. Our waitress, Sylvie , was excellent in every way.
The food was food.  We enjoyed the atmosphere.  Felt like seeing NYC history.
The food was excellent, as always. The decor is what it is...the Russian Tea Room. The service is good...not exceptional but very good. It's a place we'll keep coming back to.
Great martinis and amazing waiter!
Highly recommend! It is an experience like no other and food is prepared by top chefs.

Was a special treat for my teenagers before seeing a Broadway musical. The food was sparse and mediocre at best. Tees were fine but nothing special. The scones didn’t come with clotted cream. The sandwich bread didn’t seem quite fresh. Unfortunately it’s just not worth the money at $95 per person.

We paid $95 plus tax and tip for stale sandwiches, cheap-tasting cakes and very average service. They even tried to charge me $5 for an extra tea bag because the tea was so weak, although thankfully saw sense when I asked about it being on the bill. Absolutely do not recommend.

Amazing experience! We had a wonderful time. Great food, service, atmosphere!
A NYC institution! We’ll be back!

What an amazing experience. The ambiance, the service, the food, the drinks. There wasn’t one thing that was bad. We had the caviar tasting and pelmeni dumplings as an appetizer and it did not disappoint. For mains, we had scallops and Boeuf à la Stroganoff. The scallops were incredible and the beef was incredibly tender. The food overall was some of the best I’ve had in New York.The atmosphere is equally impressive, quite, cozy and romantic. And the Staff was super friendly and helpful. This is a great experience all around and highly recommend The Russian Tea Room!

I had the pleasure of dining with my family at this iconic restaurant. I ordered the beef stroganoff and it was delicious. My daughter had the same dish but dairy free. It was so good that I regretted not ordering mine the same way just to save on the calories. Thank you to the Chef for preparing such an excellent meal. We also had the pirozki. It was very good but hard to share with a party of 4. My husband and son both had the ribeye and were very satisfied with it. The service was great and the atmosphere was unforgettable. We recommend visiting for a special occasion.

Dining here is always a pleasure. The ambience is beautiful, yet not pretentious. The wait staff are excellent, as they respect conversation and never interrupt. And of course, the food is always delicious! The onion soup is wonderful. I love coming here. The Russian Tea Room is more than a meal; it is an experience.
We had a wonderful time.  The service was excellent and the waiter was very helpful with menu and wine selection. Enjoyed the ambience of the restaurant.
I loved it ! Can’t Wait to be back ! Food was delicious and the stuff very nice .

Had a reservation for afternoon tea for two on Sunday and it was massively overpriced for the experience. The sandwiches and dessert are not nearly tasty enough to be worth $95. The tea and sour cherry sweetener were nice, but the tea was nothing fancy or inaccessible so I'm not really sure what I was paying for.

My in-laws took me on an amazing 1st time New York trip 30 years ago and the Russian Tea Room was a part of the “must experience” places.  We now have a daughter-in-law that has never been to New York so we are recreating our 30 years ago experience.  The Russian Tea Room dining experience was just as amazing!  Thank you for remaining timeless and classic!

Service was underwhelming, considering what you are paying you would exp ct much better. The menus were left on the table with no explanation as to how anything worked for tea or your choices. Very few waiters seemed to be working and mostly bus boys who just dropped food dishes off. Food trays came very quickly, before even be asked what you would like to drink.  Tea sandwiches looked like camp sandwiches, very simple crust cut off white bread—not what you expect for 95 dollars a person. Had to wait 20 minutes for a glass of wine while food sat in front of us. Combination of mediocre food and poor service was not worth the high prices.
So incredibly disappointing. The service was terrible. Food was terrible. And I mean terrible. We went there for brunch, and I honestly had a better meal at IHOP.
We found it a good experience overall but maybe a little overrated.
The ambiance was fantastic. We didn’t feel rushed. The service was excellent. The food was wonderful but quite pricy. Great location to the theatre district

Dinner with my lady
Food was great, service was amazing
Portions were beautiful but very large - great food and service
Family dinner.  In NYC for holiday with the family and Philippe is a usual stop. Food is great and so is the service

Excellent meal
Waiter Florin very attentive, as were his assistants
Nice setting and a cool place to dine. Had a great time and the food where well seasoned love the dumpling as well
Everything is always absolutely perfection! We love everyone there

We had a most delightful lunch--very relaxed; charming waiter; very tasty selection.  Definitely
plan on returning
It was a little loud music wise for a sunday night in my opinion but other then that minor problem everything was incredible
They had ran out of the dish after we had already ordered but waitress made it up for us great experience overall
Great food, drinks and service! I definitely recommend.

Good evening, as a first time customer was very disappointed with our server Alberto .Whentime for bill our bill came up to $603.17 which wasn't the problem we loved the food the cocktails we were celebrating my daughters birthday the bill came out to $603.17 and we gave him as a tip $100.00 which he wasn't happy with , he approached Alberto our server and told me if I was happy with his service and I told him yes and he replied so why you gave me such little tip he was demanding for more tip and he humiliated us by such act. first of all tip is not an obligation he should have been happy with the $100 we gave him it was very unprofessional of his behave to approach us for more tip and humiliate us as a first time custumore don't think ill be back nor recommend anyone.
Servers were so nice/patient and the food was perfect!
we were celebrating a birthday and the service we received was remarkable, tables are comfortable, food is pretty good, duck was great and desserts out of mind. 10/10 very happy
Consistently delicious food. Lovely wait staff. Reservations honored on time. Indoor/outdoor dIning. Will recommend to everyone within earshot!
Good food and atmosphere!  Did not break the bank either.
Had a great experience! Fine dining on the Upper east side. The service staff was so attentive and the food was delicious. Perfect for a birthday meal
I brought my mentor here for dinner and she throughly enjoyed it. She’s super picky, so if she loved it then it was great. But I always love it here.💙

Excellent food.
Excellent service.
EXCELLENT AMBIENCE.
Food is delicious! Service wonderful. Music too loud!
Very good food and service but much too loud,
Amazing experience with very lively atmosphere. Drinks were great and food was excellent. It’s become my favorite Asian restaurant. Can’t wait to go back!
It was very crowded, loud, overpriced and service was horrible!
Great food and great service !
10/10 . Highly Recommend. The Food Is Phenomenal.
It was fun

The food was absolutely amazing. It was a group of four of us and we did the prix fixe and let's just say that we left with three bags of leftovers. It was so much food and everything was excellent. 

Waiter was great as well. Worth every single dollar!
Loved it! Great food and fantastic service
I loved the food!! Everything was perfect! Even the price
The seating is too tight. But everything else was great!

First time for lunch..... but it will not be the last time.
Everything was excellent!
The best! It was 5 of us for my sons Birthday. We were seated right away upstairs at a cozy table. The food and the service were phenomenal! We can’t wait to go back!
Amazing  like always
5 Stars all the way. Food, Service , Ambiance all 5 stars. We will always come back.
very good food; excellent service... no complaints whatsoever!
As always a positive experience at this restaurant
Waited too long for our 7pm reservation. The tables were literally on top of another. Food was prompt and delicious. Service was great.
Food was terrible
It was great in every way. Can’t wait to come back.
Food and service was impeccable. Definitely loved the ambiance as well.
Food was good but did not like the ambiance. Parties to the left and right were extremely loud.

Highly recommend! It is an experience like no other and food is prepared by top chefs.

I loved it ! Can’t Wait to be back ! Food was delicious and the stuff very nice .

Had a reservation for afternoon tea for two on Sunday and it was massively overpriced for the experience. The sandwiches and dessert are not nearly tasty enough to be worth $95. The tea and sour cherry sweetener were nice, but the tea was nothing fancy or inaccessible so I'm not really sure what I was paying for.

My in-laws took me on an amazing 1st time New York trip 30 years ago and the Russian Tea Room was a part of the “must experience” places.  We now have a daughter-in-law that has never been to New York so we are recreating our 30 years ago experience.  The Russian Tea Room dining experience was just as amazing!  Thank you for remaining timeless and classic!

Service was underwhelming, considering what you are paying you would exp ct much better. The menus were left on the table with no explanation as to how anything worked for tea or your choices. Very few waiters seemed to be working and mostly bus boys who just dropped food dishes off. Food trays came very quickly, before even be asked what you would like to drink.  Tea sandwiches looked like camp sandwiches, very simple crust cut off white bread—not what you expect for 95 dollars a person. Had to wait 20 minutes for a glass of wine while food sat in front of us. Combination of mediocre food and poor service was not worth the high prices.
So incredibly disappointing. The service was terrible. Food was terrible. And I mean terrible. We went there for brunch, and I honestly had a better meal at IHOP.
We found it a good experience overall but maybe a little overrated.
The ambiance was fantastic. We didn’t feel rushed. The service was excellent. The food was wonderful but quite pricy. Great location to the theatre district
It is hard now to sit in the cabana with all the bikes and motocyles coming by..not very pleasant...One has to sit on the sidewalk side at this point to have a decent time
Out of town visitor to NYC.  Great food but slow on serving our table at brunch.
As a long term diner at this restaurant the quality of the food was disappointing and way below Hope that eas an an aberration

As usual, an outstanding experience! The only criticism was that the tuna tartare (unlike on prior visits)  was more  avocado than tuna. The som (Wally) was superb in assisting  us open and serve a 1943 bottle of Bordeaux that we brought.
Waiter indifferent at best.  We had to wave anyone down to refill waters, could not get one diner’s drink until we flagged down a busboy.

Service was excellent; have always liked the decor and the vibe in the room was good. However, the supposedly "lightly breaded" Sole Milanese was heavily breaded and devoid of flavor. The arugula salad that came with the sole was good. The Panisse (chick pea fries) appetizer was disappointing. My guests burger was okay. And the special dessert (rhubarb tarte) was very good. (The last time I ate here was for a very delicious breakfast so I was expecting tastier food this time around.)

Service isn’t good.
Takes forever to get assistance
Wrong item brought
Sullen
I went for a lunch/reunion with a long lost friend. We lingered quite a while after we finished our lunch and weren’t made at all uncomfortable about that, no pressure to vacate the table.
The service was a bit harried bc it was a very busy time/holiday, but everything was exceptional, as usual and we had a lovely Easter brunch!
A lovely Easter Brunch with friends. Great service delicious food, GM Lisa Jordan and her team did a lovely job of making the day special.
Easter brunch. The food was not that tasty, but still ok
Great food and ambiance for Easter brunch; enjoyed our experience
We were very pleasantly surprised at the level of service on a very busy Easter Sunday. The staff was exceptionally friendly and on top of everything.  Food was really wonderful as well.
Dining at Nice Matin was an enjoyable experience!  The food was delicious and staff wonderful and attentive.  I hope to return soon.
The French toast was very disappointing such a small portion.
We loved our wonderful Easter brunch at Nice Matin!

The food was great, our waiter was very good, but it was incredibly noisy. Also the food seemed to take a long time to arrive.
Otherwise very good.
Fabulous table in the window, great staff. Food was great, but not very hot. Cold Fries, and Hollandaise Sauce
Poor service, forgot our entrees, waiter was rarely around. Food average.
Good and service was amazing!! Wish I lived closer so I could go more often.
Overall a good experience. Our table was ready when we arrived. The food was delicious. The prices were high for lunch. We had to ask 4x for bread.

This has been my top go-to restaurant on the upper west side for the last 3 years because of  consistently excellent food, attentive service, and great outdoor dining options (the only reason I rate the noise a bit high—to be expected). There are very good vegetarian choices and a nice wine list. All of this quality for fair pricing. Friends and I have even come to Nice Matin for pre theater meals, as it’s a block from the #1 train and we can easily make our curtain time. I have never been disappointed!
A great weekday breakfast a- many options and everything was delicious!
It's a great place. You won't regret it. I'd recommend it for any kind of date.

The only negative I experuenced at 5 pm 4/2 was shock at the appearance of the person dealing with reservations just inside the door.  He had a black mask literally up to his lower eyelids and so nuch unruly hair that, in combination, you could not see his eyes. Hallowe’en-like,  exceot this is my introduction to a classy French restaurant? Really off-putting, in my view.

Everything was lovely but for the fact that our neighbors to the right and left did not want the heat lamps on. Since our table shared lamps with the other tables and did not have a lamp of its own, my brunch companion and I got cold. Otherwise, everything was top notch: our server was responsive, professional and kind and the food was delicious. The pommes paillassons were really well done. Overall a lovely experience.
We love Nice Matin.  They were a bit off their game this time - food came incorrectly and cold.  Staff seemed overwhelmed and not as efficient or available as the usual wonderful service.

Lovely seating area by the window. The omelettes were very disappointing.  Would have preferred not having end pieces on the bread although bread was very good. French toast and waffles were excellent.
Amazing food and service was fantastic - super friendly!

We had the shrimp salad. Every ingredient was the freshest and most delicious I have tasted in a long time. I will definitely order it again. I tried  get our waiter to tell me the name of the wonderful olive oil that came with our rolls but he demurred.  Iwill try that again too.   Thank you fora perfect lunch. 
Anne Byrnes

I find in general that Nice Matin is not what is was - Had lunch there.  Pistou soup - old standby - no more of the melted cheese crackers - chicken baguette sandwich very salty.  The change over of chefs a while ago now is not for the better me thinks....It is one of the "nicer" places to have lunch so it will do ok....it's just that it could be so much better w/not a lot of extra effort.
Best staff in the neighborhood! Great food too. Always a fun evening.
The ambiance is lovely, and the food was delicious. I’ve always wanted to try this restaurant, and I wasn’t disappointed. It’s much brighter and prettier inside than I expected.

We went to see where our Grandson works and hospitality, atmosphere, service, food and everything about our dining experience was over the top!!! I have been recommending to all ever since and will definitely go back!

I really like this place, especially for business lunches. Solid and consistent in every category. Food is delicious, ambience is lovely, not too loud, and attentive staff. Why not 5 stars? It's not over the top in any of the categories, but very good. A solid 4.7
Ordered an omelet , and it , and everything else on the plate, was the saltiest thing I’ve ever tasted ! Could not eat . Waitress was very kind to get something else for me . Beware of all the salt !
quality of the food was disappointing, especially at the prices.....
I always enjoy dining here for brunch, so I wanted to try out their dinner. It was very, very good! Service was great and atmosphere was quiet and calm. I will definitely be back for dinner.
Reasonable portion sizes and excellent quality and service
wonderful evening to share with friend, great waiter, delicious food & a beautiful place to be !
Too noisy. We couldn’t hear our friends or talk. We all left with sore throats from shouting.
Food was delicious as always and our server was extremely attentive even though the place was very busy without being intrusive.
food is no more than "OK" despite the nice middle east ambiance
Great food, service, and atmosphere. I go there regularly and am always so happy with the experience.

Tables for 2 are very small and in poor locations

Crispy roast lamb was so fatty as to be inedible
We had a fabulous meal and Dagon has the best food on the UWS.  The service is excellent too.

Normally stellar but this time, whilst our starters were wonderful, our entrees not so much.  The lamb was served room temperature and was fatty, and the chicken was stringy and overcooked.  More like how you would expect turkey.  Sad.
YUM. Great for business lunch. I can't eat enough of the chicken liver mousse.

Food was ok but not exceptional for the price tag. Feels like the restaurant plays on the idea of serving different and exotic food but it fails to ‘wow’ you and it is overpriced for the experience it provides.
Our favorite dinner place on the Upper West Side.  Food is amazing and the old fashioned is one of a kind.  Friendly staff adds extra value to the fantastic experience.
Great food, great service. Loud. But overall a great experience.
Food was very spicy for me. While the service was good, it was very noisy. This is not fine dining.
This place just keeps getting better and better, great evening
As always the food was amazing!   Tried the chicken this time and it didn’t disappoint.  Hummus, eggplant and flatbread were delish!
The loudest restaurant I have ever been to. I couldn’t hear myself or hear my guest speak because It was hard to have a conversation. The food and service were excellent though.
Noise level VERY loud Food ok not great. Service very nice
Excellent food. Heaters for outdoor seating not good enough if temp is in low 50s.

We ate at lunch because we wanted to avoid crowds and noise. We succeeded. Service was very attentive and everything we ordered was deelish. The priced fixed menu was a steal: fried cauliflower for a starter, then the burger - for $32. The labneh cheesecake was excellent. I'll be back again.
Completely overrated. Food was just ok, service was unprofessional and ambience was loud. The hostesses were very nice, accommodating our request to be moved from one table to another.
Food, service, atmosphere, all great! I am a regular there.

Set menu for Passover. The food was good but served in a strange order—soup came out before Seder plate and we’ll before the other first course at our table. We also had very long waits between courses, and the kitchen ran out of one of the two dessert items, which was unfortunate. Our waitress was clearly working hard and was responsive and accommodating but it seemed like she might have had too many tables and not enough support from the runners or maybe that the runners weren’t clear on what should come
out when. Would consider dining again a la carte.
Great food and atmosphere - it was very busy so service was distracted but they were very nice. Would recommend but it’s noisy/busy if you have young children.

Service staff were friendly and helpful.
The courses of the Passover dinner were a bit off: Seder plate and soup arrived simultaneously, instead of  sequentially.
Entree: Lamb dish was my favorite course.  It was divine.

I had the Passover prix fixe and it was wonderful.  The creative seder plate was attractive and the "maror" and "charoset" were tasty.  The salmon was the best I've ever had.  All in all a wonderful dinner.

We ate outside and the service was slowwww. Took a long time for main courses
And the whole fish was a disappointment with little flavor.
The flatbread was good but without the eggplant ingredient

Love this neighborhood gem and have discovered that while it is a lively dinner scene, the lunch vibe is much more serene (while the service remains excellent). I've hosted two work lunches here in the last week and everyone raved about the food and the space. Will definitely back soon!

One of the best restaurants we have been to in a while! Every single thing we ordered was perfectly executed, creative fare. The homemade bread was outstanding. Highly, highly recommend... great vibe and service as well.
We had a lovely evening with friends visiting New York!  The food was amazing and the service was impeccable.  One of our favorites on the UWS!
You will be coming back for another meal at Dagon! Incredible!
Dagon has always been great in the past. On this visit, the food was good but not as stellar. Service and ambiance remain solid. I hope it will return to form on my next visit.
Spent my birthday here. My favorite place on the west side. Healthy, vegetarian options and food is consistently excellent with a creative flair.
Amazing! Highly recommend! Go treat yourself to a great meal
Great food and great service!  Creative people doing wonderful things with Israeli food and a cool vibe.

Despite having a reservation, we had to wait half an hour for our table. We totally understand that things happen, but the host was unapologetic and unhelpful. Food was great, just wish service was better.

It is consistently wonderful. Food, service, ambiance are great, and it’s always lively and a lot of fun! The managers on the floor oversee everything constantly so the service is  wonderful and the serving staff is so friendly. It’s perfect for dates or groups.
Hi diner was good, but we were seated 45 minutes after our reservation time!

All of the food was exceptionally delicious and well prepared and presented! Quite special actually! Would absolutely return and order the Kubaneh bread OMG, and various salads, small plates and Mezze and share -  fun, varied, delicious way to dine here!!

We had a table up and in the back where it was quiet and roomy. Main room might be a bit noisy and tight but very cool, lively atmosphere. So either works. Service was very good and attentive for the most part.

The only issue we had at all was ‘everyone in the party must be there to be seated ‘ 2 of 4 were there - really dislike being asked to stand on the side and wait.  And, cannot order appetizers as you decide main course - everything had to be ordered together. These two things made it feel more ‘fussy’/‘uppity’ than necessary. Keep that in mind and go have a great meal.

What a great restaurant!  This was our first time and we really enjoyed all the food, which consisted of the Lavash Bagel, Israeli Salad, Levantine "Caesar," Agu's Tunisian Cigar, Crispy Zataar Potato and Labneh Cheesecake.  Very stylish decor and very attentive service on a Saturday night.  We ate at 5:30 so the noise level was still tolerable when we left, but the restaurant was packed and I can see why some people complain that it gets too noisy later in the evening.  Just go early and I believe you'll have a very positive experience.
Brunch was good but not amazing. Staff did not appreciate children.
Great dinner. So delicious.   A special upper west side spot.

We had a wonderful meal and asked the waiter to wrap up some leftovers to take home…(duck & steak tartare).  The bus boy mistakenly threw it away. The manager apologized and gave us two freshly prepared entrees to take home. Wow - what a birthday gift!!!  Love Le Monde❤️
Always great food and amazing service. Brunch or dinner, add this to your roster
Delicious food! The patio seating is lovely on a nice day. Burger is good for the price, and the lamb dish is *excellent*
It's a great spot with lots of delicious brunch options and a fantastic staff! The ambiance is very charming too, and more of a classic New York restaurant.
Very efficient service in Easter Sunday, nice European atmosphere.
It's the only brunch place that can accommodate 11 people around Columbia for a weekend brunch.  It has a room in the back.
Overall good experience and we had a very good waiter but the amount of grilled tuna in each of the nicoise salads was miniscule.
Nice food and atmosphere. Good service. Worth a visit.
Loud music blasting everywhere not conducive to conversation, not compatible with a bistro vibe.
Great food, though a bit pricy for brunch. Still managed to spend $100 on a relatively sparse meal. Great ambiance tho.
Food was mushy, hamburger bun stale. Ravioli sauce tasted old and reheated.
Very nice experience and we plan to return in the near future.

Duck, Charcuterie plate, salad, steak frites (great frites) tarts Tatin, Pinot Grigio, Bordeaux wine were quite good.
SPecial lamb shank was a bit under seasoned. Crème Brûlée had very thin crust on one side (too “burnt” on other), was too cold, like it had been stored tilted in a fridge.
The staff were incredibly accommodating and attentive and the food and drinks were wonderful.

Quite a busy place, which is fine. But the food wasn’t as good as one would expect. I ordered the French toast, and it was very basic, perhaps a little dry, not soaked long enough. The eggs were just okay. Bacon was “wet.” Drinks were a little better. I would give this place a 5.6/10. Boucherie is better. Any of them; Union square or West Village.

We came for Brunch. We had the pancakes and the French Toast with an order of bacon. Everything, even the coffee, was really good. In order of goodness, pancakes, French Toast and bacon. Though comparing bacon with French Toast is like comparing apples and oranges. I give the bacon a slight edge because it's BACON!
The croque monsieur was excellent, and my lunch companion said her shrimp salad was very tasty.  Tables are well-spaced for quiet conversation, and this has the feel of a French cafe.
Le Monde has great food and friendly & accommodating staff - we had a great time!
One of my favorites in the Morningside Hts/Columbia neighborhood.  Reliably excellent, and great for Sunday brunch.
Food seemed very expensive.
Always top notch!  Never had a bad meal or experience here. The woman manager is so nice and the French Onion soup is the best ever!!

What a truly lovely Valentine’s dinner. My fiancé and I made a last minute reservation and I am so glad we found this place. The food was paced out well for such a heavy rush. Any place on the upper West Side that is busy is Wonderful. Jenny our server was an absolute dream and very courteous. We sat next to some bitter Betty’s who were complaining just to complain. The GM who touched our table was professional and kind and his outfit was a Ten Henny! He even touched the complaining table with patience and understanding and was a prime example of customer service and so was Jenny!
My fiancé and I are both in the industry and this was such a joy to find a place in the city where we cannot wait to dine for many years to come. The food was marvelous! Happy V-day to all of the staff at Le Monde. je vous aime tous! Xoxoxox- Mitch and Kevin(a)

This experience was really poor. Way over priced, terrible service, and our meals tasted really off. The steak was undercooked and my fish was in a soup of butter. Couldn’t even finish it even though it was a $50 entree.
Very good food but slow service because of the holiday but worth waiting for

I went with my wife on Valentine’s Day. The restaurant packed in with so many people, it was like we were all sitting on top of each other. I have never seen anything quite like it. The tables were so close together, the servers were having a very hard time even bringing the food to the tables. The kitchen also “lost” our order, so we had to wait a very long time for the food to come out. The atmosphere was ruined by the restaurant’s greed in packing in that many people. 

All of that being said, the food was absolutely fantastic. Like spectacularly good. Every course was delicious, and some of the best food I have had in NYC. I gave this a four star rating because the food really was exceptional. I don’t know what the seating is like on a normal night, but if it was better, I would definitely go back just for the food. I would recommend this restaurant, but not on a special occasion like Valentine’s Day.
Last minute reservation for Valentine’s Day. Service was great, food was excellent, nice presentation, taste excellent. Definitely will come back!
Very nice, will go back again
It is a delightful environment every time.  Love the food and the relaxed nature of the place.  AND my favorite veggie burger!

La festival d’amour was disappointing. There was a small rose on the table, but that was it. No live music, but then the Super Bowl was on, which was good.
Our steak and lamb chops were not as good as usual. As we were eating our entrees we were told that the bar and kitchen were closing at nine. This was surprising as our reservation  was for 8:00.
The appetizers were good and the service was good. Just not very festive.
Excellent food in a lovely French bistro setting.
My guest and I thoroughly enjoyed the Restaurant Week lunch at Le Monde - top notch!

Busy Saturday night (which we were glad to see, as this was one of the few restaurants that stayed open during the shutdown.).  Although my husband’s steak was cooked perfectly, my duck duo was first undercooked (very rare, as opposed to med rare) and when sent back they over cooked it to the point where it was inedible. (I made it into a duck hash for breakfast.).  The fat was not rendered either.  Lobster cake app was good, but I feel lacked some lobster.
Service was exemplary and they comp’d me the duck after I gently complained.  Fair value on half bottles of wine.
Excellent meal.  Beet salad was great as was the hangar steak.  Chocolate mouse was also delicious. Will definitely return .

I'll never be there again.  They list a 6 day Restaurant Week menu. We went today on Sunday and they said "no it's only Monday to Friday". I showed the manager where they listed for Sunday dinner. They did nothing for us. I asked them to prepare any 3 courses. They could have treated us to a drink or a coffee. Nothing. And the food was blah. Maybe I would have enjoyed it more if there was customer service. And the restaurant was 90% empty.
Great restaurant week menu! Everything was delicious! Must try: truffle flatbread, hanger steak, and chocolate mousse!
Very nicely set up quiet and private outdoor dining. Very attentive staff. Great food with nice portions.

Le Monde is a reliable staple in the Columbia University environs, and thankfully it takes reservations!  I always go for the same item, Croque Monsieur, which isn't difficult, because the menu has remain unchanged for a long time.

We love Le Monde.  My wife and I frequently take our son and daughter here.  All the food is amazing and we particularly love the French Onion soup.  It is perfect every time.  Great atmosphere, food, staff and overall management.  Top notch.

A great, welcoming, neighborhood place.  I had the endive salad and mushroom risotto with a glasss of sauvignon blanc.  My friend had the escargot, salmon, side of french fries.  We both splurged on dessert--chocolate mousse!
That was the best steak I’ve ever tried. The place was not crowded, but I was there around 6:00pm. The atmosphere is awesome.

The hosts were a bit lost with our reservation at the entrance. Then, the first server was not that receptive. But our waiter was nice. The food was okay. Some of the dishes were already getting cold. The price was high for the quality we got. Our other Eataly experiences were better.

We had appetizers, but got it with the regular food. Not what we wanted and resulted in our main course getting cold. The food was totally overpriced for the size and taste. Very unfortunate, since we were very much looking forward to it.
Terrible Terrible ! Ugh Bone in Branzini , extremely small portions , slow service

Food was good with a nice menu selection. Rooftop was pretty on a nice spring evening. We came to dine on a Saturday night, ordering drinks and appetizers before dinner. They came out immediately and then they brought our entrees as we were enjoying our appetizers. That is a real turnoff! We weren’t trying to rush out to get someplace, yet they had us served and walking out in less than an hour. The waiter never checked back with our table once the appetizers arrived and he never stopped by to even acknowledge that our entrees came out too quickly. What started out as a pleasant experience just felt rushed and disappointing in the end. I won’t rush back to Serra.
Not fresh pasta, small portions and absolutely not Italian.
The music was very loud and we had to shout at each other at dinner and we weren’t even that close to the bar/speakers.
Went there for ambience.The decor was in transition so it was lacking a little. Overall pretty cool vibe. Service was SLOW & we had an early reservation.

The place looks very different compared with the public photos, very difficult to reach the waiter, the meat quality was not good, it had no flavor, too much noise…the tables were too close and very difficult to talk to my wife.

Worst service ever. I picked this place because of all the cute floral seasonal decor. There was nothing. Maybe they were switching over for spring. Waiter kept abandoning us. Took ages to get a drink. Food was meh. Very noisy. Would not go back.
I met two former colleagues that I hadn’t seen since before COVID. This restaurant is one of my favorites. Food is always delicious and not pretentious. The ambiance is great.
This place called for “Italian culinary” Does NOT have Pizza or any red source on the menu. I have never seen it before. I will never come back and I don't recommend.
Food and service were great. Great ambience however only few window tables with city view

Superb! Ambience was the draw for our choice of family Easter lunch.
Dappled sunlight, illuminating the heavenly garden decor was the perfect backdrop for our decadent meal. 
Our server was fantastic and we loved our food. 
Already cult Eataly fans- we are I mpressed on every level. We will be back!

The location is wonderful particularly at this time of the year and the vibe is nice. The food wasn't the best (cured meat on the charcuterie wasn't the freshest and campanelle pasta was way overcooked), better going for a drink.

Our waitress and waiter were great
 the staff however at the hostess desk were very rude especially the staff girl who I approached when I told her I had received a text that my table was ready she said is your party all here (1 other person) who sat down on the sofa waiting for me at the hostess desk I told the hostess yes she is here and she  said well where is she I said right there on the sofa note no one else was around and then another staff member came up behind me with a huge cart full of items he never said excuse me to let me know he was there and then the rude hostess said he needs to get past you 
sorry I don’t have eyes in the back of my head and NY has no manners like excuse me or I am sorry for running into you 🙄 I have been here 2 other times with friends and family will never come again due to rude hostess not sure who raised this little rude girl but someone needs to teach her some manners !!

The restaurant was very busy and very loud with a DJ it was almost too loud to talk. The service was okay but again with the busy tables we didn’t see our server that often. The food was good and fresh but not outstanding. We said we would go back but not for a special occasion.
The place is stunning , a roof top with amazing decor, the food was good and the service amazing
Food is average. I have been to many of the Eataly restaurants on ground level. Very disappointed.
We had a an amazing dinner!  Amazing atmosphere and wonderful servers!  Food was delicious!
It was a nice place to share with family and friends
As always the good and drink was incredible. The ambience is amazing and our waiter Dannie was spectacular
The service and food was excellent, can’t beat the ambiance!
Beautiful setting!  Food and service were great.  It is pricey, but for something different it’s worth it.  Be sure to make a reservation
Amazing ambiance and incredible food! The rooftop is so pretty and inside Eataly

World class.  We stopped here before visiting the Harry Potter store and had an amazing lunch.  Drinks were on-point.  They have proper mixologists and the finest ingredients.  Try the season cocktails - you won’t be disappointed.  My wife is a fan of wine and our server was very knowledgeable and helped her find the right selection.  Food was fresh and properly prepared.  10/10 we will be back again.
Food was good at times too salty. Nice DJ but too noisy for a restaurant. Couldn't even understand my friends.

Pretty place, good food, insanely loud. Like eating in a disco where you have to strain to hear your companion and talk above the din. Why????

Why must restaurants ruin the experience with deafening music?  I don’t get it.

Food was absolutely spectacular. Both my friend and I cleared off every last bit of food on the plate! Ambience was lovely - the floral pieces hanging from the ceiling created a wonderful atmosphere; and the lights they turned on once it got darker was an extra little touch. Near the end of the meal (closer to 8pm) it did start getting a bit louder so had to raise my voice more to speak, but nothing unmanageable or above the ordinary expectations of a NYC restaurant at night. Will 10/10 be returning!
Food was great. Service was spotty but not bad. I’ll definitely go again!
Great food, lovely ambiance. Second time here. Big fan.
both celebrating our March birthday 🥳. i haven’t seen the space during daytime. it was gorgeous. so nice to be able to reserve tables now
We had a great time the waiter’s were nice so was the hostess

Fabulous birthday lunch!
Everything about it was fabulous!
Somewhat hidden away Oasis in NYC . . . feels like San Diego . . . beautiful space and light . . . great menu choices . . . excellent service . . . I will be a regular for sure

Food and service was amazing. Decor is cute!
Definitely recommend!
The bread and butter service is terrific, and the whole fish was cooked perfectly. Great drinks and wine selection too.
Delicious food and nice atmosphere. Enjoyed the appetizers and entrees. Casual setting.

My chicken came out undercooked.  The waiter took it away, apologized, brought back a new dish, and didn’t charge me for the dish.  I thought that was great service.  Overall it took too long though.  We were there over an hour before our food hit the table.

Good vibe!
The staff was very friendly.
Cocktails are the bar are really good and the food was overall tasty.
I love spending time at Serra. The food is outstanding and the place, on a sunny day, is beautiful.

Great location,  very nice decor  inside. Outside dining is very nice - tables are very small & chairs are uncomfortable out there.  Mussels & Lobster bisque soup was delicious we Also had crab cakes but tasted very fishy. Had lobster rolls for dinner - beside the crabcakes everything else was great.
Excellent Lobster Rolls--very fresh and tasty and delish fries. Service is always efficient and friendly. And there's the spectacular view of NYC as an added bonus.
Food is not that at all  good and it is over price

Has fabulous views of the water and skyline.  It is sort of hidden inside by a strip mall so you wouldn’t think there is a restaurant in there.  
Good food and ambiance. Has a main dining area with 2 bars and an outside seating area.  Surprisingly quiet the night we went but I would recommend checking this place out.

Had lunch on a Thursday afternoon date. The whole Branzino and Lobster roll entrees were both excellent and filling. The lobster bisque soup was creamy with chunks of lobster, green onions and almond slices was outstanding. We had a new server who was being trained so ordering and asking questions was a little delayed but she responded quickly and was not afraid to ask her manager for help. We finished with the cheesecake and warm apple tart again both were outstanding. Really enjoyed so will repeat again in near future and highly recommend to others.

The service and ambiance are great. But the food and drinks were not so great. Everything we ordered lacked seasoning, flavor and taste (even the drinks were bad).
I was celebrating my birthday with friends and we all ordered different items from the menu. The server warned us about the “fried fisherman’s platter”, but I wish she could’ve told us not to waste our time and money with ordering anything.
However we took our chances and ordered the following items: mussels (in white sauce) it at least had garlic which gave it hint of taste, fried calamari- which didn’t even have the basic salt and pepper seasoning, branzino -supposed to be the best fish on the menu- LIES!! It was grilled with the head on and that’s it. There was no love or effort placed into cooking the food. The broccoli was under cooked and very hard to chew. The lobster roll was too chewy, the only good part was the brioche bun.
I normally don’t write these types of reviews but I had to warn the others. Eat at your own risk!

Great atmosphere and elegant restaurant along with plenty of seating.
Unfortunately the menu is scaled down to almost as if it was a lunch menu .
Food taste from all four of my party was not great.
Hardly any patrons there- kind of made me suspect that the place is in trouble.
Shame- otherwise its a gorgeous place.
Our server was great but the food was horrible and tasteless.  The ambiance and décor perfect but the food isn’t worth the trip..

Celebrating Valentine’s Day. It was a very nice experience however, when making the reservation they should have specified that there were only offering a pre-fixe menu. I was a little disappointed with that but everything was delicious none the less.

Honestly, it was the worst dining experience I have ever had. Our waitress didn't know anything, my wife asked her for her recommendation of a sweet, white wine and she offered her a Pinot Noir... the food took forever to get to us and when it did, my steak was over cooked and the rest of the plate was cold. My wife's steak was completely undercooked. We spoke to the manager, who just walked up and put his arms on another chair and didn't even introduce himself. He kept saying how we'll "work something out" and how he'd get our dessert to us which never came after almost 15 minutes of waiting for a cold dessert.

Greek salad and lobster bisque soup were excellent. Main courses (skirt steak and salmon) were great as well. Did not know there was a fixed menu for Valentine’s Day. It was not advertised anywhere. The fixed pricing for app, main course and shared dessert was not worth the $80/person.

Over rated/pricey for Valentine's Day,for food that was just mediocre, the hostess was bringing us drinks, and food, there were waiters bringing food to multiple wrong tables throughout the night, I understand it was Valentine's Day but we watched 4 couples sit down then after 30 minutes of not being served, stand up and just leave. I'm sure it was short staffed but it was a fixed menu and staff was getting 20% tip anyway from all parties that night so that's why service wasn't great. Not a great look overall.

Located on a pier in the Hudson River great view of the river and NYC.
The food and service were just OK.

Came here during restaurant week — I think the venue and location is very nice and nicely decorated. However, the food felt ordinary, lackluster, and average, unlike the restaurant itself. The service/server was friendly which I appreciated.

Lobster Roll Love!!! Always fresh and delicious.
Service excellent and, of course, there is the spectacular view of nyc skyline.

The view is magnificent! The entire restaurant has floor to ceiling windows makes it so dramatic to see all of the scenery of nyc skyline.

Cocktail was so so so goooood! Had the infuse jalapeños Diablo.

Food was so good too! I had the seafood tower. Also had the linguini with clam sauce  and calamari. Omg the calamari is to die for. So delicious!

The restaurant is huge!!! Great customer service!! Definitely recommend! The view alone is worth it.

Service was a little slow, but with everyone being short handed I didn't want to go too low on the rating.  Everything else was great and for a Saturday night it was pretty quiet.  Great food and great views!
Good was very tasty,  service was a bit slow.   Beautiful views of the New York skyline,  friendly staff,  easy parking.
Beautiful restaurant.
Great service. Food was excellent. Fixed menu for Hudson Restaurant week was adequate to provide exposure to new customers. Parking very easy and accessible.
Good food and view
Food was great (Mahi Mahi amazing) the restaurant was in a nice area overlooking NYC.
They really need help with the food !
The restaurant had a set menu and did not advertise ahead of time. We were rushed and received our main dish  before our appetizers arrived, we had to bring home. Disorganized! Not worth the $$$
The food was not great and took forever to come. The main reason I will not be returning is because the chairs are so uncomfortable and stab you in the back.

Everything about this restaurant was terrific.  Situated on the Hudson River with a beautiful view of NYC it offers a comfortable, relaxed setting with excellent food at a reasonable price.  We had a 5:30 reservation so it was not too crowded and there is ample space between tables, so our concern about contacting COVID was eased.

Food was great - service was very good ! We arrived a but late and were accommodating. The sushi bar stayed open for to make us some rolls.  They did not rush us out after they closed.  Very Recommended.
Christmas Eve
Best place for a delicious lobster roll—fresh and tasty. And great fries. Staff is always friendly and courteous. The view  is spectacular!
The food was good but the service was mediocre at best.  Also, there was a party going on and it was very, very loud.
The Yacht Club was a wonderful restaurant to celebrate a special birthday. The food, service, and views were wonderful.

Excellent customer service, but the food wasn't seasoned well. After asking for salt and pepper, still not tasty. Took the rest home, possibly gonna toss. I miss it being Mitchell's.  Plus they mixed up our tabs as well. Nope, not a winner.  Barely had regular beverages, asked for lemonade, had to settle for iced teas, sweetened. Starving after 3 hrs. People fishing...nah.

Amaazing food! The whole experience from start to finish is great .waitress was so friendly and kind. The food can’t get better and the prices are fair for the portion size. A great spot to get great food. Will definitely be coming back

What a disappointment! Save your money.  Just because it’s located by water doesn’t mean it’s good!!! Our waitress was kind and the view of the city was great if you walked outside but the rest wasn’t worth it.  It took over an hour to get our meal. Don’t order steak at a fish restaurant. The steak came out the wrong temp and had zero flavor. The food was just average.  Almost forgot to mention a soda is $4. No refills.  Loved paying $8 for 2 drinks per kid x3. And the glasses were maybe 8oz with ice. It was so incredibly loud in there, the table behind us couldn’t speak at a normal level, all they did was shout. I hate when food is auctioned off by the runners.  Just not what I expected for a 50 min drive!  Will probably never return.
Great views of the city. Foods and drinks were awesome
You should offer vegan options, to be inclusive of diners with preferences.

Food not bad they recently upped the price in a matter of the past few months. Decor used to be better in its previous incarnation. All waitstaff and maître d I encountered tonight was great friendly and helpful. The lady manager was excellent too. Can’t say the same to their male presumably manager or perhaps owner. Seemingly socializing with majority of the patrons throughout the evening and yet to say a single word or even a polite nod to me. Being an Asian guy I didn’t feel welcomed by this person. Quite abhorrent for such disgusting behavior maybe he’d like to express his dissatisfaction of my presence directly to me.

I don’t know what happened to this place, it has such potential. The food was very average as was the service.  The fish and chips were not crispy and my husband never got things he asked for.  It’s a shame

I went for my ladies birthday and they forgot her. I called ahead spelled her name out for her birthday surprise. She wanted desert and they said the kitchen was closed! My reservation was at 9…. Never got any birthday surprise, couldn’t even order desert. Flawed system in my opinion.
Everything was great but the server was especially nice.

name: HAVEN Riverfront Restaurant and Bar
addressComponentsLongName: New York / Tri-State AreaNew Jersey - North

reviews.reviewsText: We went out for our anniversary dinner, ambience was very nice, service was very welcoming. We started off with the Mango Rita cocktail, very good and sweet. Then we got the truffle mac n' cheese, however we couldn't taste the truffle at all, wouldn't recommend it. For mains we got the "Bangkok" pan-seared duck and the pan-seared lamb shank. Duck was plated beautifully and very flavorful. The lambhowever, didn't taste the best as it was bland, the combo of chick peas and mash potatoes wasn't it. I brought it up to the manager and he delightfully took out the lamb out of my receipt and let me choose something else. He also provided a small,nice anniversary dessert. Would recommend going back for the excellent ambience, service, and the view.

This place was absolutely phenomenal. The servers were so attentive and professional. There was never a moment were there wasn’t a server visible for any need we may have had. That was huge thing for me. 

The food was beyond my expectations. From the presentation to the taste. We drove 3 hours away to enjoy the day in Jersey and we definitely will be back here! Beyond a 5 star experience and completely exceeded our expectations.
Place was 100% perfect, food, ambience, price range.
Food and drinks were amazing! Highly recommended !
Excellent service, great views and food! Luis was the best!

The appetizer was delicious (mini crab cakes) however the bread didn't look appeasing and the main course is disgusting. To much going on in one plate,  the garlic bread was burnt and again not appeasing.

Overall I loved the experience. From beginning to end they were very attentive. I have to admit I wasn’t a big fan of my brunch item but I should have read it better. My eggs were a little too watery than what I’m used t. Aside from that the lychee martini, bellini and mimosa were great. I would go back again.
Cold red wine
Amazing service and fantastic food we got a lovely view of Manhattan we will definitely be coming back thank you again

Wonderful experience. Can’t wait to visit again!!
Good food, service and drinks.   The staff was pleasant. The valet parking was also a plus.
Everyones dinner was delicious alittle pricey but would definitely recommend for special occasions.

The first thing when I arrived at the restaurant the host was rude and told me I just going to need that table by 9 pm my reservation was for 7 pm so I had to change the table 2 times cause then someone cancel and she put us in another table which it was nice. but the food was not good for the value, I will go for drinks again but not for dinner the menu is very short not too many options.

The lunch menu was small, but nicely varied. My buratta, however, was drowned in a heavy vinegar dressing, which to my taste was inappropriate for the ingredients, which go much better with an excellent olive oil and light lemon or sparing vinegar dressing. The service was excellent and the view was spectacular, but on both occasions I was there, the volume of the music went erratically up and down, which made conversation a bit difficult.
Great food, lovely view, efficient and pleasant service

My boyfriend and I went here for brunch around 11:45 on a Sunday I got the American breakfast and he got the French toast. The food came out fast and our waiter was attentive. The food was okay… nothing special but the dessert we ordered was great! I got a mix of different sorbets and my bf got the warm apple churro. The restaurant knew it was my birthday and they gave me a candle but didn’t sing the song! I have been to the restaurant multiple times and believe their food is better at dinner.

We had a great time!  My girlfriend has both dairy & gluten allegories. I spoke with Greg ahead of time and he went over the menu with the chef. The outcome exceeded our expectations!

We will definitely be back once the weather warms up to experience the patio dining overlooking the NYC skyline.

Nice view
Fatastic foods
Cool vibe
Resonable price
Great serve
excellent and friendly service, order all the appetizers and the Colorado braised short ribs, very nice views of the skyline too!

This place location is great. Amazing views.
Service was ok, waitstuff was nice, but long time to get waitress attention. Restaurant was empty.
Very clean, looks beautiful.
Appetizers and salads were good, main dishes- really subpar. We choose 3 main fish courses. How did they manage to ruin Sea bass and branzino? Very unusual. Or may be I am spoiled by great Manhattan restaurants😄
And bill was around 350$ for 3. 
Parking near by- it was a plus.
Nice outside terrace- summer time Will be nice to have glass of wine there.
Birthday gathering

The food was more than exceptional on top of the beautiful view…the special occasion was more than appreciated…this place was referred to a few friends already…we will be going back, especially when the weather gets better.

Dinner and dessert was sensational. 
Excellent service too!!
I had a wonderful business luncheon at Haven.  I highly recommend this restaurant- and the view is incredible!
Celebrated my mother inlaw birthday and it was amazing. The view was beautiful and the food was great. The crab cake and linguine pasta is is top-notch. My mom had the salmon and it was well done.

Love the ambience of this restaurant
Food and service was outstanding
Very clean, romantic setting and outstanding customer service.
It was our first time there and had a great meal, great view and great service.
Great drinks , delicious food , great vibe with beautiful views of NYC.
It was a delightful experience.
Our go to restaurant for anniversaries or intimate celebrations. Service is always on point from the moment you enter the restaurant. Food is always tasty and so are the drinks.
My 2nd time dining here and my boyfriends 1st. It was another amazing experience. Food, drinks and service were excellent!  The view was the icing on the evening. We will absolutely be back.
We had a good time

One of my favorite restaurants in the world! Food, service, ambiance, 10 PLUS! And the NYC view by the river! Take a beautiful walk after your meal and enjoy. Also: accessible! A good friend in our party today was in a wheelchair and o can't begin to tell you how very kind all the staff and management were. This place is not only exceptional but has HEART! Thank you!
Service was a little scattered. Food and drink were excellent.
We had an out of town relative visiting and it was the perfect spot to enjoy a delicious meal and watch the NY city lights begin to twinkle at sunset!
Excellent and well exceeded my expectations. Will absolutely go again.

We went on a Tuesday night, so it was not packed. With the exception of a crying toddler, it was quiet enough for dinner conversation. Beautiful view at night. All our food was excellent, especially the fresh raw oysters and the Crispy Branzino. Our birthday guest was surprisingly comped with a dessert, no special requests made, just a note on OpenTable. Cocktails also delicious. Will definitely go back.
Service was great, food was outstanding. And view was was amazing

The brunch was delicious!  South African lobster eggs Benedict was outstanding.  We had a great waitress and the view is beautiful.  It was quite loud in the restaurant, but it did not take away from the meal.  I would definitely recommend Haven.
Lovely experience. Will be back again. Thanks for a great experience!
Night to remember, one of the BEST RESTAURANT by far. I enjoyed everything from the welcoming at the door, the beautiful place, outstanding service,  fresh & delicious food

The quality of the food was superb. The appetizer buffet was delicious, especially some of the roasted vegetables. Very tasty zucchini and eggplant. The meat… the raison d’être  of our visit… was flavourful, tender and plenty. The place beautiful. A bit cavernous and reminiscent of a cruise ship restaurant. It was loud. But we did ok to talk. What struck me was the attentive service displayed by ALL the staff. Nobody walked by our table without looking over to see if we needed anything. They didn’t always speak or bother us but you could tell they were attentive and quietly without asking a fresh plate would arrive, more water. It really felt like they worked as a team.
Exceptional service, outstanding meats. Everything was perfect!
Terrible server. Priscilla. Just completely absent.
All my friends and I had an amazing time. The food, service, and whole experience was something we will try again.

Great place for Brazilian food with lots of meats! Services are superior!

Will go again soon!
When we are craving meat we reserve a table at Fogo de Chao. A great concept,  top quality,  great atmosphere, and an excellent value for the whole experience.  Definitely recommend for any occasion.
Good food amazing service, delicious meats, good music overall great experience
Reply good experience overall. We ordered the Fogo de chão experience and até a lot !!
Beyond! Staff was outstanding and friendly! Highly recommend!
Perfect date night and an amazing authentic experience!

We enjoy Fogo de Chao and wanted to try the one in NYC for 2 birthday celebrations.  The table was fine and the service is nice. But, there were maybe not enough servers going around with the meats as we only had maybe 4 kinds come around.  We think there were too many guests for them to accommodate, so we would prefer another Brazilian place we went to last year in NYC.  We got to try all the different meats and the birthday guests received a cake as well.  They did not honor our request for a more private table and did not also acknowledge the birthdays.  Overall, the food is still good, but the level of care to customers is lacking.

Salad bar was a mess dirty and cluttered. Service was diner like not fine dining. Meats were full of gristle. Was expecting the dining experience that we are used to from the Philadelphia restaurant. It did not compare at all.

The food was okay, both the salad bar and the meats that kept coming around.  However, there was inconsistency in the way the meats were cooked.  Some were very dry and others were succulent.  The price should be less based on the quality. 
 The drinks were great. The service was awesome.  I would return for the service alone!

Meat lovers paradise. Strongly recommend the place if you like different cuts of meat. I got some roast, lamb chops, chicken and steaks. The salad is a great balance. They had a good Chilean wine recommendation which worked out very well with the meat. I would go back for sure.
Mala la comida y caro  no regreso a este restaurant
Was amazing really enjoyed it wonderful food & experience
Very friendly, professional staff. Well prepared and professionally presented food. Great Sunday brunch
Friendly servers and food was excellent as always.
Met expectations as always! Food was tasty and the meat was being served quickly with good variety.
The food and service are consistently excellent. I love Fogo for a special occasion.
The food and meats are AMAZING. I have been to LA and Miami but this one is a totally different experience. The meat is INCREDIBLE, and im a very picky eater
We had a very good business lunch with great food, good service, and pretty quite place, convenient for business discussions.
Great service excellent food. If they don't bring the filet ask for it.

I went to celebrate my husband’s birthday - and if it wasn’t for the food, we would of left. The table next to us argued the entire time. They were screaming at each other very loudly, extremely disruptive and disrespectful to those around them. It went to the extent of using foul language and threatened to get physical with each other. The manager went over several times to tell them to keep it down. Never returning again…. Ruined our dinner honestly. It was awful having to endure them screaming at each other for more than an hour. The waiters/manger were nice but for all the money we paid for our dinner we could of done without the spectacle next to us. Very ill mannered crowd.
