Great variety of flavorful cuts of meat. There was a time where I felt each cut tasted similar and was overly salted. I’m glad this time didn’t feel that way and we enjoyed most of the cuts. I do wish there were a couple more interesting sauces than the steak sauce and BBQ sauce however. Drinks were enjoyed and service was incredibly friendly and attentive. I do think the upsell attempts were a bit gimmicky and took away from the experience however.

This is a friendly and family-oriented rodizio-styled steakhouse. The wait and servers staff are actively engaged in ensuring a memorable experience within everyone’s budget. Reservations are a .must. The restaurant is located in a high tourist-traffic area.
Absolutely delicious and so very filling. It is a little pricey but the food was excellent. The papaya and cream desert was to die for.

Manager at host stand was rude. We had guest arrive prior to the main group. The manager told us we could go get our guests at the bar and then be seated. Typically the host or manager would simultaneously seat our party and send someone to get the other guests. This wasn’t a polite request from this gentleman, it was a rude “you go get your guests” - not representative of the Fogo brand. The rest of the staff were fantastic as usual.

The ambience, food and drinks are amazing. But the service is TERRIBLE, we waited 45 min after our reservation time, after insisting many times to the host. Once seated, no waiter approached to explain the buffet, had to ask 3 times for tap water, and chased the waiter for wine and other drinks. The last waiter that served the table was in a terrible mood almost throwing dishes and utensils at the table.
We waited 40 minutes for the table, instead it was perfect
Great salad buffet and generous beef servings. Amazing service!
One of my favorite places in nyc  I will go over and over again
I enjoyed  it . Service was great , waiter made sure we was good every second
Great love the food and waitresses was great always checking if everything was ok

I took my daughter here for the first time for her birthday and it didn’t disappoint. I had my reservations about a chain restaurant but the food was delicious and well prepared. The meat was all juicy, the market bar was fresh and the cheddar puffs were to die for! The service was amazing! Someone was always available to help you. The only downside I would say is the waiting to be seated was disappointing. We came 30 mins before our reservation and we were seated about 35 minutes after we came. A bunch of people that came on time for their reservation were seated late so my advice is come early!!! It was well worth the wait!!!

The food was quite good but they were busy and apparently understaffed as meat was extremely slow in being delivered to tables. We were left trying to flag down servers and were only able to obtain three items in the first half hour of our visit.
10 th anniversary of being in NY celebrating the occasion
This place is great, a bit crowded, no waiting, so mu ccg food that you need to pace yourself. Meat is so tender, cocktail drinks is strong. Would definitely go back here again
Great food and variety! Love the service

After Broadway dinner.  Staff seemed tired and disinterested.  Poor service.  Everything arrived at once.  We were rushed out as they wanted to close…yet why take reservations that late?  Horrible experience - should have put our money towards a better place.

Food was excellent, but that was about it. Had a 545 reservation and was seated almost 30 minutes after our reservation time. Could overlook that (it was a Saturday night, so I get it), but we were rushed through our meal; we asked if we could hold the entrees so we could finish the appetizers and the server said he did the best he could to hold them, but that they “needed to turn the table”. I’m sorry, what? That’s like saying the quiet part out loud. We were a party of 11, and we’re in and out in just over an hour. It was by no means a relaxing experience, we felt rushed, and probably won’t return or recommend.
Food and service as wonderful as ever! Always a treat!

My family and I had a good time, food wasn’t bad but not what I expected. Maybe because it was a busy Saturday afternoon not sure but I would definitely give it a second shot.
Also, everytime the back door was opened there was a horrible smell, we assumed it was from the garbage but that smell shouldn’t have come in the way it did. So our dinner ended sooner than we would have liked.
Our servers were amazing!!!
Overall an average experience! Will not go there again. It was too loud and noisy.

It was great!!   Waiter was awesome!!   Food Fabulous!!
Will definitely return again!!
Thank you!
I had made the reservation 2 months in advance and was disappointed our table was right next to the waiters’ station all the way in the back of the restaurant next to the kitchen.
Wonderful post-theater meal. Nicole was wonderful and made our experience top notch!
We had the best time. The staff was accommodating and very nice! And the food was delicious. Plates are large and amazing for large groups.

Janice was amazing! It was our first time there, and she explained everything to us perfectly, even the portion sizes. The staff was exceptionally patient with my son who was all over the place for his 3rd birthday. Prices are fair, considering the large portion sizes. We had reservations and they took us immediately. My only suggestion would be bring your own toddler friendly cups, as they only offer glass cups. We will be back. Thank you Janice and team!
Visiting family in NY

Sisters bday. Carmines never disappoints.
Food is delish!!!
Delicious food. Service was impeccable. Anthony our service was amazing. Sous chef Anthony came out multiple times to check on us and dietary restrictions. The best!
Excellent service and food. More than we expected. Thanks!
Good food, very welcoming, great service- just a tad loud

I took my daughter for her 31st birthday and for the first time, was disappointed. 

I asked for water and was charged for bottled water, rather than given tap water and when I asked for tap water, wasn’t given it. 

The lasagna was cold. 

Overall, not the experience I’ve come to expect.
Would definitely go again, food was good atmosphere was good
My mother felt sick and the bus boy had my brother to come out of the tqble to make room for other people to seat. Outrageous. Never gonna come back in this place.
In town to celebrate my daughter’s 16th birthday. This was the perfect place for dinner after Bad Cinderella.
Food was not tasty. Service was bad. We told our hostess that we don’t like the dish. At least she had to offer to change the meal but it didn’t happen. We paid and left unsatisfied.

We were lucky to get a last minute reservation during our spring break. The food comes out rather quickly which made it feel a little rushed. Overall it was a delicious meal, very large portions, and friendly staff. We would definitely eat there again!!
Great food . Classic New York spot . Would definitely come back
Great service for pre theatre dining, but we couldn’t cut through our veal scaloppini. Manager was kind to remove it from our bill.
We ended up setting at the bar. Junior was our bartender and he was amazing.

I had heard of Carmine's for years, but this was my first (and last) trip. In the reservation notes I said that this dinner was for my friend's 90th birthday. They paid zero attention. There are few appetizer choices, and each is huge (no complaints about portion size), so we chose the stuffed artichoke. It was inedible. The stuffing was an uncooked mess and the artichoke was devoid of edible parts.  The veal marsaIa was okay, but nothing to write home about. The broccoli was pretty good. I  was embarrassed to have brought my friend to this restaurant for a special occasion. Never again.
The only challenge was a wobbly table. The ambiance, food, and service were all outstanding.
First time to Carmines.  So worth it. I just wish I had 4 stomachs. Everything was outstanding.

My brother and I take a trip once a month from Conn. and explore New York and end the day with a meal at Carmines…We have learned to make reservations since the place is always busy and sometimes we may have to wait a little bit but everyone is so friendly that we we have no issues at all.
Fantastic service and delicious GIANT family size portions. The Titanic dessert was the perfect ending.
Overall great experience. The table was kinda small, but that’s understandable.

Too large dishes, not so tasty.
Will be better to allow half size dishes to allow more dishes
Great atmosphere and sociable experience. Would highly recommend to anyone visiting.
Totally worth your time and money. Delicious food. We had the spaghetti with marinara sauce and a Caesar salad. Fabulous!
The environment is bright and friendly. The food was excellent. Staff were all attentive and kind.
Everything was great except not a fan of being herded into the crowded bar area to wait an additional 20 minutes for a table.

The place was packed, but somehow we only waited two minutes for a reservation, and it was perfection. The service was fast, and we never felt rushed. Karmine’s is always a hit in our hearts, and we will always come back.
Great city experience. There’s a happy buzz of conversation and great food
Wonderful experience all around - as always!  Good was amazing.

The appetizers were delicious especially the mozzarella with red peppers and the calamari. The pasta was prepared well with the sauce a delicate balance of garlic and seasonings. The drinks were cold and refreshing and made perfectly. Will definitely be retuning.
Overall it was a good experience.    Eventhough we had reservations we had to wait approximately 15 minutes for a table.

name: STK - NYC - Midtown
addressComponentsLongName: 1114 Avenue of the Americas,  New York, NY 10036

reviews.reviewsText:
The appetizers too 45 minutes to arrive.
The service was underwhelming. I asked the manager if my waiter needs help because we haven’t seen him. Apparently she did nothing, just asked him are you good and moved on.
The steak was over cooked, the 10oz was closer to a 6 oz.
Not going back to that location for dinner ever again.
Loud music. Subpar food. Over priced everything and horrible service

Overpriced steak house with good food but really disappointing service. Our table was not stable, needed to ask twice to please help. Sides for the kids (despite several friendly reminders) came after they finished their meals (kind of waste as we said once they were done we did not need them anymore). They were still on the check but removed after my comment that we did not have them. My wife and I waited over one hour on our food. Generally, the waiter needed being reminded of everything albeit being very friendly. The senior colleague/ manager (?) was great though and everybody is entitled to a bad day once in a while but if you sell steaks for around 100 USD this is more difficult to accept than in some diner.
The ribeye, which cost $81, was the worse ribeye I ever had. It looked like it was cut in half. Fortunately, the restaurant took the steak off my bill. I would never go to STK in NYC again.

Food was delicious. Was a bit disappointed by the service since I was celebrating a birthday and they didn't prepare anything, not even a small ice cream with a candle. They would only provide a sparkler if you ordered dessert separately. It felt obvious that they were trying to cheapen the overall feeling and service to cut costs here and there but it does hit the reputation in my opinion and is not a good business decision. I will definitely not be back to celebrate anything in the future.
The customer service was so awful it was nasty.  Will never send any of my executives back here again.
Wish it was better. Food was ok. Service was pleasant. Location was great.

I really enjoyed STK pre pandemic! I’ve been to both NYC locations since and each experience had its issues. My coworker and I were excited to have lunch there as the weather got warmer. Firstly, the glassware on our table was filthy. They moved our seat, unnecessary but we welcomed the offer. We ordered two of the same lunch menu items and upgraded to truffle fries. My coworker complained that the fries weren’t cooked. I didn’t share her sentiment until I bit into one of my own and found that the fry was in fact not cooked through. From then on it was hit or miss as to which fry was cooked through. A waiter (not our tables waiter) who I knew from another dining experience spoke with a manager for us. They offered a new order of fries. What came was fries that were scorching hot and practically burnt. I’ve had their truffle fries in the past… and they were cooked all the way through and not burnt. I was so displeased that I didn’t even finish my sandwich. Overall it wasn’t a pleasant lunch. I judged my brunch experience in meatpacking harshly thinking it was unique to that location. Apparently the lack of attention to detail and basic care in preparing food is across the board for their NYC locations.
Yum yum yum yum yum very good and good service. Good atmosphere and location. Mashed potatoes went hard

Tolle Steaks, tolle Drinks, sehr zuvorkommend und freundlich. Ein Steak war ein wenig über der bestellten Garstufe und wir haben auf Nachfrage darauf hingewiesen. Uns wurde sofort ein neues Steak angeboten. Wir haben dankend abgelehnt und daraufhin hat der Kellner uns auf dieses Steak 50% Nachlass gegeben. Einfach nur Wow!
Die Preise sind sogar für uns als Frankfurter hoch, aber alles in allem war es ein toller Abend und alles war super lecker. Absolut empfehlenswert, aber teuer!
Food was excellent. The music is great addition to the atmosphere, but too loud.
We had a great Easter Brunch. Our server was great.

Celebrated my moms bday and everything was perfect. Food was good drinks were good and service was awesome. Beware that if you bring a cake, they will charge $5 per person to cut the cake. We ended up just cutting the cake at home. Other than than that great experience and great ambiance. Definitely will come again
Amazing food, service and vibe.  We were glad to get a same day reservation as we will dine here again.  We visited with my 16 year old who thought it was cool.
You book at 8pm, you get the table later! This is not correct

Love this restaurant, the food is excellent and the atmosphere is great, its always nice to visit this restaurant.  Two points about our visit yesterday....the service provided by our waiter was not good - appetizers came with the entrees and he was happy to argue with us when we said that wasn't what we expected, he had to be reminded to bring extra drinks that we had ordered a couple of times, and generally we felt that he was trying to rush us through dinner, which for us was a 50th birthday celebration.  Not what you would expect from a quality steak house.  Secondly, the music was very loud, felt that it could have been a little quieter that early in the evening.

My drink order or DIET COKE was messed up 3 times. My allergies that I informed my waitress ahead of time about were not accommodated for. Food was brought out that I never order. The food was really bad except for the steak.
Beautiful restaurant, very unusual inside, the food was great, service friendly and attentive. Is a bit pricey though. The music gets quite loud late evenings as they have a DJ there.
Service was the worst ever it was like no one wanted to serve us food was under cooked or over cooked and they forgot a couple of side dishes

My steak was delicious but please expect to pay between $75-$100 per meal.   All menu items are a lacarte the price range listed here is wildly inaccurate.  Music is very loud here but we were seated in the back where it was tolerable.
This restaurant was great.  The food was delicious. Highly recommend this restaurant!

Ambiance is amazing but food, not so much. You’d think a “steakhouse” would get your steak order right. My husband and I ordered medium well. His came out medium and mine came out well and both were warm. Steak comes out HOT! Food also took a long time to be served. We experienced it but we won’t be back. Very disappointed, thanks.
Food was excellent. We thought the music was a bit too loud, but it didn’t spoil the night.
The music was very very loud. Lots of bass. Like a club. Could not talk and left with a headache. Not the atmosphere you would expect for such a nice restaurant. And on a Wednesday night.

The food and atmosphere were excellent. I was there for a very important business lunch. Towards the end of the meal, the server kept interrupting us to see if we needed anything to the point of annoyance.  As it approached 4pm (the lunch started at 2) the server again interrupted and when we said we were fine, he said that his shift was ending so could we close out the bill.  My colleague said I guess no desert, the server rudely said you want desert?  My colleague asked to see a menu and the server said, “what do you want”.  And when asked what do you have, rattled off some deserts.  Clearly he was just worried about his tip, very unprofessional.

The bread they bring out and the lobster mac and cheese were incredible. The sides, drinks and desserts were also very very good. We all thought the steaks were ok but not something amazing that we could not get from an average steak house. We thought in general it was overpriced for the level of food being served in the city.
The biggest issue we had was the loud music. Our group has no issue with loud music or a high energy atmosphere but when you can’t hear other guys at your table when they are shouting it is too much. We could not hear waitress and she could not hear us without shouting. Even then we had to repeat ourselves.
Overall, really good in some areas but miss the mark in other areas. They should not be missing the mark for the prices.
Amazing food and service - and buzzy vibrant ambiance. The only downside was it is very very expensive.
Dodd was good, service was ok and noise was loud . Not value for money too expensive for what you get . They want $20 for tator tots to go with over priced steak .

Extremely loud, but our Waiter was great, seating staff put us  at a terrible table so loud we couldn’t hear the waiter to order. Had to ask to be moved. They did accommodate which was nice and provided champagne and free drinks with dessert . Pretty good experience but if your going out strictly for the food i would choose a different steakhouse because of price.
Ok food, very loud ambiance and outrageous prices: $19 for six boiled asparagus is simply unacceptable! Will never go back!

A bit pricey but we’ll worth it. It was a great upscale experience paired with the beat waiter around. The service and food were top notch. The steak was surprisingly good after reheating the next day (leftovers).
The food was great n music was on point would love come back here again
Love there short ribs and steak was amazing . The music and ambiance was wonderful and servers such as Artomnd which was my server made my birthday extra special thank you stk. 👏❤️

6 of us came to New York to celebrate 2 birthdays. The location was good, the ambiance was nice, great DJ but everything else was terrible! This place is not organized at all! For the money you spend on the food/service - there’s NO way you should be treated like crap. We get there 15 mins before our reservations and ended up waiting 45 mins to an hour just to be seated. The waiter / servers / managers kept moving us around asking to stand in different places because we’re in the way. Some were more rude than others. When we sat down things were a little better. Food arrived pretty quickly. Our bill was about $700 so to be treated the way were was horrible. I will never go to a STK in New York ever again
Too loud. Steak came out cold and over cooked. Overrated wish I could get my money back

Waited over 20 min passed my reservation. Saw endless tables be seated before me. Instead of apologizing hostess told me it was because the size of my party. Reservation was made Tuesday and we were a party of 3. Rude and a waste of my time.

This is my first review I have ever written. Top to bottom was by far the worst experience I have ever had. I have worked in midtown and in the restaurant industry for 13 years. My dad is a bit handicapped and hard for him to walk and the amount of times we were cut off by staff and no allowed to walk first was surprising. Kahn seemed to be pretty clueless from the beginning, we always had empty glasses of wine, I ordered shellfish, apps and entrees and had a conversation where he asked if we wanted to do 3 courses I said shellfish and also can come together then entrees. When the food came everything came at the same time. Shellfish/apps/entrees, I told Kahn about it and his response was “oh yeah I see that” with in 30 minutes of being sat we were on entrees. We weren’t even given different share plates so we were eating the filet mignon and pork with the plates covered in cocktail sauce and oyster juice. To say I was livid is an understatement as I was there to celebrate a bday and I put that in the notes but when I ordered dessert so candle or any acknowledgement about that either. At the price point this restaurant is at they should 100% have higher standards. 5 adults 1 kid bill was over 1k so we we spending money and probably would’ve spent more of wine wasn’t on empty all dinner. I will never be back.
Horrible food and terrible service . Place was too loud with DJ playing hip hop..
First time, it was a great experience. Food was good atmosphere was great

This was the worst dining service experience we’ve ever had. We go to fine dining restaurants regularly and we needed a place to eat late night. STK had an opening and we took it.

The server was absolutely terrible. He never checked on us. He took so long to bring a check we ended up not ordering dessert. He was extremely rude. His name was Jay and honestly he should be fired. This was the worst service experience I’ve ever had in my life and that’s saying a lot considering how many reservations have been completed in the past year alone.

name: Tavern on the Green
addressComponentsLongName: 1 Tavern on the Green,  New York, NY 10023

reviews.reviewsText: A special place! Everything was perfect- food, atmosphere, and service from the lovely Ivy!
The atmosphere was great as always. We had the special Dash steak for two. I hate to say it, but for a medium, rare steak, it was rather on the dry side. Broccoli was terrific and so was the service.

Terrific service the moment we walked in. Accommodated our request for a different table out of the sun. Nice acknowledgment of a birthday in our group. Restaurant is still lovely and well maintained. Wonderful experience overall. Everything we’d hoped for.

Had a reservation and still had to wait 1hr to be seated. During the hour, we were told a table was ready 3 times but we were never seated. Finally had to get a manager involved and was quickly seated in 60 sec. Service was also a little slow but our waiter was very nice. Manager did rectify the situation with complimentary drinks. Beautiful ambiance outside and the band was great.
Server wasn’t attentive or happy to be serving us.
Fantastic spot for a meal in Central Park - highly recommended! Good fantastic, service excellent!
Beautiful setting, delicious food, fun cocktails! We will go back

Tavern on the Green made our 15th Anniversary so special. The food was beyond delicious.  Our server was amazing! Thank you for the truffles; extra special treat and decadent. Highly recommended. From Ottawa, 🇨🇦
The food was tasty and the service was excellent. We thoroughly enjoyed our experience at the Tavern and can’t wait to come back again.
It was warm last night so the outdoor tables were filled and we ate inside instead.  Very, very loud and hard to hear each other talk.  But the service was friendly and the food was delicious.
Braised ribs were warm at best. Wonderful server, we sat at the bar beforehand and waited for a bartender for about 5 minutes before we just ended up waiting for our table.

It's been years since we dined at Tavern and I know we won't wait that long again! We ate outside on a beautiful night. The restaurant was very busy and all tables were full. Food was delicious. Service was good. Price was on the higher end but it is one of the most famous restaurants in NYC so we expected that. We will be back soon! Our waiter Abraham was great!

I thought this would be more of a NY experience rather than a great place to eat. Well the food was incredible. I had the short ribs and my husband had their homemade raviolis. They are amazing. You can beat the ambience.  I would love to go back.
Service was very slow. Menu is limited. Prices very high. I’m
We sat outside on a beautiful day.  Our waiter Nelson was very attentive and made our birthday celebration quite fun.  The Tomahawk steaks were delicious as were the Manhattans

I came here for my birthday and the service was very amazing. I had the rainbow trout and my sister had the salmon both excellent!  Quality over quantity for sure which is important to me. I also expected it to be very expensive but their prices are reasonable and I respect that they didn't over inflate their prices like other businesses these days. Now I see why they have lasted so long and gave a great reputation. P.S. I got a yummy, free gift for my birthday:)

The food took over an hour without any communication or real attendance from the server.  Also, without any compensation…a complimentary dessert or cocktail would have been a nice recognition of the waiting time to eat. Additionally, a large table of 7 (that was seated after us) was a served before our party of 3, how does that happen?

Amazing food, great service
Perfect location for lunch whilst exploring Central Park

Our visit was to celebrate our first wedding anniversary after having our wedding meal in the glass box last year. 
As always the venue, the staff,  the food never fails.
Thank you
Very disappointing NY strip.  Will leave steaks to steak restaurants in the future!  Other than that everything else was to the usual high standard

I can not save anything from my dining experience at Tavern on the Green. Food was of very low quality (we had the day soup with lentils and chicken - this was barely ok - then artichokes  - they removed the heart?? but also, they were old and chewy - then heirloom vegetables - boiled and again, old - and oysters - that have been clearly rinsed with tap water). And everything was cold. Awful. Service was even worse, if possible. The server asked if we wanted food to be served in a particular way, we asked to get oysters first, he brought the soup instead. I asked for a change in my cocktail, he said no problem, but then brought the original cocktail instead. He brought us oysters from east and west coast (we asked from west coast only) and was not acknowledging that. And on top of it, greatly overprice. Definitely NOT recommending it, it's a tourists' trap.
Place to be seen. Great food, incredible location.

We had a lunchtime reservation and waited about 15 minutes to be seated outside- and only about 60% of the tables were being used. The food was great, loved the music being played, and our waiter was nice if we asked for something but he had a very stand-off attitude. Overall it was a nice experience on a beautiful spring day….with a pricey bill haha. We felt it was a must-do for our first time to NYC
We were sat in the direct sunlight and we’re not allowed to either switch seats or add any umbrella coverage. Tables that opened up next to us were pushed back into the shade.
Great service and beautiful room. Large portion size.

Our server was great, attentive but not overbearing. He returned our humor with a good attitude. The view of the outdoor dining area was beautiful and only improved as the night waned. Would definitely go back!
Wonderful service. Elegant surroundings. Wonderful meal. A lovely evening!
10/10 food and ambiance.

We had not eaten here since the restaurant changed hands.  What an improvement.  Decor and ambience are vastly improved as is the quality of the food.  Service was good without being overly attentive.  Recommended for a lovely evening dining in Central Park.  It amazes me how casually people dress at an upscale restaurant these days.  Shorts, sweats, etc.  Maybe I'm old-fashioned but even though I was wearing jeans, I had a nice shirt and sport coat on and dress shoes.  My wife was wearing a dress, not shorts and a sweatshirt like the woman at the next table.  They should institute some kind of dress code.

Worst service ever from waiting for reserved table to actual service.  The table was uneven and wobbly.  They took 1/2 of the lunch trying to fix it all the while my coffee was spilling.  I asked the waiter to help with the coffee.  He said nothing, grabbed the cup and returned with a new cup which was lukewarm.

My guest originally asked for an iced tea.  The waiter came back by and she called (nicely) to him.  She asked to change the order of tea to coffee.  He said, "no, the order was entered."  I'm not kidding.

We live in the neighborhood but rarely go to The Tavern.  Now we will never go again.  So many other choices.
Our server was fantastic and the food was delicious!
Would be the perfect lunch in the perfect setting but the music is so loud and bad that it kills the ambiance.
Prix Fixe Easter Dinner was $125 per person and we felt very rushed through each course.  Also, the main and desert courses were quite small portions.

Too expensive for what you got. It was just okay.
Server also should have told us there was a kid’s prie fixe.
$125 plus tax and gratuity too much for a kid.
The host was so kind, and the food was delicious. The table staff was excellent for accommodating my lactose intolerance. The ambiance was beautiful, and we enjoyed the view.

Set menu cost of $125 per person plus fixed 20% tip.

Food choices, nothing stood out amazing, the eggs Benedict was just was just a mush of mess of an plate.

Service was rushed, main course turned up whilst starter plates were still on the table.

Seating was squashed together.

Beautiful pre-fixed brunch at the TOTG 
The arrival of the pretty lambs made Easter very special.

Amazing food, service & ambiance. 10 out of 10 NYC dining experience for our out of town guests!

The dessert special that evening (a chocolate tort with caramelized bananas) was one of the best desserts we have ever eaten! Thank you, Tavern on the Green.

First time diners and we were a party of 3. Perfect picturesque venue for an early dinner. Christian was the perfect server: knowledgeable and friendly. The food was perfectly cooked (except sautéed spinach was overdone so they substituted for green beans) and we would definitely come back again.
Great food and service as always.  A great start to our evening.
Very good food, great atmosphere and fantastic service by Adrian!

My husband, son and I had a nice lunch today at this New York location.
The service was great. Our waiter Dorsi explained the dishes, very courteous and fast service.
We enjoyed our entrees and dessert.
Next time we are in town. We will go back again.
Fun brunch! They do the Parisian cafe vibe right!
It was my birthday and they treated us so well! The location is so beautiful and the food is phenomenal. Worth the price!

Tough to find the place and when we got there it was in a strange location
The food was good but overpriced and the noise was unbearable.
We will never return nor recommend it to anyone.
La cena muy deliciosa y muy bien atendidos por Rodrigo. Muy recomendable.
Nice ambient with good food. Would recommend!
A bit noisy and the second level dining area was extremely small.  Food was ok, but there are better French restaurants with more ambiance and equal if not better food.
An excellent restaurant with authentic French cuisine and a superb ambience. The waiters were very attentive and added to the evening which included theater.

It’s a really nice ambience, for a moment you feel you are actually in France. My party and I went for brunch and everything we had was delightful. If you find yourself there you should definitely have the profiteroles for dessert

Beautiful space to meet after work.  Hostess's were welcoming and accommodating...bartender was sufficient and professional.  Drinks were served promptly.  Server was efficient and professional...lacked personality, same with bartender.  Can't quite put my finger on it but seems as though they didn't really love their jobs.
Marveled at the ambience. Enjoyed the exquisite food and cocktails. Thought it was a bit loud for a 2 pm lunch but hardly the fault of the restaurant.
Great atmosphere and the service was outstanding with tasty selections it is hard to decide
Great service and the food was excellent. It was more expensive but worth it for a nice meal before the theater.
This was our second time at La Grande Boucherie! Never disappoints. The food and the ambience is to die for.
Exceptional service and experience.   Was memorable event.
Overall good experience.  Not cheap.  (Half chicken was $42).  My wife's burger was below par.

Overall we were disappointed in LGB. While the onion soup was excellent, the scallops and polenta was not good at all. The steak frites were ok but not stellar. The chocolate carmel tart was very good. The prie fixe theater menu is a good value but not if the food is only so so.
We got there for the last reservation and it kinda felt like we were getting rushed out but other than that it was fine
Amazing food & excellent service! Came to visit from Canada. Will definitely recommend this place to friends.
The food was great but the service was atrocious.
Amongst the best meats we have eaten. The place is just amazing. The menu could propose more vegetables as side dishes.
Food ok, foods came quickly almost too quick. The co-waiter did his job well. The waitress was having a busy night…

This is a large restaurant near and convenient to Broadway theaters. For the quality of the food, it is overpriced. Our waiter was fine but the wait-staff that brought the food never knew who ordered what.
Everything was A1. Their accommodation from pushing time to changing our seats. The food, the service, drinks. They spoiled us a little bit too! Will be back!
gooooooooooooooooooooooooooooooooooooooooooooooood

Came here with a friend for Easter and had the most amazing experience! We sat here for 4 hours enjoying appetizers, entrees, drinks and desserts. Jose C was a fantastic waiter and made sure we were well taken care of and comfortable. He was amazing from the beginning to end of our meal! Thank you for a great brunch.
Amazing food and environment. Beautiful setting seems authentic.
Such a lovely experience. Adrian was amazing, so kind; and the staff was all wonderful. Such great food and ambience. Would love to go again!!
Outstanding dinner experience. Went there for my birthday. Everything was perfect. The quality of meat was A1
Good food and service, particularly for such a large venue.  Very loud and busy
The food , service and ambience were excellent!! We had a great experience!!

Such a amazing find. Near Broadway and our hotel at Hilton midtown. Service was great. Food met expectations and came out quick. Glad we opted for indoors as the outside(although technically indoors) was windy. Will def go back then next time we are in the city

Food was very nice and definitely recommend it. Service was not very attentive, in the end while we considered ordering some desserts, decided to just leave because we did not want to wait 45min -1h to attract the attention for offering us any drinks or dessert menu

The restaurant is really pretty.  Flowers meet you at the entrance.  Very nice.  There was a long line to get in as only one person was checking guests in and one person seating.    The food came out very quick which explains the lack of freshness.  The food was simply not memorable.  The best part of the meal was literally the bread and butter.   I will not return.

Seriously, THE BEST place we have eaten in NYC. I had Mushroom Ravioli (so good!) and family members had variations of steak. When I tell you it is SO GOOD I am not lying. My daughter had the Steak Frites, which was so amazing. My other daughter had Filet, also amazing. Crème Brûlée and Chocolate Tarte- chef’s kiss!
Ozzy was our server, absolutely AMAZING, definitely ask for him if you can! We will be returning and sitting with Ozzy! The steak was so good we didn’t even take a pic until it was half eaten 😂
Phenomenal service and food. Will be coming back.
Amazing experience, worth every dollar. We had oysters, chateaubriand and wine.
Absolutely beautiful restaurant. The food was fantastic.
Great  cocktails. Prime rib was amazing

The food was lack luster the fries were extremely salty, pasta was bland and a tiny serving for the price. The cocktails should be known as mocktails since the alcohol was nonexistent. 
Extremely loud you can’t have a conversation.

This was a fantastic experience! We were looking for a great place to dine that was also efficient since we were headed across the street to Lincoln Center and wanted to make it in time.  In and out in one hour with cocktails, wine, arancini appetizer, and delicious steaks.  Service was great and on top of things! Wish we had more time there but it was perfecf for what we needed.
Server was fantastic. Food was delicious but noise level was off the charts LOUD. Was hard to hear across the small table. From people and music. Dial down the music volume at least.

S’mores dessert was phenomenal. And we might come back for this reason specifically. Everything else we had was good, but overpriced for what it was. Gnocchi was good, but the truffle sauce was too creamy and rich. Calamari and caesar salad were good, but probably wouldn’t order again. A bit loud for conversation, but we didn’t mind too much. I don’t think this is a place you need to go to, but service is very good and food is good.

Great place for bunch near Lincoln Center.  Our group had both eggs and sandwiches, everyone enjoyed their meal. Service was good, and we had no problem getting the food in plenty of time to make our show. The only complaint is that, when crowded, this restaurant - like all of The Smith restaurants - can get very noisy.

The restaurant was packed on a Saturday morning for brunch so the noise level was uncomfortably high - so high that it made conversing at the table extremely difficult.  I had the frnch toast which was dry and tasteless while a companion had the eggs benedict which were over cooked.  Definitely don't recommend this place.
Te food was good. The noise level was horrible. Too many people and seated too close. You could not have a conversation.

At first the menu doesn’t look impressive but when the food comes to the table it is truly outstanding. Brick pressed chicken… outstanding. S’mores dessert… outstanding. Mac and cheese? Humongous and outstanding! Service was great. Make a reservation because the place can be very busy! Definitely going back!
Waiter, Sam, was excellent. When my friend ordered a dish from the main column, by mistake, Sam gave her that dish from the appetizer column. When it was discovered, he gave her a free dessert.
Mac and cheese out of this world -- as always! Service excellent. All good , but the noise level is horrendous. The mac and cheese though -----
quick service  but thoughtful, extremely busy and loud but ylgood food and very good vegetables

Over 20 minutes to get a simple cup of coffee for breakfast is kind of ridiculous.  It came the same moment the food runner brought the breakfasts to the table.  When the server checked in a few moments later, I asked for a refill.   Never came.  Another 10 min, I ended up asking a bus girl for a refill.  She came through right away!  Note: the restaurant was not very busy at this time: between 9 and 10am on a random Thurs

We came here for a birthday dinner at 6:30. It was very busy, but we had a reservation and were seated within minutes of our requested time.  We ate in the outdoor seating, which I prefer, though the level of chatter was quite high. We ordered an appetizer and two entrées. All were delicious. Definitely recommend "The Smith"
The service was very good and the goid was delicious. It is rather noisy, however, but we enjoyed our dinner.

I have reviewed this restaurant before. The food and service are always good. There was a very minor glitch with one of our orders, for which they made one wine order and one coffee order complimentary. That was above and beyond, and showed real class. There are other good restaurants near Lincoln Center, but The Smith consistently delivers the goods.

Always reliable and favorite spot to go when seeing a show at Lincoln Center. So big but well run with friendly, efficient staff. I love their kale salad but lots of nice bistro type options. Not many good restaurants along this strip, and The Smith never disappoints.
We had lunch before a Wed matinee.  The restaurant was crowded and noisy.  We would have liked to been offered an outside table but we were not.
The food is delicious but the service had a delayed start and once the waiter came he was great. The restaurant is too noisy and loud.
Great food - great convenience for the theater and the food variety is excellent.

I was pleasantly surprised!  The lychee gimlet was delicious!  The salmon was not plain and boring, it was nice and crispy on the top and flavorful.  It came in a yummy broth with bok choy and root veggies.  Definitely will go back!  Brussels sprouts amazing!

I dislike giving bad reviews but this was pretty terrible
Noise level through the roof
Salads so over dressed more like salad soup
I sent mine back and the manager was very gracious about it offered other food etc but I was done by then
The chicken under a brick was a nice meal
The only one of our table of 4
Appetizers were fried TGIF except the Baruta which was mediocre at best
Pasta all’a vodka also swimming in sauce
This feels like a chain and so not worth the $
Disappointing

Wow… the food, service, vibe did not disappoint!!! Everything we ate was AMAZING… from the tomato soup to the pasta to the s’mores dessert. Definitely coming back and highly recommend. (Visiting from SF)
The service was exceptional, The food was of excellent quality and a decent value. Preparation and presentation was superb. Overall a wonderful pre thaeter dining experience.

We really enjoyed our experience at The Smith other than the noise level. Service was very good and we all enjoyed our food. 
We would come back again
Service was outstanding and the place is adorable. I wish there were some gluten free options but overall we loved it.

Food was great; however, you should be warned of the outdoor seating area situation as it is not heated! It is enclosed so it blocks out the wind. Once the sun sets and drops below 50 degrees it is cold dining outside. For a place like The Smith I would have expected outdoor heaters.
I always have a great time at the Smith. The food is delicious and do yourself a favor and get the three scoops of chocolate peanut butter ice cream!

Friends from out of town were visiting, we were heading to the theater for 8pm and had 6:15pm reservations. They didn’t sit us till almost 7pm, had to rush through our meal. I like the Smith but was disappointed that we didn’t feel relaxed on this visit.

The service at The Smith was outstanding. Someone at our table had a nut allergy and the server and the manager helped her out with her food choices. The service was great in general, and the food was delicious!

Went to the  Smith for a pre dinner show.  The noise level is very high and it was hard to hear my companion.  What’s causing my 3 rating is that the waiter accidentally put in the wrong order for me.  It took 15 minutes for me to receive my dinner during which my companion had almost finished his dinner.  They didn’t charge for my companion’s coffee to make it up to me.  I was charged full price for my dinner.  When we mentioned to the waiter that this was not the correct way to handle this situation and that one of my alcoholic beverages should have not been changed for he merely stated that this was out of his control.  He also never came to ask how the dinner was and I had to flag down someone else to request the correct dinner. Not one of my better dining experiences,

Peter the waiter was fantastic!!
Pre show dinner - got us out on time!
Food was EXCELLENT!!
Never disappoints!!
My wife and granny had a marvelous time at the Smith. Service was superb as they allowed my family to have perfect seating and the food was impeccable!
The food was amazing! The service was amazing! So glad to have come!

The overall vibe is crowded, popular and bistro like- it’s just a bit of a madhouse on a Saturday morning. Too many people crammed together in a big space, pushing each other out of the way. The experience is impersonal, loud and mediocre. The food and service definitely mediocre at best. Maybe there are not too many brunch places  around Lincoln center and the price point is acceptable. The bartender was outright yelling at people as we waited for our table that the bar seats were saved for people who want to eat at the bar. He was frankly a HUGE and unfriendly bummer. Not one gracious bone in his body. So overall a stressful and depressing brunch experience.

Good experience. Was in the area for a show at Lincoln center. Went for brunch. Place was packed. Having a reservation definitely helped. Had to wait quite some time before waiter came back to take our order. Food was delicious but portions a big small for the price. Drinks were ok.
Loud.  Eggs Benedict did not use English muffin. Too hard to eat.

The food and service were WONDERFUL!!! The restaurant itself is well-lit and decorated. Lots of cool rooms and sleek styles. My only critique is that they cram too many tables into the space. We felt on top of our left and right neighbors so all surrounding conversations felt loud.
Heaters were broken ... so we were accommodated inside
Great location near Lincoln Center. Reservation honored on time. Great food and service.
Love The Smith.  Usually go to the one in midtown but was at Lincoln Center and it's right next door.  Food is priced moderate but delicious and big plates.
We think this is our new go to place when we are in the city
Great food quality, absolutely top notch service. Ambiance is energetic in a very good way, the decor is simply stunning and the employees are not only knowledgeable but extremely courteous.

Outstanding service from the moment we walked in and were greeted. Truly inviting, professional, pleasant. Fantastic food - bread was a huge hit. We celebrated a birthday and our server Rosa and the hostess were very engaged with us and made the evening special. Top notch all the way around

Excellent service, excellent food all in a lovely restaurant!
Highly recommended!

The Dover sole was over cooked. The “brown butter” was all butter, no brown. The diver scallops were awful; the chef added spice without flavour, so it came off as tasting almost like a spicy dirt.

The bread served to start was beyond stale. It was too tough to eat.

The cocktail my girlfriend ordered had a pile of ice on top, making it impossible to drink. 

Do not recommend

Anniversary & meeting friends and family.
Couldn’t have been better.
Great service, wonderful food for 6 people.
Will definitely return & recommend to all.
Thank you

Reliably good and inventive classics at Quality. We were dining pre-theater and the service  seemed a little off at first but they got into the swing of it as the meal progressed. Butter service was grand. Loved that. Entrees we’re excellent. Sides and desserts were a little disappointing and the salad was over dressed.
Great ambiance, great food, great service. We will be return!

I chose Quality Bistro to celebrate my company's 6 year anniversary and every detail was thoughtfully considered. A lovely handwritten card on the table, complementary bubbly for a toast, and excellent service start to finish. The pistachio creme brûlée and butter service were to die for. Steaks were top shelf. We / I will be back many times to relive the deliciousness and superb hospitality.
The food and service are always excellent at Quality Bistro and it is one of my favorite restaurants - Butter Service is a must! I also love the other establishments in the Quality family.

We love Quality Bistro (and the other establishments in the group), but this experience was marred only by the fact that there was an aggressive and persistent transient that kept harassing all the diners and the staff and management did nothing about it, allowing the patrons to continue to be harassed even though they were well aware of it.
I enjoy this restaurant. Located comfortably in mid ny. And big enough to choose rooms

Perfect ambiance. Between 5th and 6th avenue not far from Central Park.
Great food and service. Expensive.

Our experience was fantastic from the beginning to end! The staff was warm and friendly and the food was AMAZING. The ambience was perfect for our girls dinner date, hence, we had the best time. Our waitress was knowledgeable of the food and was super helpful and attentive to us.
I usually love this place but this was the first time for lunch. Fish undercooked. Veg overcooked. Very disappointing.
A good place for a beautiful Dinner ! Bye from Italy

We waited at least 10 min for our server to greet us. Overall he was not attentive and rarely checked in. We ordered a bottle of wine and had to pour all the glasses ourselves. Below bar service but fortunately the food was good.
This dinner took 3 hours. It was apps and entrees. And it wasn’t that good. Honestly you’re better off at quality eats or quality meats.
Great food, atmosphere and service. Absolutely loved it! Thank you.
The Butter Service and Garni was absolutely delicious and totally unique. Loved it. Also had the French onion soup which was Devine.
Had a terrific meal at QB once again. A favorite of ours, with great atmosphere, service and of course food!
Everything was amazing! I highly encourage you to order the “Butter Service”!!! It is well worth the splurge. Go for a long walk after if you feel guilty, but indulge yourself. So yummy!

We ordered the double chop medium and it was cold and rare when it came out. They took it back and it came out medium well. Kind of upsetting for a $185 steak. Salmon and Tiger shrimp were really good. Asparagus salad was soggy. Bibb lettuce didn’t have any dressing. Server wasn’t very attentive. Overall, I wasn’t very satisfied after our last visit which is a shame because our December visit was amazing.
My team loved it. They would be happy to dine there again, so we'll keep it in our rotation. They liked the food and the atmosphere.
Food was good. Service was okay had to ask multiple waiters for the same thing because we kept waiting.

I ordered the beet & cabbage salad, and it was a huge mound of shredded cabbage and I couldn’t find a beet.  I barely ate any of it I was so disappointed.  The Branzino was excellent. 
I think this place is overpriced, even for Manhattan.  There are much better places for this price point.
Great food, great service, great ambiance. Solid choice!
Fantastic food and service, some of the best I’ve had in the city
Great!  We loved the ambiance and the food was delicious.

The restaurant was great, but I thought the fact that it is a “bistro” implied that it was a less expensive version of their other expensive restaurants. So it was an expensive dinner, but it was delicious.
One of the most amazing meals I have ever had in any city! Cannot wait to go back. The outdoor cabins were a fun experience.

Everything was very Quality about this Bistro.
Service, food, ambiance were terrific.
On recommendation is having one vegetarian entree option on the menu.
Excellent food and service.  Great cocktails and wine list
Great service and amazing food.  Has become our favorite restaurant in NYC by far.

Fried chicken was really good. It is enough for 4- not 2 as suggested.  Didn’t think the butter  & bread service was worth it. It was very nicely presented but jus bread & butter in the end.  Room is beautiful and not noisy at all.

Completely disappointed with the place. Service is ok. But the food is very bad, Especially the butter service. It’s just a regular bread with the most basic butter. Don’t understand the fuss around it. The salads, branzino, filet mignon, oysters all basic and not tasty at all. Paid ~$300 for dinner just to leave in the middle and go to a better place.

Excellent service from checking in, to table, food experience and wait staff. We were celebrating our anniversary and the staff made it special. We had the crab cake, tuna tartar, chateaubriand for two, and finished with Raspberry Charlotte which was an amazing recommendation from our waiter. Wine choice and sommelier also excellent. 5 star++ Small issue was it was very cold in the area we were sitting which made it less uncomfortable. We will return.
Love that place and food but service was pushy and rush. They rushed the food to us without any time between services

This was an absolutely unreal experience. We went for a late night date and it checked every box. The food was delicious, the ambiance was incredibly cool and romantic, and the service was impeccable. A memorable meal and I don’t see how anyone could rate this anything but a five star experience. It’s spendy, but worth every penny.

Ambiance gets triple point. It was my first time there to catch up with a good friend. As we walked in, we were pleasantly surprised to see ourselves in this eclectically gorgeous mega restaurant. Many patrons were in business smart attires, and ambiance was friendly yet orderly and respectful. We saw a large groups dining near us, but our intimate conversations were never been interrupted. This is a big restaurant with good vibes, but the noise level was low. Food was with great ingredients and presented well. Crab cake was my favorite among what I had. Wine by the glass was excellent.
Great food and service portion sizes are huge the only downside on a Saturday night really noisy
It was great as usual. We had one of the specials and a pasta dish. Loved everything.
Best experience I’ve had thus far. Food was so delicious
The food was delicious. The sauvignon wine at the bar was served warm. Additionally, the bar was out of kettle one vodka.
What a wonderful restaurant! delicious and fresh dishes and exceptionally wonderful staff. Will return soon!
Great family style Italian! Highly recommend! Great location in the center of the Upper West Side!

Carmine's has been my "go to" restaurant for dinner for about 20 years. As a former nurse at Metropolitan hospital I planned celebratory dinners and continued the tradition until i retired from Bellevue hospital. The food is excellent, served on platters to share. professional and helpful staff. Last night when my friend collapsed in the dining room, the staff immediately jumped into action, especially the manager and our waitress. Other staff stopped by to offer assistance. It reminded me of an emergency room scene and i know because six of the diners are Nurses, including the person who needed emergency assistance. You be assured we will share our experience at Carmine's! Thank you again!

Food was excellent as always.  Our server was the best. My only complaint is that I asked for them to sing happy birthday to my sister and no one did. They also sent the wrong order for my sister's to-go dessert, and then took forever to change it and pack it to go. But it was fairly crowded so...
Amazing hospitality & delicious food !! A family favorite
Wonderful!! Food was just a little bit “cold” when it arrived
We were placed in the party room so noise level is low compared to the main room.   Still our favorite Carmine's in NYC - service is great even during a busy day (Easter), food is great!
Given a holiday, restaurant was busy, but service was extremely slow and items were forgotten where manager actually brought out a dish
Excellent place for special occasions good sized shareable portions of food !
All of the food is excellent!  And the staff is friendly and helpful.  There were 22 of us (5 young children included)  and everyone enjoyed the meal from appetizers to dessert.

Carmine’s- 
My family & I ( almost 21 attended) have been going to Carmine’s over 20 years in celebrating Easter! We love ❤️ it. Since we had a large number, we asked if our tables could be close to each other. Unfortunately, that did not happen. Perhaps next year, Carmine’s would do us this request since we spend a lot of money there.
My family loves Carmines.  Staff was attentive and food was delicious.  Keep up the great job!
Excellent food and service. The staff was very attentive and efficient.
When they tell you that 1 plates actually feeds 2 people believe them!! The food was absolutely delicious!

Booked ahead but I think we could still have gotten a table
Good outstanding as usual
Very accommodating hostess. Waiters very attentive. Atmosphere is perfect for enjoying your meal with friends. The food was very good.

I have been here so many times so I will take it as an off night . Really our waiter ruined the experience. He was awful. We asked multiple times for our drinks and and they came after apps were cleared up. We waited at least 10 minutes to get silverware for dinner since it was cleaned up. But the food was very salty as well. The manager was super kind the restaurant was informed of an allergy at the table.  Loud, huge servings. Like I said willing to try again because we have been here many many times before . But only one other shot.
Food was good, but the waitress showed no interest in us.

The experience in Dining at Carmine’s was the best I have ever experienced in New York, Our waiter Chris provided us with the best service ever and the staff was the friendliest ever in welcoming me and family
To the restaurant…..
All of the food came out at different times. One of the meals came out wrong and that prolonged dinner.
Loved the experience it felt like a home cooked meal
I always try to find time to go to Carmines when I am in NYC. I like that its old school charm has not been lost. Food is alway good and the service is amazing.

First the good. The service was good
Now what wasn’t so good. We made a reservation for 8 and we’re sat a table that wasn’t adequate for 8 adults, 6 adults could’ve sat at this table comfortably. It was a very tight fit and made dining a little uncomfortable.
Our dishes came out warm to less than warm and we’re just ok in terms of flavor. The garlic bread, Caesar salad & lasagna were the best of 7 dishes we ordered, everything else was just ok. Not bad not good and that’s a shame for $85 per person.

Service was amazing.  Fast and attentive.  Food was very good but I remember it being slightly better.  Our side dishes were not fully cooked and the mixed drink flavor was a little off.  Main dishes were delicious and we would still return.

The food and the service are great! Server are very nice! Except one of the customer an elderly one, got annoyed because our baby keeps crying and she didnt like it and made a horrible remark to our daughter. She's being racist and made a gesture , i think an italian gesture saying we are nothing!  But overall, the food and service are great!!
Fabulous service- 2 meals and an appetizer were more than enough for a family of 4….. food was delicious! We ran 40 minutes late and they weee very understanding!

We are from California and don’t have a Carmines near us. This place was amazing!  We have been to Carmines in Washington DC & Las Vegas before and the NY restaurant was just as amazing. Hands down best Italian restaurant for sure. Chicken Parmigiana is delicious. Meatballs & spaghetti are delicious. Calamari appetizer is delicious. You won’t be disappointed here!

Loved it. They made my special day so special by bringing out a cake honoring my celebration. Super accommodating and sweet staff as well. Great for large parties and celebrations! Will most definitely come back for another event in the future.

Bad service. They let you reserve a table for 9:45 pm, but they treat customers badly. We had to order food in a hurry. They started cleaning the floor next to us while we ate. In the end, we couldn't order dessert or coffees because they wanted to close. Dinner lasted 40 minutes. Noisy environment. Lasagna was okay.
Do not recommend, does not resemble the Carmines in Times Square.
Great food great atmosphere but my service was bad
Fantastic! Very good place for a family get together. They were fantastic about reservations!
Wedding anniversary dinner had a good time. Service was quick. Reservations where at 5:000pm was seated by 5:01 and finished eating by 6:00pm

We went to Carmine's on 91st for my brother's bday.  Him and some of my family members had been there before, however, this was my first time and I loved it!  The food was AMAZING, the staff was very friendly and the ambience was nice. 
My only complaint was that the service was pretty slow.  When we got seated, the place wasn't too busy, there were a lot of empty tables.  Though, in the next hour, the place was PACKED!  But even when it wasn't packed, we found the service to be slow.  After we placed our order, we waited a while for the food to come.  My husband ordered their Titanic dessert for my brother's bday while we were having our entrees.  After we finished eating, the tables were cleared out in a few minutes and we got takeout boxes but then a few minutes passed and I asked our waiter about the dessert, he nodded to acknowledge my ask.  It had been a good 15m, there was nothing, we were just sitting there idle waiting for the dessert.  I asked him about it again and he said he told them in the kitchen, should be out soon, and it finally arrived in the next 5-7m.  
Other than the slow service, everything was excellent!  I would still go there again and recommend it to everyone!
Not good enough! The food is unhealthy. Portions too big. Preparation overdone.
Food was awesome as always. Brought some friends from out of town and the look on their faces when the food came out was priceless. As always looking forward to our next visit

Total change of test of their dish gardaniera . Basic sauce used to be creamy. Ask waiter to get some creamy vodka sauce. She was told management to change 25 $.
One of our family’s favorite restaurants hate to see this change in test and service

name: Fleming's Steakhouse - Edgewater
addressComponentsLongName: New York / Tri-State AreaNew Jersey - North

reviews.reviewsText: Last 3 visits they can’t seem to get it right.  Will not be going back

I visit Fleming’s often and the food and service are always on point.  I appreciate their attention to detail and always ensuring that I am satisfied as a customer.  This time had chose Tomahawk Tuesday!

It was a perfect birthday celebration for my wife. Everyone is so nice and very welcoming. Tomahawk steak is so so delicious. We didnt see the nice view of the city because it was raining and very foggy. Overall it was an excellent birthday celebration.
Everything was perfect-from the saying HELLO to THANK YOU for coming.
Everything is great. I am not a fish lover,My husband had the salmon and he loved it. I had a plant based meal with cauliflower,mushroom and other delicious foods.  It was exactly 💯.

It was our anniversary and I was looking for something special. I was not disappointed. The food was delicious. The service was excellent. The staff attended to our every need, they were courteous & very helpful, offering excellent menu suggestions.  The view from Fleming’s, looking across to the Manhattan skyline was spectacular. Staff were attentive to small details, which made a huge impact; deserts were served on a “Happy Anniversary” plate with a sparkler. They even gifted us with a small Box of Happy Anniversary Chocolates. I’ll be having dinner at Fleming’s regularly!
Amazing time!  Delicious food and super great server and service.  Will definitely return

I absolutely love this restaurant. it's my wife and the second time, and when I tell they do not disappoint, the food was amazing as well was the service the ambiance was so beatiful especially where they had us seated looking over the city always such a great time coming here can't wait to comeback again
Crying child near our table made it difficult to have a conversation.

I regularly visit Flemings because I love the service, great food, and attention to detail.  I brought two of my girlfriends to celebrate one of their birthdays.  The food was impeccable and the service was very good.  I am giving 4 stars because I just noticed that my waiter did not submit my Dine Rewards points…

Fleming’s will forever be our favorite steak house. The atmosphere and the magnificent view is incomparable to any other restaurant. The food and drinks are outstanding. Everything is made fresh and cooked to perfection. The wait staff is so attentive, helpful, kind, delightful and knowledgeable. I tipped 25% last visit. Absolutely love Fleming’s and I recommend this restaurant to almost everyone I talk to.

The restaurant was great. The ambiance was beautiful. Our waiter Darren was phenomenal, if you ever visit the Edgewater location request him, he’s amazing. Would definitely recommend to anyone, the food was very tasty.
It was amazing Sergio and his colleague made my girlfriend night special

Great service by Giovanni. Nice ambiance with great views of NYC.  Well made Manhattan cocktail. Delicious calamari and Burrata with Prosciutto appetizers.  Hearty angus beef ribeye, petite filet mignon, and Chilean sea bass main courses. Mac and cheese, Flemings potatoes, and asparagus are must have sides. Scrumptious chocolate lava cake ( don’t miss out, so leave some space).

The food was really just not good- very expensive and the food was just meh- our steak was almost all fat and even the bread was kind of stale. The view is wonderful and the service was top notch but they present the restaurant as super high end and the food is just not on par

This was my spouse & my 3rd time busting the restaurant, 2nd time celebrating our birthdays. The ambiance, food & service was great!!! Ask for Swe (hope I spelled it correctly), she was awesome!!! The assistant manager, Dakota was great as well. We will definitely be returning.

Our server Serena was amazing. She was friendly, professional, checked on us at the right time and an overall pleasure.Our food was great. Unfortunately my partner and I are on special diets so we weren’t able to try as many menu items as we normally would. However I enjoyed my dinner and the entire staff.
Flemmings is consistently good.
This food and ambiance is spectacular! But the service is top notch! Best service in NJ. A must go!!
Great service and food as usual, we were very pleased with everything.
Wonderful. Thank You Sergio.
we were celebrating my sons belated birthday and it was all perfect. food was delicious - server was attentive - restaurant  looked beautiful. it was a wonderful evening
Great food great service!

Fleming’s is a beautiful restaurant on the Edgewater waterfront with excellent views over the Hudson River with the Manhattan skyline in the background. Inside, the restaurant in beautiful, warm, and comfortable. The food is excellent, the ambience warm, and the service attentive. Dining at Fleming’s was a great experience that I can full-heartedly recommend!

Maggie was an outstanding server. Her attention to detail was impeccable.   She made my best friend's celebration dinner so special.  The food was  spectacular and the views were magnificent!  We thoroughly enjoyed our dining experience.

*chef's kiss!!* 😙💋
The service was great! The food was delicious, and a big kudos to the sommelier.
Last night was my first time at any Flemings location, but im so glad that i finally made the reservation at Edgewater. I will definitely be back and will recommend to friends.

I had the dry aged ribeye with the truffle lobster topping, but everything on the menu was amazing, and the staff is top notch.
We came in for my birthday celebration and it was done wonderfully along with delicious meals.  We enjoyed ourselves and the services were impeccable.

This was our second time going within a short time between and we just happened to be seated with the same waitress Allie, (is her name) that we previously had the last time we were there and she’s Great! The Filet is my favorite go to and the variety of butters makes it even better! The views of NYC Skyline is beautiful. Serve great for date nights!
Great as usual! Servers were attentive and service was excellent.
The ambiance was great , food delicious and awesome view . The girls at the front desk are welcoming
My family and I always have a great experience here. We also celebrated my son's birthday which was also a phenomenal time. They were able to accommodate more than 100 guests comfortably.

Our waiter Sergio was absolutely amazing! Very attentive and provided special accommodations for my infant. The staff are very professional and the ambience was great. Not my first time here and certainly not my last!
The staff was so kind and extra caring. Made the birthday event extra special

My wife and I shared a 11oz filet along with flash fried brussels sprouts and a baked potato. We also ordered a nice Rioja. The food, ambiance and service were excellent. A bit noisy for my liking. Kudos to the staff, Trevor in particular, for making the evening very enjoyable

The view was fantastic, friendly service but I do have to say the 35oz long one tomahawk rib eye did not impress. For the price it’s better than anything around but as far as the taste and quality of the meat it was choice at best, definitely not prime. Considering it’s a steakhouse with multiple locations you’d assume they don’t cheap out on meat and sell choice for prime but that’s exactly what happened and I’m disappointed about that

I came here to start off my weekend birthday celebrations and I wish I came here to end the weekend because my experience was so great. I got the ribeye and for the table we got mac & cheese, cream spinach, and mashed potatoes. With the exception of the mashed potatoes which were surprisingly a little dry, all of the food was delicious. But the best part of coming here was the service. The hostesses were welcoming and our server Serena was on point. Serena was so sweet and made great recommendations, including a nice place to take photos outside. I would definitely visit this location again.
AMAZING!!!

Steaks were just not good…. Seems like the cuts are not what they use to be or compared to steakhouses just not up there .. place looks beautiful ambiance is cool and staff was attentive… food was just not there … we use to visit this place a lot … perhaps anew methodology is being utilized… not good ( steaks ) salads and sides were good we didn’t try anything else.
Been here many times and one of my favorite places. Steak not seasoned that well this time.
Exceptional service as always
We have eaten here many times over the years and Cafe Luxembourg never disappoints.  The food is good, our server was a pleasure, and we had a great meal with friends.
As a local, it’s one of my favorite spots in the neighborhood and I go often. The best.

Cafe Luxembourg is definitely a cut above other restaurants in the neighborhood.
The service was attentive and the food was comparable to what one receives in establishments like Nougatine or Boulud Sud.  The preparation and presentation of the grilled salmon was superb as was the omelette which I and my guest ordered.
We really love Cafe Luxembourg and today was no exception.  The food was very good but took forever to be served.
Always welcoming, considerate.  Table ready on time.  French fries best in the world.
We had a terrific meal and great service.  Luxembourg is such a great neighborhood place
Great food.  Fills up fast.  Great for people watching.  Convenient to Lincoln Center.
There is always a warm welcome here. Excellent food and atmosphere. A completely convivial experience!

Pro: open for lunch on Mondays.
Con: $40 for a lobster roll?
Excellent customer service and we were placed in a cute corner booth
Thank you ALL for a perfect Easter lunch! Civilized bloody marys, perfect omelette, surprisingly scrumptious french toast and luscious crocque monsieur. All of the staff was A+
Always a delight! Our go to restaurant when we’re in the city for a Broadway show!
Great place for brunch.  The ambiance is very pleasant and we were seated promptly The food and service are outstanding.  The only negative is the somewhat cramped seating.

Decent for after theater dinner. Service was excellent and they promptly seated us as per our reservation. Food was good but not exceptional. Limited menu but had all the necessary foods that one would want after or before a show. As a place to go for a special night out for dinner i do not recommend for that purpose.
Fabulous meal. Outside, so intimate and quiet. Thank you!
This old mainstay still offers a bustling dining room with delicious bistro fare. Went for lunch and had the special: crispy shrimp sandwich with a glass of Gruner Vertliner.
Great friendly professional service from Kalib, Nadia and Jamie.

It was our 1st time dining here.  The cocktails were delicious.  Chicken dumpling appetizer was very good.  Creme Brulee was outstanding.  I would definitely go again when visiting NYC.  Don't expect a cheap night out,  though.
Cafe Lux is my go to on the UWS of Manhattan. Always reliable and a lovely ambience. I am a constant customer and will continue to be.
Always a fantastic dining experience! Great food, great service
Some of the best Eggs Benedict I have ever had. Attentive service.

Always reliably good food, the one annoying thing which happens every time we visit- the servers refill water glasses at a hyper rate,  as we have bottled sparkling water on the table , the servers pour flat tap water into the glass and over the sparkling before we can stop them. It happened twice yesterday- calm down  no one is desperate for water!
Such a fun and relaxed brunch to celebrate a friend’s birthday! Conrad, our waiter was awesome!
Wonderful brunch and great service!! Will return !
Lovely in all ways. Wine properly chilled.  Greeted with warmth.  Food great.
Always a classic.  Good energy in the dining room.  Nice food.
Good food.  Drinks were excellent.  Nice ambiance but we were stuck at a small cramped table
Always excellent— food, service, atmosphere. Highly recommend the moules frites and chicken dumplings.

Well executed classic French recipes.
My steak tartar was a little dry but very well seasoned. Only flaw is that I specifically requested no pepper on it and there was a lot of it…..Although I left with a runny nose due to my mild allergy to pepper, I had a good experience.
Love the half chicken with glazed carrots and caramelized sprouts.  The accompanying dark sauce is the perfect compliment.
Both a neighborhood standby and a good spot for celebrity spotting, if you know writers and opera singers.  It’s been there forever and hasn’t changed and that’s what we love about it.
Food was great, service was great, it was crowded and loud but in a good way
I have been coming here for thirty years and it never disappoints
Always fabulous and predictable over past 40 plus years!

Cramped in with a table for 8 next to us and a loud female party of 5 behind us, and an older gentleman with a walker squeezing by. Very tight quarters but food and service up to standards. It seems as if the portions, (steak frites) and the salmon are getting smaller and more expensive. The steak was about 5 ounces and half inch thick. The Moscow Mule was served in a narrow glass instead of a usual copper mug. Profiteroles for desert were the highlight.
Food and service outstanding!! Waitress took our order perfectly!
great inventive delicious food, and wonderful service.
The wait staff is beyond compare. And the food is always consistently magnificent !
Great service and very accommodating. The food was delicious!!!

Came for dessert and drinks after our Boucherie debacle. Complete night and day experience! Lovely lovely staff, friendly front desk, lovely drinks and a really really good crème brûlée!! We’ll be back for dinner next time!

Thanks Stanley Tucci for the reference!!

name: Pier 115
addressComponentsLongName: New York / Tri-State AreaNew Jersey - North

reviews.reviewsText: Service was excellent. Prices reasonable. Sit near the back or outside if the weather permits. NYC skyline is lively. Menu somewhat limited so be sure to check it out first. Food was really good.

Everything was great until one of the orders was missed and never came out . We did we did not want it anymore as 2 out of 3 finished the main course . All we got was a sorry they should have comp part of the meal or at least offer but nothing. We will never go back again .
Great service and wonderful food , best views for my first time seeing New York
Had a great time here. Food service and scenery was excellent. A must come back for future dates and occasions
Great service , nice waiter 😊 it was very busy always make reservation .
Hudson Roll is not to miss! so is the tsunami burger.
Ambiance was dope. Food was good. Drinks was good.

Definitely overrated and the food was flavorless. Took a group of friends there and sadly all of us have no desire to return. Way better restaurants available with that kind of view for the same price.

We had a reservation for a birthday/bachelorette party and our group of 5 was seated at 2 small couches and a tiny coffee table in the back. When we asked for a regular table, we were told they were booked - so just a heads up, you might have to eat dinner crouched over a coffee table, even with a reservation that doesn’t specify subpar seating. We ultimately ended up leaving.
The place itself was very nice . But the food was okay I was just expecting something different I guess but the service was good .
Celebrated a milestone birthday - good food , great service.  Outstanding views!
Very lively and noisy but good vibe. Food was very good and the service was very attentive. Will go again.

Great service and charming ambiance.  Breathtaking views of Manhattan skyline.  Met up with an old friend and had a wonderful reunion in a very relaxed atmosphere, friendly staff never rushed we stayed for hours catching up with such a gracious staff.
Food and drinks were great. Will definitely come back again

The mushroom flatbread with hot honey and mac and cheese were good but not worth the price.  The Wagyu burger was kind of bland and the fries were a bit stale.  The pasta was above average but pretty standard for most dining places.  The price for valet is a bit much. A little crowded with narrow dining table.  Waitress was nice.  V day drink specials were good but a bit too "organic and herbal" for my liking.

The service was just okay, not horrible. Tables were crammed together to the point that servers were stepping on my feet which were under the table. Service was slow. Standard items on the menu were great, but the salad was VERY DRY. So light on dressing.
