I was told by the seater that a certain section was reserved, only to see the table not seated for the donation of my dinner. It’s a bar it says dress casual but there were people in hoodies.
Valentines romance
Food was ok, service was not so good.

Been coming to this place for years, but their prices have gotten completely out of control. $27 for a burger is beyond ridiculous. Pizzas starting at $20, $19 for a mac and cheese "appetizer", $12 for a side of fries. Every cocktail is $18. I realize you can see NYC from the windows, but that doesn't mean they have to charge the same prices. Plus they don't have wings on the menu anymore, which it sad but then again who knows what they'd charge...disappointing to see them taking advantage of customers.
Wonderful ambiance , great staff and service . The beer was outstanding . The view was amazing , so very happy to have visited .  Food was yummy .
Loved the vibe ! Always a good time at pier 115! Thank you!
Friends in town
Food and drinks were great and the view of NYC is amazing!
Great experience.  Food was delicious.  Very attentive staff!
Had an 8:15 reservation and didn't get seated until 9:00. And the table we got was smaller than an airplane tray in the middle of traffic. Was constantly getting bumped into

It took forever to receive a glass of water or utensils. I ordered a drink and the server  didn’t know if they made the type of drink. I had 3 drinks and was also charged for the large ice cube in each drink. The chicken bacon ranch pizza was mediocre and had 4 whole roasted plum tomatoes. It looked unusual with the whole tomatoes and lacked seasoning.
They didn’t put the right cheese on the burger and forgot our water. They also didn’t check us in on open table when we showed up, I had to tell them as we were leaving to do it.

I went to Pier 115 with my father the day after Christmas. The hostess was extremely racist, rude and unprofessional. I arrived around 7:50 and the place was not packed. I saw several open seats. She asked if we had reservations and said the wait would be approximately 45 minutes. I looked on Open Table and I was able to immediately book reservations. OpenTable had openings for 8:00, 8:15, 8:30 and 9:00. I made a reservation for 8:00 and informed the hostess that I made a reservations. I asked to be seated with my reservation at one of the several open tables and hostess refused. While we were waiting one came into the restaurant who needed to be seated. When we were finally seated, we saw even more open seating. I took pictures of two open tables near me that remained open the entire night and there were even more open seats that remained seats. Luckily our server was attentive and the food was decent. That hostess needs to be reprimanded for their racist behavior. We were the only black people seated at the restaurant
Overall great experience.  Food was good and the service was wonderful.  Higher prices, but guess that's expected to be in the pier and during these times.  View was amazing.

The food and service is great but it is extremely overpriced. 6 people and all appetizer and a few drinks was $600 - no one ordered a main meal and only a few people had drinks so this is disappointing but- the food and drinks are delicious!

Unfortunately we were overall disappointed.  Started from beginning - they had a sign for valet but actually valet service was not available.   We then looked for parking - no signs of where to go; it was the same for walking to the restaurant - no clear signs where to go.  The ambiance was very much of a sports bar.   The pizza was good - the portions for entree - very small for price.   I ordered the chicken - I believe they gave be 1/2 of a breast and a small thigh -thankfully we had potatoes.   We were seated nearby the door to deck.  Nice view but if the door does not close all the way when  people exit the people seating nearby are hit with Arctic air.  None of the wait staff seemed to care about it.  Overall if you want a drink and look at the view and order a pizza ok otherwise ….
Birthday was delicious. Had the truffle Mac and cheese and octopus
ambiance was very nice but not enough personal space
It was ok the front door staff where a little rude .
My experience wasn’t very good. The food was bland and I even had sand in my scallops. Not much to say. Perhaps someone else will have better luck.

Brunch was delicious,  service was great, music a little too loud for me on a Sunday at 12:30 pm when only a few in attendance and you're trying to have  a conversation. Other than that, it was very nice.
The French onion soup wasn't not the best. The pizza was good.

Food tasted great, and staff were attentive.  Interior design is rustic and comfortable.  We enjoyed the wide menu selection from both the lunch and brunch menus.  Amazing beer selection with many holiday/seasonal choices.  Nice place for a special occasion or just a relaxed meal with a great view.
Staff was pleasant our waiter was attentive and sweet. Food was great. Family time well spent thank you
Music was cool, vibe was nice and chill the hookah flavor were really good
Overpriced for what you get. I literally went to a steak and seafood house and spent the same amount for more alcohol and same amount of food Better quality.

I saw this restaurant on tik tok and heard good things. Decided to make it a night out with some friends. The food was OK. Ambiance was OK, not really impressed. Our waiter was MIA.. had to go find her and flag her down for a soft drink. We had a party of 4, yet 20% gratuity was automatically added. So, with that kind of service, 20%, in my opinion, was a bit much when I had to literally go get her. Especially when she was attending other tables right in our area. It's like she turned a blind eye (Amani). Dissatisfied
Best calamari I had & music always on point, hookah is okay, they make up in service
Great ambiance. So so food
Loved it it was great service and great ambience! 10/10
Everything was amazing. The food, the music, the hookah and the servers.
Good place. Has a little of everything, hookah, TVs, good drinks. A bit pricey but food was good as well.
NYE - horrible good horrible host and managers horrible pricing for nothing party of two paid $500 after reservations
Over charged for the new year…. Used open table as a disguise of a false deposit only to over charge more in person

The food isn’t worth the price, in my opinion. If you’re going to charge customers $45 for a lobster tail, a few potatoes, a few pieces of carrots and asparagus, it should taste great. My lobster didn’t taste good. Might’ve been overcooked. I don’t mind paying the money as I am a foodie. I just want to be satisfied. Other than that, everything was ok, as far as location, service, and vibe.
I love Spirit Bar. I have a good time every time I go there. The vibes are always great & so is the food.

4. This place is great! Atmosphere is chill and cool.  Our waiter Justin was very attentive. Delicious dishes and drinks.  The violin musician playing along with the DJ’s music was  extraordinary. Highly recommend.
Cool vibes not too pricey…food was good lamb chops specifically was on the money.

Appetizers and drinks are consistently top quality.  Entrees are “hit or miss” - mostly miss. 90s Night on Thursday was a huge disappointment.  Most service staff are attentive, but we experienced on multiple occasions careless mistakes with food and drink orders.  Last night one waitress mixed up the drink orders by bringing another tables’ drinks to us only to return minutes later to attempt to take back and deliver them to the other table even after we told her we already drank from the glasses to taste.  We prevented her from doing this to the other table.  They always charge 18% gratuity regardless of table size (2 or 4). Last night was the straw that broke the camel’s back.  Despite a ridiculous $640 + bill for a party of 4, our waitress charged us for one of the wrong drinks we sent back after her mix up.  Rather than do the customary thing to take the wrong drink off the bill, she left in!  We brought it up nicely and she refused to take it off.  After I said “we just won’t ever come back here again” she changed her tune and took it off.  It wasn’t about the $20 drink, but the principle that this establishment does not understand customer service.  Which is probably why the majority of patrons we see go only to order a drink or two, a couple of appetizers and to smoke hookahs.
We are never going back again.
The food was delicious and the service was Grade A. This is also my first time visiting since they renovated and I really like what they did with the place! Nice date night spot
Hookah bar. Great drinks

My waiter Justin was AMAZING!! 
It was my first time so I had a lot of questions to ask about the food, he was very patient and honest. 

The atmosphere overall is amazing
The atmosphere was good and the it’s a definitely a good place to go and hangout with friends
Everything was amazing . I would recommend this restaurant to all of my friends
Husband Birthday
Amazing staff! Food was good, hookah and drinks were amazing. Everything came out swiftly and as ordered. Went during a quieter time during the day but will be back to try HH!
Has been a favorite for many years & we enjoyed another wonderful night of excellent food & ambiance.
Have enjoyed Rebecca’s over 20 years. Food authentic and tasty.  Lechon, croquetas, great.  Service is really kind and excellent. Enjoy the rear courtyard for a change of pace.

Rebecca's shines in the quality and freshness of its authentically Cuban food. 

The delucious guacamole, for example, is accompanied by crisp homemade plantains. I have eaten most of the dishes on the menu and they are all plentiful and tasty. 

Service is thoughtful and charming, and the mood in the main dining room can be romantic or lively, depending on who you dine with.

Rebecca's has the best Cuban food in the Edgewater area, which is why my family and friends return often. Go (!), you will love it.
This is a nice and cozy restaurant for locals in the area. Take your own wine.
First time here the food was amazing will definitely be reserving another table this weekend
A cozy and private restaurant. Excellent food and friendly service.
It was great service !

It was my first time booking a reservation in this restaurant and I have to say its a 10/10. From the food all the way to the service top notch. Price was excellent especially with the fact that it was Valentines Day. It was a surprise dinner for my husband and he loved it!

Great spot! Small and intimate.

Perfect

Rebecca’s is always the perfect place for a family dinner.
Simple dishes, delightfully so.

I had a great experience with with my family celebrating my mother’s birthday. Warm bread was brought to the table with butter. For appetizers we had yuca frita and chorizo which were good. For entree most of us had ropa vieja with white rice, really delicious and flavorful, a decent portion as well. Desert was tres leches for some, which was so moist and fresh. For myself, I had a cappuccino which was a bit off for me, it tasted salty which is odd. The service was great but we were also the only ones in the restaurant most of the time. I do have to admit I think it is a bit overpriced. And I failed to notice gratuity was included on the bill already, we ended up giving double tip when I looked at the receipt when I got home, sort of wish this had been highlighted either verbally or directly on the bill.
We absolutely love going to this restaurant! Service is always amazing and the food never disappoints!!

Took my boyfriend here for his birthday ! It was great ! Food was great ! Services was great the pero olé We’re amazing , they gave us our own private table alone on the patio it was beautiful ! They even sang him happy birthday ! Appetizers , entree , desert was great ! We do recommend bring your own drinks !!
The staff were friendly and attentive. The food was also good too. Definitely would visit again.
3 guest order the paella which came out cold, very little seafood and tostones were rubber.  My friends were super disappointed especially the birthday boy.  Not good…
The flavors were delicious! The service was very attentive. Highly recommend the camarones verdes. The sauce was great, but could be spicier.
Felt like we were at a diner. Perhaps New years Eve wasn’t the time to go but it felt like a rush job- feed em and move em out. Been wanting to try Rebecca’s for some time now, we won’t be back.
Rebecca's is amazing! Will definitely go back again, and I have shared my experience with friends and families.  Thank you again it was truly amazing.

Sea bass & shrimp were delicious.
Staff were all wonderful.
Nice ambiance. Will return!
Great experience overall ( service, food, ambiance)!
The restaurant is on the smaller side but it creates a nice ambiance. Great for date night. All the food was so tasty.
Rebecca's is outstanding in every way....lovely entering, great service, and the food and choices are amazing.  Wonderful portions and tables are safe distance from each other.  Highly recommend!
Great food great value
My favorite restaurant in the area.  The staff is very friendly and helpful.  The service is always fantastic and the food is always delicious!

The restaurant is beautiful and intimate, but the food was okay. The jerk chicken skewers had no spice or flavor. The pricing for Sangria was absurb, $14 for the tropical fruit 30 for the wine only for it to have no taste. The steak was good and the roast pork was plentiful,. Slightly disappointed .

beautiful restaurant with great food and byob! however, if there is a large party reserved in the back you are limited to dining in the front half of the restaurant. i would still highly recommend this restaurant
Cute, modern, romantic and tucked-away. I prefer this over the loud, overpriced, waterfront spots with long wait times and large parties.

We celebrated our anniversary here and it was amazing! The restaurant is so pretty and romantic with the lighting. I love the dramatic long velvet curtains. The food and service was also very good. BYOB is always a plus! The waiter convinced us (well me to step outside the box) to try the guava & cheese empanada for dessert and it did not disappoint. 😋 Will definitely be back!
Was there with my boyfriend last night, service was great and food was amazing. Just wished we could stay a little longer, it felt like they were pushing us to leave.
Wonderful. Rebecca’s is my go-to Cuban restaurant. Highly recommend for any occasion.
As always food and service was excellent.
My experience at Rebecca's was great!
the food and service was terrific as usual i always enjoy dinner at Rebeccas
Just a warning that the “outdoor” area is enclosed in glass, so if you truly want outside, you will not get it here. Overall food was fine. Service very good.
Great service, friendly and professional staff. Food was fresh and very good. The ropa  vieja was tasty and we enjoyed it very much. Servings were very generous. Will definitely go back.
the food and atmosphere are always great, the staff always friendly

Anniversary Dinner.
Will definitely be going back.
Great food and exceptionally friendly and helpful staff!.
Second time here. First time awesome experience. This time just okay. Service a little slow at times. Food is good. Atmosphere very nice with outdoor lighting and open doors
Waiter was excellent- food great- a fun evening with friends.

Incredible service!
Special occasion birthday din for my friend. 
Amazing burgers and salads as well as chicken even though chicken was a bit on th dry side the coating was delish. Loved this experience!!!
Ambiance, vibe, food and service was excellent!  I wound definitely recommend and return again!!
Totally Awesome! Recommend the cornbread and shrimp and grits

Nice atmosphere. Beautiful decor and great music. Menu not great. Don’t care for fusion dishes. Likely wouldn’t return. 
Service was ok- server was very busy but pleasant. 
I think the famous chef attracts but overrated.

We celebrated a birthday and the service was excellent the whole stay from the bar to the surprise birthday dessert. The drinks were excellent, the crab cake too spicy to feel the crab, the pasta with seafood was the best pasta I ever had. The tiramisu was nice but not the real recipe so a bit disappointed. The music is very loud and you would get five stars if you turned the volume down a bit

I have been to Red Rooster many times over the years...I live only 3 blocks away...but the food quality is going down.  They have raised their pricing, which I understand, but the quality of the product has also gone down as the pricing has gone up.  The service is always good and the ambiance is nice.  It is a great ambassador of the neighborhood, so I hope that the food improves.  People from all over come there and it is a really nice mix of people.  See photo of the Buccatini....there is only 3 shrimps and two bites of lobster...I couldn't find any crab...the photo is before anything was eaten, pretty lame when it used to contain lots of shrimp, crab and lobster!
Very welcoming, alert staff, Nice with live music and the Food was delicious.
This was our second visit, great place. Really nice vibe, super service and lovely food. Live music was fun. Hope to come back next time we are in NYC.

Dinner Before the Opera

This was a repeat visit as I was so i pressed the first time I came here about a year ago, give or take. The fried chicken is delicious, with a nice crunchy, and the hot honey drizzle gives it a nice little kick. The collards are tender and have a hint of sweet. They are braised overnight and it shows in the flavor profile. The fries were good, but nothing special. A nice side to go with the fried chicken.

Service is outstanding, and well-paced, without being pushy or feeling rushed. The vibe is very cool and gives off a feel of eclectic and relaxed, mixed in with a little bit of soul and warmth. Well worth the train ride from Midtown. This place is one of my favorites for soul food with a spin. Great food and terrific service!
Wonderful service from Cedric and crew the family and I had a wonderful time…

The emperor has no clothes or culinary skills? My crab cake was a bit dry and terribly overpriced. The greens would have my southern ancestors rolling in their graves. They were bland, undercooked and sugary with not a hint of umami which is at the heart of every pot of greens.   I was seriously underwhelmed and mortified at how people are so hypnotized by celebrity that their taste buds fall asleep.
WOW what a meal.  This place is a gem. Everything about it. The bar, the staff, the food, everything he live music. Loved it! Can’t wait to go back.
Amazing gospel brunch! Tasty food, nice service and the choir was just great.
Spectacular venue, excellent food; wonderful entertainment
The Sunday gospel lunch is an absolute must if you are visiting New York and you are around on a Sunday.  We are from England and had a great time! Sing Harlem are fantastic!

Great venue.  Catfish was outstanding.  Burgers were tasteless; McDonalds does better.

Have had many fabulous meals here.  This one was for all the wrong reasons.

Waiters very attentive and a very nice place to spend a couple of hours having a family dinner. We had 4 different dishes and 2 snacks. The snacks was clearely the best. Fresh, straight forward and crispy. The main Picadilly dish was soggy as an example. Maybe American pasta is more soggy than Italian.

Marcus Samuelsson is one of my favorite chefs. So, I was excited to eat Red Rooster. The ambience was fantastic. It is a bit tight but great food and atmosphere. I wish I could have met him, but his staff was great.

Red Rooster used to be my favorite restaurant, from the incredible food (down to the homemade ketchup) to the fabulous ambiance. Unfortunately, our first time back since the pandemic was a disappointment. The wings (appetizer) were great! The cauliflower entre I had was basically inedible and the flavors were meh. And my daughter's ketchup tasted like it came out of a bottle. Sadly disappointing!

We loved the place, veggie and chips was great, according to my son, burger was fantastic. Unfortunately, the vegetarian dish with cauliflower was less successful, more raw food than comfort food. Maybe they will change it till next time
The food is great! The service staff are all very nice and attentive.

The food was AMAZING! I had the Mac & greens and a drumstick as an appetizer. My main course was the shrimp & grits. Everything was full of flavor! Be sure to try the Yep! Chef cocktail. Will definitely visit again!
Great staff. Menu not extensive but the food is very good. I enjoyed the shrimp and grits. Definitely would dine, again.
Excellent place to eat with fabulous atmosphere, food and amazing table service!

Everything was absolutely delicious. Drinks were a bit pricey and the dishes weren’t served together.  The wait staff was super friendly.  It was loud, but we could still carry on a conversation  if we leaned in.

The food was 4/5. I ordered the appetizer wings for the table and they could have been cooked a little longer. My son liked the burger and my nephew enjoyed the chicken and waffles. I had the fish and beans, which were good.
Great atmosphere! Our waitress Amanda was very nice and welcoming. I recommend a visit!

Great experience dining at Red Rooster. Everyone who we came into contact with was very friendly and accommodating. Loved the food (shrimp and grits; catfish). Nate Lucas All Stars were an extra special addition to the experience.
Loved the live music and food. Vibrant atmosphere, fast and friendly service.
Food was delicious!   Great ambiance, friendly staff and live was added bonus.
This was a really good expirience! We are a family of four, and we all loved it!
We loved the smith experience! It’s amazing both the place and the gospel group!
It wasn't a simple lunch, it was a great show. You have to go on Sundays lunch because there is the choir and it's amazing
This was the highlight of our New York trip. Food is fabulous. Sing Harlem incredible!!
We were visiting from the UK and absolutely loved seeing Sing Harlem perform the gospel brunch.  We were also very well looked after by our server.

From the service to the food to the Gospel Brunch, Red Rooster was soooo amazing!! It’s definitely a must do when you visit NYC. We had such a great time and have already added it to the list for our next visit.
A perfect spot for Sunday brunch. Sing Harlem provides the perfect ambience.
Fantastic atmosphere, very good food and the wait/Bar staff was the best!  Must have the cornbread and deviled eggs.
Great vibe!! I loved the food, ambience, live DJ, great cocktails and wonderful desserts. Go for the pan fried catfish, asparagus, collard greens and apple tart.
Great Restaurant! Great Service! Great Food!  Great Atmosphere !  We had a great time!
Atmosphere was nice, food was pretty good, service was mediocre (unfriendly, brusque waitress who barely uttered a word beyond what was absolutely necessary).
Outstanding service and food! Will definitely come back.

This was an intriguing option and we took a flyer to check this out for Easter Brunch and we were pleasantly surprised!  The design was fantastic, the service was excellent and the food was fantastic.  Our server told us the history of the location which was great that she knew all that, including as to why it has the name it does.  The overall experience exceeded our expectations and the avocado toast was the best part of the entire meal! We can highly recommend as this was a great experience for us.

We have gone to this restaurant several times and have never been disappointed. It is a beautiful place and the food is absolutely delicious. The servers are fantastic. I highly recommend this restaurant.

The ambiance and vibe is nice and quaint. Our waitress was not very friendly or personable and and the food was subpar for the price. I was most underwhelmed by the octopus. The drinks were the most redeeming part of the night. But In the end we don’t feel our experience matched the bill.
excellent food, better than the last time i was here. the cod was the best i have ever had. Good meny.
Everything was incredible and delicious! Highly recommended and will be back!

This is my second time eating at The Milling Room. Everything was great except I felt the Prosecco was extremely overpriced. We ordered five bottles as it was a birthday celebration and 9 thirsty Ladies were in attendance. Our waiter was John who was very friendly but at times wasn’t as attentive as we would have liked him to be. At $55 per bottle I should not have to refill my own glass.

The Milling Room has been an absolute gem for brunch. Twice now, I've arrived for the first reservation at 10am on a Saturday and the place has been fantastic: light-filled from the skylight, quiet, expansive, serene. The food is really good: not fussy but a cut above standard fare. And the service is professional and human without over-stepping. Just a great experience. Also, I mistakenly reserved for the wrong day and they graciously helped me move it on very short notice without charging the no show fee.
We went to celebrate my wife’s birthday and it was perfect

Food is good for the price .. can be better . Great looking place
Add more veggie friendly options in Mains !

Overall it was a lovely experience. 
I work in the industry so I know steps of service. When our cheese plate was dropped off, we didn’t get to learn what cheeses we had. I asked a server that passed by a few minutes later and she said she’d get someone to tell us, but that didn’t happen. The cheeses were delicious, but I wish I know exactly what they were. The dish is also advertised as coming with honeycomb, but there was only a small amount of plain honey, and about 1 whole walnut worth of candied nut pieces and 4 small slices of baguette. Again, all delicious, but overall small. More bread and honey was brought upon request, for a charge. (I understand this, but also think there ought to be enough bread on the first run- and I’m a generous cheese to bread ratio kind of person.)
The entrees were brought out when we were only half finished with our apps, which is what it is. Didn’t bother me terribly, but there were plenty of open tables and it might have been 7:30, 7:45 at that point- no need to rush us. 
At the price point of the restaurant, I’d expect a more leisurely experience. 
Again, we’d return, the staff were friendly and the food was good, but I’d hope these things may be improved upon.
The Milling Room is a beautiful space with a lot of natural light. Each table has plenty of space. The food was delicious (mushroom risotto was a favorite) and the service was good.
Beautiful space and attentive service but food was not incredibly impressive for the price

Just a great experience.  Dramatic but unfussy atmosphere.  Solicitous service, very fresh fish.  Crispy potatoes were special.m, beet salad, too. We ended with a perfect cheese plate, and proper espresso and macchiata.  All in all, a great American bistro.
We had an amazing evening with a party of six and the food was delicious ❤️
Our first time back since the pandemic and Maison Pickle did not disappoint!  Food just as yummy as always and one of the best Bloody Marys I've had in a long while.  Excited to get back again soon!

As aleays
Great food
Wonderful service
Excellent cocktails
My favorite place on
UWS
Such an amazing experience. The staff helped make a really special occasion perfect, so thank you all so much!
We liked it so much we've booked to go there again soon.
Wonderful food and experience.  The gnocchi was light and fantastic.  We had the beet salad and risotto appetizer that was delicious.  The squid ink pasta and salmon were perfect.  Highly recommend!!

We loved it! And we would like to go back again.
The food, service and hospitality made our experience special.

The Milling Room never disappoints. Expertly prepared, beautifully presented delicious and healthy food, served in the gorgeous room with tall ceilings. I love the seafood options, and Branzino in saffron broth is pure genius. Definitely one of my favorite places on the UWS.
Other than a rather sullen server, we had a thoroughly delightful experience. The duck really is outstanding.
Food is interesting and really good. One of our go-tos on the UWS. Great selection of wine by the glass and cocktails. H

A Magical Meal!

The restaurant is beautiful. The food is exquisite. The service is so welcoming, intelligent, friendly, and efficient.
The memory of this meal will stay with us.❤️

We enjoyed our time at the Milling room.  We were a few minutes late, but they graciously held our table. Also, I have a garlic allergy, and usually, it is a problem, but they were able to serve me everything I ordered without any problem. Loved the vibes and the ambient. I will go back once I go back to NYC

We ordered bread because the meal seemed to be taking a long time to arrive. Our waiter asked us if toast was acceptable but I told him not to toast the bread because the two children at the table were starving waiting for our entrees. Unfortunately, our meals beat the bread coming out to the table and the waitstaff could not understand our annoyance with the bread coming out after our entrees.
Luckily, the portions of the gnocchi were so minuscule that the late arrival of the bread allowed two of the diners at our table to be somewhat satiated.
The chicken, although flavorful, was rubbery and not what we had expected.
The bathrooms were nice, although the men’s restroom literally is like a ski jump ramp.
The restaurant has a beautiful main dining room which truly is a surprise upon entering.
Great food and service.  Interesting space.  Needs just a bit more lighting, very intimate atmosphere.

Purtroppo la luce era scarsa, per leggere il menu abbiamo dovuto utilizzare la luce del telefono. Anche quando sono arrivati i piatti per vedere il contenuto abbiamo dovuto utilizzare la luce del telefono.
Fabulous food in a open and attractive space with attentive audience
Great meal with amazing staff! Can’t wait to go back and highly recommend.
Good food in nice atmosphere.  It would have been better if we did not feel continuously rushed to get done and leave so that they can free up our table.
enjoyable experience! food was great.
Our waitress was wonderful. Music was a bit loud at first.

We enjoyed the evening very much.  The overall experience was very good.  My one criticism was that the chocolate raspberry cake, though tasty, was very difficult to eat.  It was so hard one couldn’t put a spoon through it.
Worst steak I’ve ever had and when I shared with management they charged for it anyway.

I met a friend for brunch at Milling Room, already one of my favorite UWS restaurants. For brunch you get the best of the lovely, light and airy room. The service there is always friendly, warm and attentive without being intrusive. And OMG, I loved my meal - simple poached eggs on a bed of roast Brussels sprouts and heirloom carrots. I skipped the Hollandaise because - well, the obvious reasons. And I didn’t miss it at all. The vegetables were so perfectly roasted and layered.

Honestly, I think it’s my new favorite dish.

First time here and we really like it. The food was excellent and the back room with glass ceiling was cool. We had the gnocchi with truffle mushrooms, the rib eye steak with creamy peppercorn sauce and the roast chicken. All was great.
The food was amazing and service amazing and ambiance nice.

Just a heads up they automatically add gratuity to your order. My server was horrible. Waiting for drinks was long. Food Quality was delicious. I had the Colossal Salt & Pepper Lobster with Vegetable Fried Rice and baby it was DELICIOUS. The food is excellent but,  the overall service is trash. They also have a dress code if you’re wondering and it’s definitely ENFORCED.

The food was delicious and the wait staff was very kind and courteous, however the security staff/ bouncer was not very friendly and a bit rude. He did not greet us, the establishment is more catered towards an adult friendly crowd rather than a family gathering. The decor was very nice and the food portions were great.

Excellent restaurant , my party was warmly greeted by the door man as we entered, our table was ready and we  was seated by friendly staff. The  drinks and the appetizers came fast . Everything we ordered was good
The vibes and drinks were great. My only issue was the girls working in the front could really work on their attitudes. Other than that it was a good experience.
Excellent service all around but food was bland and subpar
food was nasty, expensive & when I asked for my food to be cooked a certain way it was still cooked hard.
Wonderful birthday celebration! The ambiance is top and the food was delicious.
When I arrived i had a coupon from pulsd and they denied me from using it. Then said they just stopped using it yesterday which was kind of ironic…

I think people honestly go here to take pictures and listen to music. The drinks are strong which helps get you through eating. I had a NY Sidecar, and my friend had a “Henny” colada which we didn’t see on the menu. Branson cognac was…which was spelled Cocnag on the menu. Anyhow, we ordered Lobster Rolls, Chicken Dumplings, Vegetable Fried Rice, Sweet and Sour Chicken.
Portions are really small. Rice was lacking flavor. Chicken was outnumbered by largely cut veggies, and heavily sauced and sweet. Lobster rolls were tiny and bland. Highly priced for small portioned flavorless foods. This one gets 2 snaps and a twist thumbs down!
HIGHLY RECOMMEND! The food is fres and soooo goood! Love the music and the drinks are so goodddddd 😩 I’ll be back here soon
The food was amazing! Great customer service! Will definitely be back.

The food was overpriced and basic. I’ve tasted better Chinese-American food from the hood spots. I ordered the “filet mignon and broccoli” the steak was poorly cooked and way too soft and chewy, the broccoli was extremely hard and the flavor was not up to par. Drinks were watered down and you could barely taste any alcohol. So the drinks are also overpriced! The rice was bland as well. The music was great though and staff was nice enough. It’s a stylish restaurant but the menu is very limited and overpriced for it to be high end, I’d expect high end food. 

Overall I’d give the restaurant a 5/10.

Food was great and service. However the chairs were very uncomfortable for my boyfriend. The legs were very loose and when we asked staff they said they all are like that and they were unfortunately. We switched about 5times. It put a little damper on the night.
I think it’s unfair that you guys put a limitation on your brunch. There shouldn’t be a minimum of 4 people.
It was my birthday and they made sure i really enjoyed my birthday everything was 1000/10 and im definitely coming back
Fast service! Welcoming workers. Good music, food and drinks! Will return!!

The hostess was rude 

And they sat us next to the heater which was boiling hot
I has an excellent experience at Panda’s the food the service and the atmosphere was very pleasant and enjoyable

I did the Sunday brunch and there was definitely a club vibe. The DJ was very good. I can only imagine what a Friday/Saturday night is like. As for price $$$, but no different than a midtown location. Cheers!
Great spot for a date or just hanging out with friends food is amazing staff are friendly music is great

You’re better off ordering from your local Chinese restaurant. I essentially paid $150 for a poor imitation of general Tao’s chicken, beef lo main and pepper steak. Oh and 2 drinks- one alcoholic and 1 virgin. The drinks are strong, the vibe is cool but that about it. As far as hookah goes- it’s cash only(separate from your restaurant bill) and he only had 3 flavors. Nah, I’ll pass.

The food was horrible
We had reservations for 10:30pm. When we arrived we were told we had to wait 40mins for a table. There was no where for people to sit that we’re waiting on a table. The vibe in there is great but the host at the front was not pleasant
Our server was really great she was a sweetheart
Over all i will not be going back.
My waiter was awesome and the food was exceptional!

We came to celebrate my daughter’s 13th Birthday. The Ambiance is amazing, the food is Delicious and the DJ never missed a beat! 
Definitely will be back but without the kids lol
Ralph is a excellent waiter he took great care of us
Food was definitely not worth the price. Waiter was preoccupied with taking pictures of customers at other tables. The vibe of the place is very nice. I would go again for drinks, but not for dinner.
Portion size was a bit disappointing. Crab cakes were the size of marbles.
Yeah I wouldn’t go back here.

It was my birthday and the service was poor! I enjoyed the food and music but my waiter was rude! He brought me the bill without me asking and forgot to bring out my bday cake! Didn’t even sing happy birthday or nothing!
Everything was great including the music will return again in the future.

My friend birthday
It was just the two of us . It gives lounge and restaurant vibe. The food is really good just need bigger tables. I felt like we barely had room to place our food or bags. So don’t bring a lot of stuff with you and use your smallest purse lol. The food and customer service was great. Get there early parking is crazy

Food was not impressive and drenched in sauce even when asking for light sauce. Ambiance, dj and drinks were great. Our server , Carlos did a great job at making us feel special and celebrating a friends birthday. We will definitely be back for him, the music and vibe.
I had an amazing experience. The food, ambience and service was  very GOOD!
I liked it! I will come back. This was my second time and the food and drinks are always so good.

It was very cold in the restaurant, our waitress was high as hell and the brunch menu choices are sparse. The bottomless mimosas should have flavors for the amount of money you pay for it. The drinks were strong and nasty, my filet was very chewy took 1 bite and spit it out I wish we had gone somewhere else for the amount of money we paid for food we didn’t eat and drinks that weren’t enjoyable.
I loved the restaurant my only critique would be there should be a different section for people who want to smoke hookah. I was eating next to someone who was smoking no good

So I really like the decor the food was delicious. We had the first reservation of the night so it was empty. But I wanted to beat the crowd especially since I was with my kids for a little date night.  My only issue was the 20% gratuity for a table of 3.
Food was ok the 2nd time ard first time was better drinks wasn't good 2nd time either lil pricey but I'll go back
Great food and service
Great vibes. Food was amazing drinks were perfect! Def a good place to come with a group of friends

This was my son’s 32 bday . The table was perfect for the right of us! Sergio, our waiter was outstanding- attentive, gave great suggestions, and served us well! The food was outstanding- steak, chicken parm, salads, quac, lobster toast, prosciutto, and desserts were phenomenal !!
We had a lovely time! We will absolutely return!
Great staff and the chicken parm “pizza” makes it a 5 star trip every time
Todo bien en general, servicio profesional. PRECIO DESORBITADO! Vino intocable.

Delicious food, pasta and wine, Wilson was the best waiter.
But extremely noisy.
We had a great birthday dinner here. Our waiter JC was so kind and attentive. Food at QI is excellent, but the portions are large. You definitely get a lot for the price.
Hangar steak was super tough. Everything else was delicious. Our waiter was awesome.
Good and service were great.  The staff were very attentive and the food was fresh and delicious.  Would definitely go again.
Top notch service and amazing food… traditional, yet adventurous with a lot of thought and care given to every ingredient. Incredible value for the experience!

Made a reservation for my birthday dinner, they lived up to our expectations.  Service was great, food was incredible. I had the Spicy lobster rigatoni alla vodka and finished with the chocolate olive oil cake.
They gave us the perfect corner booth to celebrate my special day.
The server was wonderful and so friendly and professional! My main issue is wine bottle prices, meaning so few bottles under $100.

Food and service were outstanding especially given it was Easter Sunday.  The corn "brulee" is ridiculously good and a must have.  We were pleased with all of our entrees (branzino, filet, pasta with lobster, berkshire pork chop.
Food was very good. Our waitress Leslie was exceptional!!!
Easter Sunday lunch after st Patrick’s cathedral mass

I was seated 30 minutes after my reservation time and do not appreciate when paying the bill that the waiter stand over my shoulder watching. Otherwise my steak was very good, but portions of my wife’s food were cold.
Amazing dining experience all around. Everything we ordered was delicious. Energetic  ambiance. Will definitely come back.
One of the best dining experiences I’ve had in NYC
Love Quality Italian! It has become a tradition every time we visit NYC and it never disappoints. The food and the staff are top tier.
Fantastic food and wine!  We ended our spring break trip with a family dinner at Quality Italian.
Went for a Birthday dinner, the place, service and food were excellent. Definitely will come back.

6p reservation, sat within 10 minutes, ordered a few salads to start and waited nearly 70 minutes to have them plated.  then 7 dishes all hit the table at once, no serving spoons.  had to flag down a wait for serving utensils, he brought us back literally teaspoons.  manager was nice, took off the appetizers.  food was largely good though some of it cold.  the place is always busy, you can see they're all in the weeds trying to service everyone.  probably ought to reduce the number of tables quite honestly.  if i go again, i'll try the first (or last) seating when it's not a zoo.

Meh and not cheap. I think overall the food is just a little too extra. Do you need sausage on top of chicken parm? My lobster rigatoni with vodka sauce was so salty i couldn't stand it. The people who ordered steak in our party were happy.

Great restaurant, we come here a few times a year when visiting the city, however the waitress we had was a bit rude, we had 3pm reservations and showed up a few minutes early she started off telling us the kitchen is closing soon and to order quickly…then why take reservations if the kitchen is closing?? She rushed everything then disappeared and we ended up having someone else.

What an amazing experience.. there was a couple of minutes before our table was ready.. we enjoyed a cocktail at the bar(delish) before being escorted to a fabulous table with a window view of the city. It was my boyfriend’s birthday and he was greeted with a sweet card from the staff, it was a great touch and appreciated. Out waiter made the experience at this restaurant next level! He was funny, kind, tentative and knowledgeable. He made sure we had everything we needed and surprised my boyfriend at the end of dinner with a little dessert with a candle. We have been to this restaurant before and we agree that this is our “special” place. Thank you for everything!
Underwhelming experience, wouldn’t return due to the food being pretty bland. Impeccable service tho

Impressive, beautiful and well managed restaurant. The food is delicious and plated lovely. Everyone is welcoming and we enjoyed ourselves here. We will be back! Highly recommend! You really can’t go wrong with anything on the menu.
Amazing dinner and amazing service. Thank you Jasmine
My favorite spot and Michael C was amazing as always
This place used to be awesome.  Now it’s horschit

Highly recommend Yellowtail (Crudo) and Beefsteak Tomato for appetizer.
We had the famous Chicken Parm Pizza as a main. It was a mistake. No way it can be finished by two people and took away the room for dessert, and honestly it wasn’t anything special other than the shape of it, and the meat itself was not juicy or tender.
It was a nice evening for some friends to get together. I didn’t love the service, but the wine list and food was great.
Pre birthday dinner for March Dad and April son .. good choice
We could not have asked for better service!  The food was delicious!!  Great dining experience!
Great food great service easy location don’t overthink it just go
We brought friends visiting from Minnesota.  The food was good all around and we were surprised with a complimentary appetizer.
Service is top notch! Love this place and go on business

Due to traffic and public transport issues, we arrived 30-45 min late to our reservation. The front of house staff was very hospitable and had no issue seating us despite the delay.

In addition to that, we also only had an hour to dine. Our waiter, Sergio, was accommodating, friendly, and very helpful getting us a quality meal in our limited time. I’d highly recommend requesting him when making a reservation.

Not a single critical comment to make about the food. The tomato stracciatella salad was full of authentic flavor while remaining simple and fresh. The gluten free gnocchi used for dietary restrictions were big and fluffy & the perfect delivery mechanism for their outstanding pesto sauce. And their sautéed spinach could convince anyone veggies are underrated.

I really don’t think you can go wrong here.

Ps. If you’re looking for a more intimate space for your meal, request the back room. It’s not quite as energetic as their main dining room.

Chicken Parm pizza was really good… enough for 3-4 people.  It was a fun presentation too . Chopped salad and octopus were delicious. The  orange sorbet was yummy.  The cocktails were delicious and strong. Service top notch. The large room was rather noisy. All in all a great experience. Thank you!
Electric atmosphere. We got there at 6:30 and was hopping, left at 9:45 and was hopping! Service stellar, loved the apps and my steak delicious.

Amazing experience with Joseph. I have been in the restaurant industry for over a decade and his delivery and overall hospitality is second to none. I can’t say enough about how well he handled our party of 9 thanks again Joseph. The food and beverage with all of the quality branded restaurants is always remarkable. We loved the chicken parm pizza, the fusilli, agnolotti, and the steak also all of the desserts were amazing. This place is great for anyone visiting from out of town if you want to show someone a wonderful time in NYC.  Thank you again to the team at QI.
Great food and great server! Nice wine list! Got seated quickly and waiter was very attentive.
Food was excellent. My son had the pizza and I had bass wrapped in potatoes.
Great ambiance, service and food! A great UWS gem and will definitely return! They hosted us  lovely time for Easter Dinner.

I think they were short on staff, because the service was kind of scattered and unreliable. Greeting us at the door was also pretty complicated for them- we had a reservation and yet no one was around when we got there and I had to push my way in to talk to a hostess. The manager/owner didn't seem to be as on top of things to help out with the lack of staff. She was trying, but it was kind of hectic. The food was good, though, but my child's French toast was a little undercooked.
Everything was amazing!! Food and server!!
The food and service were excellent.  We especially loved the Tartare Di Sofia appetizer!

We’re regulars by this visit was marred by terrible service. We asked our server about the Brussel sprout side and he didn’t seem to know much about it but we ordered it anyway. He asked if we wanted bread for the table. We said no, but 2-3 times servers came by to give bread. My order was wrong (no potatoes, when I just asked for less potatoes) and the Brussels never came. We asked for it at least 4 times, including when the rest of our meal arrived. Our server never came back to ask how everything was. To me, that’s critical for full-service restaurants. And it was not that busy. He had time where he was just standing around, but he never checked in to see how everything was. Very disappointing, esp for the money.
Nice service good food it's just a bit over my comfort zone for price per portion size.

I chose the lasagna and it was not tasty. It was” mushy” and bland. For an Italian restaurant I was disappointed. My boyfriends steak on the other hand was cooked to perfection! I’ll order that next time.

Extremely slow service, over 30 minutes before our orders were taken. Then the table next to us, who arrived after we did, got served. When the mediocre food arrived some of it was hot and some not. We ordered meatballs as an appetizer. When they arrived it became clear that they weren't browned before cooking in the sauce. So, they were mushy and the only flavor was the sauce. That same sauce came with everyone's main course and pasta. Everything ended up tasting the same. We never had our water refilled let alone the waiter asking how our food was.  Not good.
Exceptional hospitality, great customer service, food & ambiance
We were a large group. Every dish was terrific and nobody felt rushed. I particularly liked the Branzino.
Really nice experience, good food at more than reasonable prices, the owner is very nice: they brought the wrong order, and he corrected it discounting the price of the dish from the bill.
Service was great and ambiance too, food was sub par. Bread was cold and stale, both pasta dishes over cooked and  very bland. Drink where good and again service was great
Lovely Warm Cheerful. Well located. Attentive staff. Tasty food.
The staff was absolutely great . The food was not so great. The prices were not worth it because the food was not good.

This restaurant is NOT BYOB, unless you consider a $45 corking fee BYOB..  definitely would not have chosen to dine here if we knew this beforehand.  The fettuccine and margherita pizza were yummy, but when we requested more bread, it never came.  Definitely won’t be back.  We should have gone to Carmine’s..

This was my 2nd time dining at one the Serafina location both occasions were great. The food the service was great. 

I am planning to dine at Serafina other locations soon. In the New York region. 

Perfect place to dine with friends or first date.
Great family holiday lunch! My granddaughters love the calamari here and there is something for everyone. Great time- the eggplant appetizer is my favorite meal!
Service was horrendous, restaurant was extremely loud , food took more than an hour to come out , don’t recommend at all.

The ambience is nice...casual but not too much. The service was good...we arrived early for the reservation and we were quickly seated. The waiter attending us was on point and very attentive. He answered all of our questions that we had about the menu. The food was delicious...there were no complaints and we had a group of 6 w/4 kids. We will return in anticipation of another great outing.

This is a lovely Serafina with a real neighborhood feel with the same high quality food and service that you expect from Serafina.
I highly recommend Serafina 105 for brunch, lunch or dinner for its warm and friendly atmosphere and delicious food!
it was a really good. good was good service was great. Armando was our waiter and he took care of us.
Great food - Service has opportunities.
Great experience and service! The food was wonderful.
Always a great meal, great service, great atmosphere!
Serafina was good, felt like we were rushed alittle, but overall good experience.
Service was slow and the waiter continually forgot to bring the drinks.   Ordered cheesecake based on being told it was original.  It wasn’t; it was lemon.   Would not have ordered lemon.
Perfect night out. The most amazing service I’ve ever had and the food was delicious. Can’t wait to come back
Serafina doesn't disappoint.  Eating outside quietly on a fine night was very nice -- especially since 3 out of 4 participants were hard of hearing.
As always a delicious and enjoyable meal
Serafina 105 overall was a great experience. The service staff was very attentive. The food was flavorful and the wine/cocktail was good also.

The staff is friendly and helpful. There is an extensive menu and everything was good. Not fabulous, not to die for, but good. The prices are reasonable. My Chianti was very pleasant as was my son's Paper-plane. We ate outside and the heat lamps made it very comfortable. If you're looking for a reasonably priced good Italian restaurant, Serafina is a good choice.
Good food. Good service. Comfortable seating.

Serafina is always a great place to go for good food & good service. I remember when there used to be 1 in the city And of course it was the hardest place to get into so I'm pleased there are several locations To go and enjoy
good gluten free pasta - a rare find! got a terrible stomach ache after, but only because I ate so much.

I have been going there for years. It's always been pleasant. But, they have a new policy. No refills on regular coffee. We were charged for every cup of plain coffee we got. The manager was unsure if this was policy or just a new waiter who didn't know better. She ended up charging us for 4 cups instead of 7. Meaning one refill is allowed.

No one told us about the new policy and the waiter was snooty about it when we asked to speak to the manager. The prices have already been raised I don't even understand only allowing one refill (if that is the policy) at a brunch. We'll be looking to go elsewhere from now on.
Delicious autumn! When you eat food with your family and friends, it always tastes better!
My vegan choice and my friend's pasta were both delicicous.
The lobster ravioli was very good, but everything else was somewhat average for a not so average price.

The service was the stuff of another restaurant - Serafina 105 was not bustling on a Saturday night at 6:30 and there was no line to grab a table. Why on earth our appetizers were rushed by the 2nd course literally flying to the table, plates clattering is just beyond me. Waiter was rushing from the moment we sat down at the table, we were pushed to order and somewhat upsold. There was no interest in creating an environment for the customers (4 of us).  The experience doesn't invite me to return at all, it was that bad and jarring. 

On the positive side, we were seated outside as requested and the pastas ordered were moderately good.

Salad was uninspiring, steak was loaded with fat, fries were soggy. My wife did like her burger a lot.
The last thing our waitress was interested in was serving us!
Excellent food and service! This place is consistently good. Servers are caring and knowledgeable.

Always a delight, with interesting specials enlarging the menu of old favorites. The new space is more mid-century than the former 20s bistro look but equally charming. 

Service last night was impeccable and friendly!

Overall good and might return. Chicken club fortunately 2 of us shared. Had a lot of aioli and a heavy dish. Sausage excellent.
Service just ok. Had to wave several times before waitress ever looked around and noticed us. Happened 3 x. Staff courteous but poorly trained.
Atmosphere lovely.
Great day to sit outsides and enjoy lunch. We both had mussels and fries and cleaned our plates. Service was attentive but not intrusive and we will return!

Had Easter dinner here, party of 3 with 1 wheelchair.  I had made reservations a few days before. They accommodated us at a conveniently located table.  I had the braised lamb, which was delicious! We also enjoyed the potato leek soup and the shrimp appetizer.  Be advised that bread is provided by request only.  Overall, it was a pleasant experience.
Delightful French brunch with lovely, well-curated menu

The staff and setting were wonderful, the “new” Cafe D’Alsace is a beautifully designed and renovated space. Unfortunately, the food was very disappointing. I went for brunch on Easter with a friend. We both ordered the French toast and it was very, very dry, even though we had specifically mentioned to the waiter that we both wanted it creamy on the inside as French toast should be. The waiter took our orders back and returned within 5 minutes with 2 new orders. They were not much better, tasteless and soggy this time  (and not even hot) as if the chef had just poured plain milk over the bread to soften it. Obviously not coming back anytime soon.
Great place for a celebratory lunch.  And the best eggs benedict I've had in years.
Food is excellent. Service was subpar to borderline bad. Fill up the coffee cup all the way!

The only reason I didn’t give the  restaurant 5 stars was that they appeared to be a bit short staffed. Our server was 5 stars but had way too many tables that she seemed to be responsible for.  Food was excellent and overall a very pleasant dining experience.
Best Eggs Benedict I ever had.  I had been there for dinner but never brunch.  I will return.
Cafe D’Alsace has upped its game—foie gras and wonderful salmon. Our waiter was terrific !

Always great - delicious food, great wines.
Please bring back chopped salad on menu!!!
Pork chop so good - how do you do it?
Food was fabulous. Wine selection excellent. Staff attentive, friendly and knowledgeable.
Birthday lunch . Unhurried and relaxed.. a perfect setting  for catching up with good friends and celebrating . I will be back next time I am in NYC

Cafe D'Alsace is my favorite restaurant on the UES.  From the time that you enter, you are warmly welcomed to a beautiful environment.  The food is exceptional, the service is excellent which enables the dining experience to be wonderful!

Stay awesome, Cafe D'Alsace!
Very good food and atmosphere. Excellent wine list and very authentic options. Great overall experience. Highly recommend!
Excellent food and service.  I totally recommend eating here.
I love that I can go to Cafe d'Alsace on a Sunday afternoon and have a beautiful weekend lunch and leave with the feeling as though I was on vacation.
D'Alsace is a neighborhood standard for brunch. The food and drinks are top notch in quality, presentation, and speed. The beautiful interior and friendly staff complete the experience.

Reserved table for four in center at 7pm. Arrived a little before 7. Unfortunately,
only center table available was the one closest to host desk. Very nice host suggested
comfortable banguet table in corner in back. However, our friends who sat on chair side very distracted by noise behind them from large party.
 Overall, we had a nice evening.
Excellent food with first grade servers, and a lovely space for dinner.

Cafe D'Alsace is absolutely outstanding!  From the exquisite preparation of the food, to the service, to the ambiance, Cafe D'Alsace delivers.

The Somaliere is excellent, as well!  There is no better restaurant on the upper east side!

Midweek lunch was lovely.  I love their Pamplemousse cocktail!  I had their wonderful hamburger with Roquefort and onions.  I'd been craving it for a while, and it was as delicious as ever.  My friend enjoyed her mussels.  We shared their heavenly apple tart.

Service was outstanding, from the warm greeting to the perfect table service.  

Just one very minor complaint that the music was a bit too loud, and they weren't able to turn it down.
We had a wonderful meal and a lovely time. The food was delicious. The staff was attentive, and it was a pleasant place to go in.

We visit family in NYC very often and our go to restaurant is Cafe D’Alsace.  The food is consistently delicious and we have enjoyed every meal we have had.  We recommend the French onion soup and the frisée salad. 
Staff is very nice and accommodating
Amazing place, got even better after moving to the new location across the street.

Started off with the country board of cheese and meats.....lovely presentation, very tasty meats with enough for the four of us.  Entrees very very good: Hanger Steak, Atlantic Cod, Scallops and a Burger.  All were good portions and extremely delicious. Cocktails were generous pours!! Definitely will return.
The chocolate truffle tart was a great recommendation! Service was perfect! delicious and consistent, always - xoxo N
Husband birthday. Great server. Delicious food and wine representing the Alsace region.
Absolutely loved the social lunch we here. Beautiful interior, excellent service and absolutely divine dishes to enjoy. I cannot wait to return!
Great meal great hostess great space overall a perfect lunch!!

I particularly want to single out the woman who served our table, but unfortunately I do not know her name.  We were four older adults with varying needs and she was very patient and courteous and understanding.  And cheerful!
Each of us was very pleased with our selections, which were presented well.  I had the beets appetizer, which was a more than sufficient amount for lunch.  My table mates had the salmon and lentils entrees, which were so generously sized, they took some home.  All the food was fresh and delicious.
I loved the room, the table was comfortable and roomy.  My only complaint is that for older diners, the music makes conversation a challenge.  
That said, I look forward to returning.
Food and wine were legit; as were the cocktails. Fun buzzy vibe. Great service. Loved it.

Great atmosphere and great food!  Will be back! 
Staple to the community.
We always love the food and now our friends to do!  Wonderful meal and service.

Very busy evening on St Pat’s Day. Food was up to par as usual. Cocktails were very slow for some reason. Apps arrived prior to initial cocktails. Bone marrow one of my favorites here - usual portion of 4 bones but very little marrow in 3 of 4. Chicken, cod, sausages were excellent. This remains our standby spot in Yorkville.

Cafe D'Alsace is awesome!  The food is delicious and presented beautifully.  The Sommelier  is always available, professional and friendly.  The service is top notch.

I highly recommend this establishment!

Very rude staff. The hostess rolled her eyes when I checked out the back room for the first time and then asked to be seated in the front. The server would come and go in seconds before we could get in a word. He also did not take anaphylactic allergies seriously as I had to insist that he note them for the chef. The bus boy spent more time and patience caring for us than the waiter. Food was great as always though.

Excellent food & drinks, we stop in almost every time we’re in town from Texas. I feel confident, referring my friends to stop in!
See you again soon,

Make a rezo!
Porto's is fantastic! Go and try the Cacio Peppe pasta and actually anything else! It's all good

We’ve been wanting to try Porto for a while. It’s on a very tiny street in North Bergen, they don’t have a parking lot but luckily on a Sunday later in the day there was street parking available. Very tiny restaurant decorated with a lot of celebrity portraits, they were playing the movie, the Misfits, and although it was fun, I’m not really sure how it tied in with the restaurant, but that’s OK. It was fun to look at.
All of the servers were very nice and attentive, although one thing that constantly annoys me in most restaurants in this country is that servers come and clear things off the table while you’re in the middle of eating. That is something that servers should be taught not to do.
My husband and I shared a pizza, and he had a puttanesca pasta dish and I had an eggplant stocked with tomato and mozzarella for my Main Course. All were adequate, but nothing was really spectacular although there were components of things that were nice.
The pizza, which apparently is supposed to be done in a wood oven, was not very crisp, and was definitely under done. The sauce was moderately OK.
My eggplant stack looked beautiful when it came out. It was fried eggplant with tomato and cheese and an arugula salad on the top but nothing really was flavorful enough to stand on its own, and even when you eat the pieces together, there was really no seasoning. My husband said his pasta dish was very good, and he thinks that the pasta was homemade. That’s always nice. He did say it was a little over salted but it did have capers and olives in it so of course it’s going to be salty . We did not have dessert.
I would definitely give the restaurant another try,

Glad this place is now on Open Table. Started with fried artichokes and a Margherita pizza- both delicious! For dinner, both people in my party had the bolognese sauce which they enjoyed. I had the orecchiette and have to say was probably the best I’ve had. We would have loved to have some bread to devour the delicious sauce but the only bread available is focaccia which you have to purchase. I would suggest offering a complimentary basket of bread as most Italian restaurants do. That was the only thing missing from a perfect meal.
Best pizzas EVER. Pasta was just ok. They need better salad options. But overall love the place.
Love the food and service here!!! The new drinks on the menu are top notch, can’t wait for the summer drinks!

Wonderful food! Brick oven pizzas are so original . Love the options . Tiramisu awesome. Bar selection pretty good. We ended the night and ordered lemoncello spritzers, you nailed it. I thought was in Ana Capris
Wow! The best meal I’ve had in a while!!! So delicious pasta and pizza! I am definitely coming back soon
We were celebrating my husband’s birthday last night and had a wonderful time. The service was great! Vicky was very professional and knowledgeable and the food was phenomenal!
Dinner. Great pizza and pasta.
Amazing food and place service was awesome. Top notch can’t wait to come back here! Antonio is the best such a wonderful place and ambiance

Good not great. Been here about 20+ times - felt it might have been different this time. Maybe because it was after 8?
Service was impeccable as always but pasta was bland, mushy (not al dente). Almost as it they didn’t salt the water too - literally just bland all around. 6/6 of us felt they way. A shame
We were celebrating our daughter’s 18th birthday and her acceptance to Boston University!!! Thank you for making her day special.
We were recommended this restaurant by family and it did not disappoint! Great food and friendly service! The food was mouthwatering good and the prices were decent.
Great food and great service.  Pasta was excellent and a fantastic value.
Food was great as always and the servers were fast and attentive.
Veal Parm was the best we’ve had.  Mushroom ravioli was so delicate.  Excellent, attentive service.  Good value for what you get
Excellent value if you are doing their pasta and salad! Great before the theater as they pay attention to that.

Wonderful food and excellent service for a meal in the theater district. They are very aware that they are servicing theater goers and make sure you are served and on your way before showtime. We had the pasta special which was delicious and very affordable.
We really enjoy coming here when we come to NYC. The food and service is always excellent, we look forward to returning.

Food and service outstanding, highly recommend “Joes” veal chop.  We also shared the porterhouse and hanger steak cooked to perfection! Little noisy but it is NYC, overall great place perfect for before the theatre!
Always a great meal and the service is impeccable

Used to come here on a regular basis 5-7 years ago and have such fond memories, went back recently to find everything was up to par but the food. My dish was bland and my side was undercooked. Upon informing our server they promptly offered to fix it but due to time I could wait. My spouse’s dish was nothing special and so I won’t be going back for some time until I hear something in the kitchen has changed.
Our meal was excellent. Best server we have ever had! Can’t wait to return.

We love Becco and get there a few times a year. This was the second time that we had to flag down our waiter because the pasta trio never came. The value is great for NYC and the wine list is wonderful. Definitely recommend it to everyone.
Everything was delicious and I can’t wait to go back.

What a wonderful experience! The staff and service was just stellar; perfect! The food was delicious! My only regret was that I couldn't take my left overs as we were going directly to the theater. I wish we could have brought them with us, because it was all just so good! I was treating my 15 year old grand daughter to dinner and the theater, and she kept saying how she felt special in the restaurant and it was the best chicken parm she had ever eaten! 5 stars are not enough

The experience was pretty disapointing. We were placed by the bar and people waiting for the table were standing/ sitting literaly over my head, from time to time puling my chair. The pasta was overcooked, not at all al dente. The people who served us were changing and didn't know what to serve to whom. The entrees didn't come in the same time.
The restorant can obviously serve 30% people less, in chasing the profit the quality unfortunately goes down.
Was hot and crowed and food was mediocre. Haven’t been there in 4 years— quality is down.
Great food and service! Enjoyed dinner prior to going to “Sweeney Todd”!
As always the food is consistently very good and of all the times I ate tonight I was able to meet Lidia which was a bonus.
Convenient to theaters, attentive and kind staff, but food was middling for the price.
Went pre theater for my birthday and sat upstairs it was lovely
Daughter in law and 2 granddaughters evening at the theater preceded by a wonderful dinner at Becco. Excellent!!
We ate there before going to see Hamilton. Kid friendly. And everyone enjoyed it.

The food was outstanding - even by NYC standards. There were six people in our party and every dish was delicious. The two bottles of Rose were excellent and the waitstaff was wonderful. Except for being asked to wrap up and leave at 10:30ish, it was a perfectly lovely evening.
Thank you Gary and Daisy. You made our evening delightful.

I was brought the wrong order, and when I told the waiter I was told I was the one who was wrong. Also, they served all 3 of their daily pastas in the same bowl with their sauces mixed together. Completely overrated and a waste of money.

Excellent food. Enjoyed the unlimited 3 pasta dishes for 29.95.
Waiters were very attentive, and the restaurant is attractive.
Good solid Italian food on Restaurant Row.  I made a reservation and was seated at the bar, not an issue for a party of 1 but good to know.  A table would have been easier to navigate.
How can you beat a pasta symphony? All you can eat of high quality, delicious cuisine and they’re practically giving it away. Our 2nd time here and won’t be the last.

How many times have I said that this is my go-to place for Italian food, except for my kitchen.  It's that good.  This time we too friends who have never been here.  Loved it!  the sinfonia di pasta is the big draw, but the menu is wonderful, too.
Mangia!
Always a great experience.  An all time family favorite for special occasions.

As always, another wonderful meal at Becco's.  Went for something completely different and we were not disappointed.  Would like the server to offer recommendations, besides the specials.  Had a wonderful wine, that took them a while to find.  All in all a great experience.
As always, Becco does not disappoint!. Pre-theatre

Our family has a tradition of coming here before we go to evening plays/musicals and we love it for what it is - a nice place to have a wonderful pasta dinner with wine and quick service. It’s a bit loud and frenetic, partly because the spaces are small but also likely because people are out for a night in the city.
The 3 pastas were fabulous. Great waitress. Great veal piccata. The only bad thing was they charged us for dessert when it was my wife’s birthday.

really nice restaurant right in the theatre district.  Based on ambiance and price you don't realize /remember you are in the theatre district.  A really great experience that added to our "dinner and a show" evening.  Great food, great wine, - started the table with nice bread and breadsticks with dipping sauce as well as a plate of olives. It only got better from that and that with my wine was all I needed to start!  Will absolutely go back again.

Ate at Becco for our anniversary and as has been my experience every time, it never disappoint!  Excellent food, specials and pasta and wine offerings were reasonably priced and perfect. Can’t say brag enough about this restaurant.
Went to the theater first and had early dinner. Food was good, service was fine but it is very loud.

Ordered pasta with butter and wanted small spaghetti pieces, but came as regular spaghetti. Pasta was soaked in too much butter and was not edible.

Ordered Salmon which was totally overcooked and very well done, even crisp at the bottom.

Waiter was not attentive

Sorry about review and been there previously when much busier and better  overall for dinner.
This restaurant became One the favorite restaurant at NYC.
Amazing each time, love this place . Excellent with kids
Our to go place, always great service along with amazing food and cocktails
Baby Jem salad was very bland. The dressing wasn’t very good, just no zip. The beets or whatever the root veggies was was too raw and not seasoned at all…
Such a perfect place for a dinner date. The staff is always so friendly and great.

Beautifull Restaurant. Went there for Brunch with my wife, had the boozy brunch option and we had a great time. Great food, great service and amazing ambience. The Nicoise Salad is a must. Just beautifull. We will definetly go back.

This is the best Italian restaurant north of 86th street. Tremendous value for the exceptional service and the ambience is moderate noise. Great decoration and lighting. While also giving a personal and warm touch.

I will be coming back again soon.
Loves the cute and quaint spot! Ordered the bolognese and it was delicious! Pasta is so fresh. Also order the chocolate soufflé and was the best ending to a night out with my girlfriend!

We had not dined there for over 9 months after a terrible experience, but decided to give them another try and we're glad we did.  The food continues to be very good - we love the cauliflower appetizer and the penne a la vodka.  We also enjoyed the beet salad and the angliotti.  And the desserts (chocolate souffle and tiramisu) were both outstanding!  The service was definitely improved from our last visit, but still a bit uneven.  While everyone is friendly, we had to ask a few times to get bread, and some of the timing from the kitchen and the servers seemed off.  At least this time they acknowledged it and made some accommodation for the inconveniences, which was very much appreciated.
Fabulous duck! Wonderful roasted chicken! And scrumptious burrata salad! We are regulars!
Great food selection and cocktails 🍸, service was top notch

Last night I dined with my friend. She ordered the fish and I ordered the bolognese.  My bowl was filled so much that I couldn't eat it all. Half the portion would have been enough. But it sure was delicious. Thank you.
Food was cold , reserved a table inside but when we came nothing was ready. Service was bad , waiters were forgiving forks or something all the time

Excellent service. Our waiter, Carlos, was prompt when we asked for something and kept checking on us on a regular basis. The food was great. The short beef raviolis were outstanding. We ordered them again to take home. The risotto was very tasty, not too much cheese. The mushroom appetizer was also delicious. The only negative was the noise level. People were really enjoying themselves!

We will definitely go there again.
We love eating at Cibo e Vino and eat here weekly! Tonight we had the beet and burrata salads, roast chicken, pasta bolognese and risotto special. All were simply delicious!

My cousins Ciara, Niamh, Ava and I all had a lovely dining experience at Cibo e Vino! We shared Penne Vodka, Steak Tartare, Roasted Cauliflower and Truffle fries. The food is delicious. The service was excellent! The ambiance is warm and inviting with a floral flair. The staff was very accommodating as my cousin Ciara was celebrating her birthday last night and they placed a candle on her Italian cheese cake and sang Happy Birthday in unison with us. Thanks you Cibo e Vino!
I went on a date for lunch, I’ve been here for dinner before and loved it. The eggs Benedict was ok, noting too crazy, probably not worth the price. None the less perfect date spot with good food

Things started out well, attention to the table but the whole party was not present. Once they were return service to the table was unacceptably infrequent. Too much having to find/flag down the server. Finally orders taken explicitly and emphatically indicating serious GLUTEN/DAIRY allergies. And yet, the burger came out with cheese and the other entree came with gluten; completely the wrong item!  What was also very disappointing for this caliber and price point of restaurant, was the auctioning of the food; “who got the this; who got the that.”  Deeply disappointed. And the WAIT for the food to come out was too long. And it initially came out in segments instead of all at once. Then the last to arrive were of course the two entrees with mistakes that had to be sent back. Finally to top it off, the bill arrives to reflect 2 BOTTLES of Prosecco instead if 2 glasses that were actually ordered. A total disappointment and utterly embarrassing. The restaurant wasn’t even that busy. You all need to do sooooo much better, as even the local diner’s service is superior.
Food and service was amazing!

What a beautifull place, lovely ambience simply beautifull. Everything was just perfect, there was a rose and a candle on rvery table. The food cane quick and was delicious, the service was on point.
A true gem on the upper west, a place worth visiting.
Outstanding food and cocktails as always, romantic ambience and good service.
Went for the Valentines day deal. Servers were great. The grilled octopus  was delicious and the Black ink Spaghetti was nice and spicy. Overall would highly recommend.  We will be back
-went for Valentine’s Day and was amazing. The vibe was awesome and the service was really good!!
Pre-fixe Valentine’s Day dinner was an excellent choice of food. Looking forward to our next visit
The grilled octopus and pastas were excellent, service was attentive and lovely. A local favorite, will come back again and again!
Best penne alla vodka I’ve had in my entire life. Such a beautiful spot, doesn’t feel like NYC it’s like a mini vacation!
Undercooked my steak a little, however, gave complimentary wine because of it. Lovely decor.
Cold poorly cooked food
I was very pleased with my experience and definitely plan to dine here again!
Great neighborhood destination. Pretty restaurant, good food and large portions. Will definitely return.
Delicious food. Excellent service. Highly recommend
My favorite place on UWS, however you’ll need a reservation for the weekends.
We had a wonderful meal. The server was aw
