Panzanella are a very classic plate made with soaked bread. Unfortunately, that is not what we got. Instead, we were sent hard croutons, very similar the ones you can buy at grocery shopping. We also ordered soup of the day that supposed to be potato and leek. It was good, but I could not taste leek at all. So I can say that was a regular soup like I cook at home. Nothing special. Dessert was also disappointed. Again you can buy similar in any grocery. It was forgotten the entree with breads and olives. That one just came after our appetizer. Not a perfect time, right?!

Went there with a friend for Restaurant Week. The Prix Fixe offering was great. The portions were very generous and the food was delicious. Ambience was warm and inviting and the service was spot on. We had a thoroughly enjoyable time
and would definitely recommend this restaurant.

Very impressed with the whole experience. The cauliflower appetizer was delicious as was the agnolotti!
The cocktails were great.  Service was wonderful.

We hosted a proposal celebration brunch for our daughter and future son-in-law and their 32 guests.  Aleks and his staff did an amazing job to creature a beautiful atmosphere, plan a diverse menu to meet everyone's dietary needs and to provide outstanding waiter service throughout the event.  Plus, the food was delicious and plentiful!  If you are planning a proposal in Central Park and would like to gather family and friends to celebrate with you, this jewel box of a restaurant has the sparkle you will need for your special day!   💍💜
As always Cibo exceeds in every expectation in food, drinks and service.

I love this place cute vibe good service nice waiters good food and perfect price. Although there’s one thing that always gets on my nerves I hate HATE the iPhone things instead of real checks. It brings the place down so much it’s feels gross, cheap, less beautiful feels like a Applebees. Please for the love of restaurants take it away we see phones all day I don’t want to see it over my pastas.

I’ve dined at this local restaurant a number of times but only twice during the Covid era—once last summer for lunch and last night for dinner 6 PM by reservation with a friend visiting from Washington DC. Straight out our experience was degraded by excessive sound levels from the background music system. I asked our waiter to please turn down the sound level. No lreduction resulted. The sound levels actually increased. Frustrated I went to reception desk and again requested lower sound levels. By then my friend and I were contemplating paying our bill and leaving for another spot nearby. Shortly, a manager offered to move us outside to the Covid sidewalk enclosed shed that he said would br quieter because it is further from the loudspeakers in the main dining room. We moved. Initially it was quieter but sound levels gradually crept up as more patrons were seated. By this time we had ordered and in what seemed like a flash the entrees arrived (almost too quickly considering their complexity). Nevertheless, they were quite tasty and much better than the noisy ambience.

We ordered apps and 2 mains (mussels which about half the restaurant ordered them too) and a niçoise salad which seemed like a pretty basic item).  The apps came out nice and quick but the mains took forever, we had to ask the server if they forgot about us.  Two tables sat after we'd finished our apps and they had their mains served before our arrived.  The cocktails and food were amazing, we'll come back, but maybe I'll order a burger instead of the niçoise salad this time.
Classic French cuisine in a bistro setting with professional service. A good value.
Always a great meal with great service. A hidden neighborhood restaurant although not that much of a secret.
Great value and classic bistro food on Thursdays.  Attentive service and table wine come with the special meal.  A little noisy but the crowd having a good time.
Always good....Especially enjoy the Swordfish Burger
The portions were tasty but small. The outdoor pods were comfortable.
Love the charm and coziness, the reliably delicious food, and thoughtful service.

I booked Cafe Du Soleil for a dinner for our team at one of our rare offsites.  It was delightful! Everyone found something to like on the menu, and they were very gracious about letting us share plates and so on.  The table we were placed at fit us perfectly (there were 6 of us) and while it wasn't super-quiet, we didn't have any problems having a conversation, which is often a big issue in New York restaurants. A little gem on the Upper West Side!

Delicious classy French restaurant. Great ambience and
Menu. Loved the duck pate abd the simple burger cooked perfectly medium rare. Coq au vin was superbe!!! Mousse au chocolat delicieux!!! Can’t wait to go back!
I've been visiting regularly now for the past few months. I enjoy classic French cuisine with good value, and professional service.
We had the Muscles and Wine special and enjoyed it very much.  Food was good and waiter and staff were very nice and helpful.
Classic French cuisine in bistro setting with professional service.

The waiter was very rude to my date because she didn’t know she had to order all 3, very condescending. I never seen a waiter speak to its guest like they were a child over a menu, I also asked for a second drink and I never received it. Other than that the food was delicious.
Mediocre food, pleasant but slow service, much too noisy.
The waitress was not very attentive. She took too much time to come back to the table and check if all was well.

Great food and friendly service, comme toujours.  Way too noisy with the bar music, aussi comme toujours.  Makes it hard to hear your dinner companions over the blasting music and screaming at the bar.
Food Was terrific. Classics all done well. Attentive staff

Our family gathered for an NYC weekend to celebrate my in-laws’ 60th wedding anniversary. We really appreciated that Cafe Du Soleil still has bubble dining, which was really charming and felt intimate ,and allowed us to enjoy the meal without worrying that we were putting our elderly family members at risk. The meal and the service were both excellent. The fare is classic French fare done well.

My eggs were served warm, not hot.  Apparently they sat under a heat lamp that did not keep them hot.  The service was very slow.  The bus server was rude.  Maybe he did not speak English.  When we requested an item, he barked, "Ask your server!" and rushed away.

Cute place, nice service, terrible food. Two of us had over easy eggs and one of us had quiche. Everything (eggs, bacon, sausage, quiche) came out cold and appeared to have been made in advance (like the day before). Clearly, nothing was made to order. A total disappointment for something as simple as breakfast. Sadly, we won’t go back.
Classic French cuisine in bustling bistro setting. Good values in traditional entrées

Four women of age. We ate what we wanted took our time. Server was great. The only problem is that the noise level was too high until about 9:00 when the restaurant became less crowded and the music was lowered.

Food: Hamburgers with short ribs were great. French fries super Escargot were the best around. Pâté was a little dry but tasty and served nicely. Onion soup was crusty and delicious, but below the perfect cheese, the soup lacked depth of flavor. I’d definitely return.
Truly Fantastic food in a private outdoor igloo, which made for a very relaxing meal, and since we had to have especially high Covid safety protocols due  to one family member, it was perfect!
Always comfortable and good. Noise level has crept up a little, but still nothing unbearable.  Feels like home, if home is bistro in non-touristy Paris.
Outstanding bistro in every way. A serious touch of France!
Our favorite local restaurant; Like a taste of Paris on the UWS.
We enjoyed our brunch meal: crepe and quiche. The outdoor heater worked well.

We usually love the food at Cafe du Soleil. But yesterday we had liver and it was mushy. The sauce was overpowering. Not up to par with their quality. And the noise level is deafening. We could hardly hear each other unless we screamed at each other. How about putting up baffling to muffle some of the noise?

Easily one of my favorite restaurants, I love the chic, casual atmosphere, excellent (and diverse!) menu, and well-executed dishes.  I also love that it is VERY reasonably priced.  I went with a friend for dinner, we each had a cocktail, shared an appetizer, got our own entrees, she got dessert and we shared a bottle of wine for only about $100 each!  In NYC, that's pretty amazing for this quality of food, and portions are so generous I couldn't eat half of my dinner.  

Highly recommend the mussels dijon (and get the fries!), short ribs, and duck confit.
Best happy hour and great food
Perfect French atmosphere!

Stopped by for a late brunch on New Years Day. We were seated immediately, the space is cozy and lively though a bit tight. Service was expedient, but there were a couple of issues, two of us ordered the Croques Madame, I asked for an over-easy egg and it was fried hard. My friend asked if she could substitute the salad for fries. An order of fries came out 15 minutes before her meal was served with the salad?? The other party ordered a side of bacon - a healthy portion, but inconsistently cooked, some almost burnt and other pieces were almost raw. Despite this, we enjoyed the meal overall and the mimosas were delicious! I would dine here again. Thank you!
Great brunch date

Ordered the quiche, it was so dry there were cracks on top, the egg batter was thinner than the crust, crust that was soft as if reheated in a microwave, very disappointing in a French restaurant. I sent it back and was offered to take another item, took the fish soup, it is a very good soup, just like expected, but one tiny crouton for the whole bowl of soup? Croutons definitely comes with an “s” on the menu….Service was very good, very nice place, too bad, really wanted to love that place to have a French restaurant nearby to go to to eat food from home, we won’t be back unfortunately.
Terrible. Waste if money snd time. Food was average at best. Other better restaurants in the area for sure.

We usually go to happy hour and decided to partake in the price fix dinner for new years and had a blast. The food was outstanding. We didn’t think we could love this place anymore than we already do! We were wrong!
Celebrated New Year's Eve at Café Du Soleil. It was great! The food the service the ambiance were all top notch!
Love this restaurant they always make you feel at home there
Always lively atmosphere. Great burgers.
Bubble is fantastic in cold weather. Great service and great food at a reasonable price!

Lively atmosphere, great service, and excellent food.
Had a really good experience in this cool restaurant.
We went on the recommendation of our hotel concierge.  Food and service were very good.
My dad and I enjoyed brunch here before going to the International Auto Show at the Javits Center.
The Smith is always a reliable crowd pleaser, would recommend
As usual, The Smith Midtown was great.  Food is exceptional and service attentive.  Definitely a great place to go.
Amazing food. Mac and burger were outstanding. Thanks
Food very good, the constant low level vibration under the table is a bit odd. Is that a subway line in the basement ?

Server was distracted and rude. Seemed annoyed host had already taken drink order when she got to table.  Table was pushed up against a door frame so cut into space.  Salad (meal) came throughly soaked in dressing.  Asked for new salad with dressing on the side, it arrived 35 minutes after other diner had finished food. Had to ask for it to go. All around poor experience.
It was hot. We ate in side. The day was a hot day but they had all the doors and windows open. People who want to eat inside don’t want to be hot. It was uncomfortable eating.
Draft Beer choice was excellent, food was very good, service was good as well.
We always enjoy eating at The Smith.  Food is great and service is exemplary.
VERY loud, but I love the design & great food. Consider outdoor seating if possible…
The Smith never disappoints…great birthday dinner for my son!
Great food and drinks, excellent service. Ate outside and nothing can be done to mute traffic noise.

Reservation on time, clean restaurant.
Have been to the Smith at Nomad in the past. I would return again.
Tasty Brunch and good service.  We were seated on time for our reservation on a busy morning.
We try to fit in a meal at The Smith every time we come to town from Michigan to visit our daughter.  I could eat the avocado toast every day!
Bday celebration! Great food. Big portions. Staple restaurant in the neighborhood. Hotel desk recommend it.

Great place with a buzzy vibe. Food was excellent. Service was very good. Prices pretty high. Only one criticism menus very difficult to read in low light, I was not the only person having to use light on mobile phone to be able to read the menu.

Sat in the back room and it was fairly quiet. The service was quick and the roasted chicken with smashed garlic potatoes and spinach was excellent. Only complaint was that the spinach portion was small which I remembered from last time so I also ordered a side of spinach.

I was very disappointed with the service. We had a 2.15 reservation on a Saturday, and despite there being empty tables around the service was glacial. The four year old in our group had to wait nearly 40 mins for no-frill kiddie pancakes. They brought out the complimentary bread along with the entrees, instead of while we first sat down. We had to ask for maple syrup twice. And a request for lemons was ignored. It's a shame, because we've been going there for years and always thought of it as a reliable vehicle no use for good groups and families.
it’s too loud.  can’t hear yourself talk.  the food was great the service and drinks was great
Consistent - good drinks, food, and service, which is hard to find in NYC.
Overall great, food was fantastic, the staff was friendly and attentive. Great place for a nice brunch

One day we ask for chocolate chips in my child's pancakes and they are cooked in the pancake - as one would expect.   next day we got a bowl of them on the side.  Literally 24 hours later
And good luck getting your waiters attention for drink refills.  Once the food is delivered they don't show up until the check is ready!
A great restaurant with a relaxed and fun ambience for families and couples and groups alike. A happy memorable meal.
We had a great server from our home state of Texas. Food was really good. Music was a little too load. Difficult to hear each other. Overall great place for lunch.

This was probably the least good value meal
I have ever had. The service was slow and the food fairly mediocre. Big price tag though.
I thought the wine was far too expensive. Expensive meal for what we ordered. Lovely service.

Came here for a post theater meal with 3 kids. They were very accommodating and we felt comfortable. Drinks and food were good! The kid enjoyed the “house made” sparkly water enough that they didn’t need the fancy house made sodas. Adult bevies were good. Everyone enjoyed their food including the chips with blue cheese fondue and sticky toffee pudding for dessert. The restaurant was lively, but it made it okay for my kids to be kids without being annoying to the other guests. A good meal for a fair price in midtown.
Great place, good services and food. Casual with fun atmosphere.
Pedestrian food. Service was OK. Pricey. Generally a disappointment.
We love The Smith Midtown.  Great food and wonderful service.

Noise level was off the charts only because we were seated directly next to a large office dinner. They stood and talked directly next to our table and were quite boisterous. However, the food and the service were outstanding! We will definitely be back the next time we are in the city!

Food is great & well prepared - drinks are always tasty- altho the white subway tile makes the space louder than normal (Lincoln Center location is even worse for noise level). The service was a little snarky this time around, but overall this place is always a good option - esp. if you need a large group accommodated.
Excellent attention to allergies, great food and service.

Food was good. Service was slow and non attentive.
Drinks came out except for 1 and had to wait 10 minutes before last one arrived
Asked for high chair 3 times and came after 20 minutes
Dessert came out without spoons and had to wait 10 minutes.

The staff and service was very good. The biggest complaint that I have is about the number of dogs that I saw inside of the restaurant while my party was dining. I’m not sure if this is a new thing but seeing dogs in the restaurant while I’m eating feels unsanitary. If dogs need to be at a restaurant, I believe that they should be outside with their owners. I understand that people who require dogs as service animals is a different situation however, I am pretty sure that the dogs that I seen were not service animals and frankly, I prefer not to dine in any restaurant that allows dogs inside of the facility. It does not make me comfortable.
We enjoy everything at The Smith.  The food is great and the service is special.  Go, see for yourself.
Service was really bad/slow. Food and drinks were good
Perfect for a brunch during a trip to the city. We ordered the pastry basket and were so impressed with the selection. The drinks are all very pretty, and the DJ was also awesome!

Honestly, it was my first rooftop experience and i expected a rooftop experience but idk why the roof was covered, i assumed rain or because its not summer yet but i wish i knew this sooner because off taking my wife here for her birthday when she requested me to take her to a rooftop experience bar, which it kinda wasnt. So i wish that Magic Hour made a disclaimer prior for me in reserving a seat which cost $30 to make. Overall food and drinks were good.

Way too noisy.  Too pretentious for being served fast food style offerings.  We had better food from the street carts.  The secret service style escorts to the elevators are obnoxious.  For a place that wants to be perceived as elite and upscale, they should stop serving drinks in plastic cups.
No pink decor or any place to really take cute pics but outside. Menu was limited.

My group and I traveled from New Jersey due to videos and pictures we seen online with beautiful floral displays and decor but arrived and none of it was there. We asked someone and was told it was a seasonal thing. I wish that would’ve been clear to avoid this disappointment. Food was average, table was like a coffee table where we had to be hunched over trying to eat our food the whole time. Food came out at a decent time but we constantly had to hunt our waitress down. She barley came over to check on us. I would not visit again. Not happy with the experience.
Moment sympathique mais pas le décor mentionné sur le site . Les cocktails sont tops , et la vue incroyable

Took my girlfriend for her birthday. It was a cool vibe ad fR as the crowd. The food was cute and the rooftop was nice however security was rude and pushy. Not a welcoming environment at all. I wad asked if i had reservations (which i did ) 5 times.
It was a great experience. We were a large group and the staff were very accommodating
Poor customer service, our waiter overlooked us and waited on other people. The drinks were water washed down.. Magic Hour has simply lost it touch. My friends and I will not be returning again.

We had a good time.   Drinks were really good and not bad$$ for rooftop.  The appetizers were good.   The DJ was spinning great music.  We're going back for brunch and after sunset so we can see the EBB lit.

I know you had to have reservations and that’s wonderful.  But having a certain amount of time wasn’t good. Are table was reserved under the hot sun.  Thank goodness the hostess was nice enough to move a party of 9 to a different table.
Drinks were good but the food was cold.   The birthday girl wasn’t happy about the experience she had or anyone else.
Was looking forward to amazing decor however there was none. The hostess said it was decorated for spring however there were no decorations
Very lovely hostesses and amazing food/drinks. Great place to have a drink and view the city!

We got to the restaurant host at first door very polite and thorough with the details to get to the top floor. Hostess and servers very  friendly, food and drinks are great and ambiance is awesome. Took hundreds of pics in the restaurant!!!

Great place, great food and good service.

Could be great to order the full menu during brunch.
Very disappointed with food and atmosphere this time around. Could have gone to McDonald's and gotten hot better tasting food.
The food was good and the environment was nice. We went for brunch where they serve the Pink pancakes. I definitely recommend them!

My friend and I really enjoyed our visit to magic hour. The drinks were lovely and views were simply incredible. However the only downside was the food. We ordered the pink stack of pancakes to share and while delicious, we were disappointed that we seemed to get pancakes that were lacking in candy floss compared to other diners who had ordered the same. This was disappointing given how expensive they were. Overall we had a great experience and would recommend to others.

Don’t let their Instagram page fool you! The atmosphere is nothing like those photos! And don’t celebrate your special occasions here! I guarantee you will regret it! The chaos in this place only brings you headache rather than making you a good memory of your celebration!

The ambiance was very poor. The way it’s advertised online is only for seasonal experiences and that isn’t even communicated before you make reservations. I feel that I was ‘Catfish’ed to come to this place and it basically ruined my birthday dinner. Being from NY and having such high expectations…I would say my experience was trash. I expected to pay high end prices…but I also expected for me and my guests to enjoy themselves which we definitely didn’t.
This place is nothing like their instagram displays It to be, and the food is good but very limited.

Magic Hour is perfect to spend time with your friends and take pictures on their instagramable spot. The service was great, the lady that took care of our table was very kind. The food was tasty but kinda expensive since it was food that you find in other places like burger and chips but I guess that happens when a place gets to know much. Overall, was a great experience, I will definitely go again.

Me pareció que lo quieren hacer un sitio exclusivo y de exclusivo no tiene nada. Horriblemente ambientado y sucio. Nada que ver con lo que se ve en las fotos. Igualmente debo decir que la moza que me atendió fue súper amable y mi trago après ski excelente.
Absolutely loved it! 10/10 experience awesome and quick customer service. Loved the food quality and variety. Also the view and many photo opportunities!

False advertising on all social networks. There is only 3 pink cats outside on patio. The other pink decorations have been removed and with no warning. The waiter was not great at all. She acted as if she didn’t know her job didn’t care to make sure we was taken care of. I would rate 3/10. I only give a 3 cause still the place is cute but not what I came for. Food is horrible!

Does not look like any of the pictures online, very basic roof top bar, nothing special, nothing like the pictures. Expensive waste of time, would not recommend, there are a number of amazing roof top bars in New York. This is not one of them.

The atmosphere didn't have anything special, according to what i have seen on the internet so it was a little bit of dissapointing. However, the food was delicious and the service really kind. Note: portions are really big.

The food menu has like 5 items, the drinks are ok and nothing that I liked but my friends all picked “The Diplomat” and enjoyed it. I ended ordering off the menu. Tacos - 3 good but small tacos, Guac was not homemade, mini sliders (3) were good, curly fries were fine. With 4 drinks, and listed apps it was $150. 

While on the line for the bathroom there was an extremely rude interaction with a customer and the bathroom attendant. The customer yelled at her stating she paid $3000 already and is entitled to whatever candy is on her table. 

Overall, I won’t be back.

We had 3 servers (w/o warning/knowledge). Appetizer was placed on someone else’s table for several minutes before being placed on ours. Never gave us a fresh new appetizer. Was told we had to leave right after ordering second round of drinks. Waitress took cards to appropriate receipts ands still charged all cards to the wrong receipts. Manager had a “careless” attitude. Her response to every complaint was “Okay”. Waitresses never checked on us, we had to waved them down every 20-so minutes. Will never return. Also, it’s nothing like it looks on its webpage. False advertisement. Would recommend friends to never experience Magic Hr rooftop.
This rooftop bar is a great place for spectacular views and delicious drinks. Let surprise you by the ambience.
It was great!? Love the atmosphere, movie and the vibe!
L’ambiance et le DJ étaient super

No one seemed to have any clue what they were doing. Service was TERRIBLE. Our waitress had no idea what they had for drinks, and when we did get them, one was wrong. 35$ for two drinks. We tried to go to the bar after (with out almost finished drinks) and sat there for 30 MINUTES and were not even acknowledged. Not even a hello or a look in our direction. One of the worst establishments I’ve ever been to. Not sure who is running this place but they need to check on their terrible staff. Wouldn’t recommend to my worst enemy.
Good view but very noisy. Good view but very noisy.
The service is so bad. I don’t recommend this restaurant is my first and last time o go to this restaurant.
Great atmosphere had a great time with my wife food and drinks were fantastic

Horrendous place, we stayed 20 minutes and left. The man in the lift could jot have been a more miserable member of staff. When we hot to the top having endured the ride with the gloomy man in what I would describe as a black box there was no one there but they tucked us on a table for two around the corner from the bar. If you have read about about a beautiful rooftop adorned with flowers and if you think you’ll be eating insta-worthy pink s’mores with pretty sprinkles, topped with cotton candy then to manage your expectations, they don't serve them anymore, there is no rooftop view to write home about and the only “flowers” were a couple of plastic faux trails of  ivy in an otherwise bland aesthetic. A hugely disappointing place.
I absolutely hated this place. All the decor which was on google maps was was taken down. The food was awful. Overall it killed the vibe , I went into the bar expecting a lot more.
The food was absolutely delicious. The drinks looked and tasted good.
Such a cute place and this food is amazing!

*tourists*
I took my nephew (16) and son (5) there for the rooftop dinner experience after leaving timesquare. It was a nice quick walk from time square. All service staff was super friendly and attentive. Food wasn’t special but good price. EDM music was bit loud for taking kids there but it was 8pm and I expected that so it was fine. Sliders were yummy. Vibe was there. I ordered a red Skye cocktail and it was good.
Lovely surroundings, excellent food - especially the sliders - and the best table service.  Woul recommend without hesitation.
Everything was phenomenal and our server Zoe was wonderful. Amazing experience all around. 10/10 would recommend.
Not the most friendly service. Everything else is alright
Great way to end the night. Zoe was awesome and took great care of me. Great drinks, food and service.
Great service.  Food was all great but steak was a little tough.  Cool vibe and a young crowd with good music.
Not really outdoor. The pizza we ordered we were told was for one, but it was big enough for 2
Fun place near Times Square - cool vibe, food is decent but overpriced for what it is.
Food and drinks were good and tasty. But they were nothing special. The views are not the best and service was slow. Overall not terrible, just not worth the price.

Crab roll was amazing, meat needed a bit
More salt / spices, but overall it was a great experience!
I’d go back. Love a good rooftop   Good lobster roll
It was not what we expected.  The food was very expensive for the quality, it is more of a bar than a restaurant.
Absolutely delicious meal in a picture-worthy spot! The staff were all amazing.
Staff and Management made it special for my girlfriend
Great way to enjoy a Sunday morning.  The food was good - ambience and light excellent and the bottomless mimosas were great!
Went for a couple of pre show cocktails. It’s my go to spot before I see a Broadway show. Never had complaints.
Drinks were good.  Appetizers good.  Not the pizza. Service was disrupted with multiple waiters taking turns.  Overalll good casual place. Upbeat vibes

I really enjoyed my visit to Haven Rooftop!  The staff, very welcoming greeted with a smile.  Our table right in the corner were we could see a small view out to 42nd Street I really liked that view it gave our ladies night a nice touch.

Eric and Thomas were fun and amazing servers they did an excellent job making suggestion for drinks and items on the menu.  I loved that fact that 1 of the managers came around to check in on service he walked over to each table to say hello.

The food was really tasy and would definitely recommend our picks!
Items selected from the menu includes
Food:
- crispy calamari
- crab avocado
- lobster roll (comes with fries)
Drinks:
- solstice
- safe haven
- innocent mojito

Why do I recommend:

- menu has a little bit of everything including option for (v, vg and gluten-free diets).
- music

- right off 47 midbloc

Tip:
Depending on your time of arrival reservations are a must!
reminder this is a roof top restaurant.  Which means you need to first enter the hotel.  Stop at the hostess/concierge desk check in at which you will be directed to the roof top elevator.

Don't be afraid to ask for suggestions!  I have realized when you talk to the staff at any restaurant they will help you make great choice!  This will also add the done in experience.
Cena agradable. La pizza es generosa. Los calamares ricos y buena atención
Food and drinks were good but view was disappointing for a rooftop bar.
Neither the kitchen nor the staff seemed to be trying very hard.  French fries were very good.
Great food, great service, nice ambience for a lunch before Broadway!
Very loud in the bar area, was expecting a bit better view of buildings lit up but still ok.  Food was excellent and many healthy choices.   Very fairly priced

Terrible service, ok food, so so location.

Bla Bla Bla Bla Bla Bla Bla Bla Bla

We had such a wonderful experience. The rooftop was beautiful and a must if you are looking for a covered space but want the rooftop vibe still. The service was amazing and the food was delicious. I highly recommend this place!
Love this place- the server was wonderful, the food and drinks were great, and it’s a pretty spot especially after dark due to all the decorations & lights.
Lovely! Vibes and ambiance were immaculate. The food delicious and the view was great

Found Haven Rooftop while searching for lunch/brunch places before a Saturday matinee- what a find!
You go to the rooftop venue via a single elevator (the only negative!). You go to a very open dining area that is well enclosed to the elements (it was slightly raining the day we were there). The drinks were well poured and delicious. The food was very good - we each had different meals, but the winner was the French toast with crusted corn flakes. The farmers omelette was very good as well. The bacon egg and cheese sandwich was better than average as was the margarita pizza.
The service was excellent (Zoe was our server) and the overall experience was outstanding - we’ll be back!

We went here on a Saturday afternoon before a matinee. The entrance is into a  beautiful building and then you take the elevator to the top. On a rainy day it felt light and bright--a really good vibe. We both ordered the Garden Omelette and side salad.  The omelette was very good.  The salad tasted good but the lettuce was a little wilty.  The service was amazing.  They were very attentive in a good way.  The check was crazy reasonable. We would absolutely go back here for pre-theater.  It felt like a best-kept secret, as it was not overly crowded.

A little bit hard to find.
The food was ok, but I expected more.
I asked for lobster and it was served with bread and tones of fries. So, I don’t know, it wasn’t that special as we thought. 
I guess it’s a place to have drinks and some snacks. Not a dinner.
Def recommend! The food was good and  Our server was knowledge and polite!
Staff very helpful and friendly. The waiter was always around when we needed a refill of mimosas.

My friend and I had brunch here on a sunday and the food was amazing! It came right away and the drinks were great too.  We really loved the tuna tartare tower and definitely recommend it for starters.  The only thing I gave this place a 4 stars instead of 5 is the space felt very cramped. It was just my friend and I and so we had a really small table and we were seated next to the bar so it was quite loud and we kept getting passed by with the other patrons and staff. I requested a table by the window so we can have a nice view and some quiet a little bit but I guess the place was busy that day.  Overall, 4 stars for the food and the service!
Fabulous experience. Absolutely looking forward to returning.
Service was wonderful!  The food was great, especially the blueberry stuffed french toast.
Very enjoyable dining experience, ambiance delightful,food was excellent (penne ala vodka and a margarita pizza) service was quick and friendly. Will definitely be going back !!!
Exceptional Service! I really enjoyed celebrating my birthday there in a private setting! Thank you Haven Rooftop

We had the tuna tartare, mushroom/truffle pizza, and lobster roll. The food wasn’t super flavorful, kinda seemed like everything was thrown together quickly. For the price, you’d definitely expect a bit more quality. The space was cool - would be great for after work drinks and appetizers. For a date/dinner, there’s better quality rooftop restaurants here in NYC. Service was great and the staff were very friendly.
Food and service were excellent!  Glassed in and heated dining area with an awesome view!
Owner was rude. He looked at our 20% tip, pointed at us and laughed with his staff. No refills or check ins from waitress.
The food is excellent and the staff is so delightful. We had a delightful time.
Hidden gem, great food, reasonable prices, nice atmosphere, BYOB, would give it 5 stars if the music wasn't so loud
Great spot near the Edgewater ferry. Food was very good and enjoyed the lobster ravioli, thai salad, and mushroom buns.
Beautiful restaurant!  Excellent food! Great service!

Food was excellent and we had a large group. Everyone was very satisfied with their meals. Servings are fairly priced but very small. I recommend ordering l individual appetizers for each person. If you share you’ll leave hungry.
nice, clean place. just a bit louder. Food was delicious.
Great new restaurant in Edgewater, ambiance was very nice and the staff was helpful.
Always an overall excellent experience at terravita!
Best brunch, great food, staff is amazing. Music is on point.
This is the second time we've eaten here while visiting our sons.  I love the aesthetic, the staff is super friendly & the food was great.  We will definitely be back
Excellent meal although a bit pricey!
Great food & service. Have eaten here numerous times and the only limiting factor is the noise level, still highly recommend.
Perfect brunch spot! Service was good, vibe and decor was superb, & food was very tasty! Will come back to try dinner here!!

Terravita in Edgewater is a very cute spot, perfect for brunch or a date! The team did a great job creating a beautiful & comforting ambience for both indoor & outdoor seating. The servers were very nice & generally attentive but they could use one or two more. There were a lot of people who seemed like employees at the bar but only one server that actually waited on the tables. 

The food came quickly, was plated beautifully, and tasted great! However, the price points at this restaurant doesn't seem to align to the actual dishes. There is an expectation to pay at a higher range when eating at a nice restaurant in this area but it's almost a little bizarre. Upwards of $26 for a brunch plate that is not filling, does not contain special or particularly expensive ingredients, and is not 'unique' in any way just comes off as a restaurant that is taking advantage of customers' willingness to pay more.

Overall, I enjoyed my experience but I don't think I would ever find myself here casually and I would always mention the price point when recommending to a friend.
Excellent gourmet food. Great service and ambiance can't wait to go back !!
10/10 experience!!! Great food, drinks and service. Perfect for brunch and date night!

I had a great time at Terravita! The place was beautiful and the food was really good. My guests and I were very happy with the service as we were always being checked on to make sure everything was going well.
The service was excellent and food was delicious!
The food was
Great service! I enjoyed the food as well as the drinks. I would recommend.

Great food and very attentive staff
will keep coming back
Valentines was busy and slow, but more time to enjoy with my Valentine. Can’t wait to go  ack.

A bit pricey for brunch, $150 for 2 people 2 drinks,2 appetizers and 2 Entrees NO desserts no coffee. The food was ok but as a West Village resident for the price there are better comparable.  Service was exceptional and decor was modern and clean. If you want to try something different and you live in NJ and not on a budget then enjoy.

I have been to the Terravita in Washington heights manahattan area. I had a great time. Here the menu was more limited because Eid a valentine special. The drink I loved- lavender- was not an option. Someone had the “last one”. Not sure how that’s possible. Anyway, my friend plans her meals so what she wanted was not on the menu. For me, the food was great! Drinks were ok. The waiter seemed not to understand what the tip service was when we asked and he said not sure they are just adding it for valentines special. The wording on the bill was confusing as it seemed too small for a tip- w thought it might be some kind of alcohol service tip so when we asked we didn’t get a clean answer until we said is this your tip? And he said yes. I felt bad cause my experience in Manhattan was awesome and I brought a different friend to this location and it felt like I had hyped the restaurant too much LOL will be back to one in Manhattan- not this one so much.
Outstanding service, lunch was great and the vibe was there 10/10 👌🏽

We have eaten here before for dinner several times but this was our first visit for brunch and it was just as nice and the food just as great. Great and attentive staff and it's really nice to see the manager or owner present and actively involved in making sure every guest is happy. Keep it up!
We love Terravita, since Washington Heignts location on Broadway and now this amazing location they have in Edgewater. It’s a vibe!!!
Great place, wonderful food and outstanding service
Service excellent,attentive…food was on point…will be back…when it’s warmer outside !
Even with a reservation, we had to wait 30 minutes for a table to open up. Very loud and noisy, could not have a conversation.

This is a hidden gem in Edgewater. It was recommended by a friend and it did not disappoint. New York City service, right here in New Jersey.

Very attentive wait staff at this BYOB

We will be back
Delicious food in a romantic setting, and excellent service. BYOB.
Meeting friend s

Overall experience was excellent. Food courses were well presented, plating was thoughtful and they taste great. Waiting time for food was minimum, service was impeccable. My only complain would be their main courses should come with some kind of sides with the price that they are charging. If you don't mind paying extra for sides, it's not an issue.
Great food! Great service!
New Year’s Eve
This place is amazing!  I went here for a Christmas dinner with friends. The service, food, and ambience is exceptional. I will definitely be going back. Thank you for the great food and experience.

We used to go to Emma frequently and were disappointed when they closed, but Terravita is an excellent substitute. The dining area is beautifully designed and perfect for date night. The staff works hard to accomodate and they are very hospitable, The menu has something for everyone - Tuna Tartare, Bao Buns and Calamari and Chicken were all delicious!  Great choice in Edgewater.
Amazing! We loved the food, service & place! Will keep visiting & recommending!
Great food and service!

The Smith is convenient and reliable- it has never disappointed. Our meal was good and we were in and out within about 40 minutes. I had mentioned that we were there for a birthday and when we declined dessert(too full and we were going to have cake at home later) they kindly brought us a bag with three enormous chocolate chip cookies with their compliments. Very sweet finish!

Had a great experience here. Came for brunch and made a reservation. Noted in the reservation that one of our party had an egg allergy. From the moment we walked in, they made sure we knew they were aware of it. When we were seated, the waiter came over and confirmed it with us and explained the allergy protocol. He then worked with us to find a meal option that was safe. We picked something off the menu, he went back to the kitchen to confirm and when there was a cross contamination warning on the box of pasta, he offered a safe substitution. The entire experience made us feel so safe and so comfortable - something we don’t often feel when we eat out. Highly recommend and will definitely be back.
Friendly staff and great service.  Everyone loved their entrees.

First time at this location. Hostess put five of us at a large 6 top in the middle of traffic flow of waitstaff. I foubled back to find her and she was goofing around with the weight staff. I tapped her on the shoulder and asked her if we could please move tables because it was too big and too loud. She chose to tell me that all the tables were that loud and that we would not fit in a booth, I cajoled her into moving us to one of the many available tables and it was fine from there, however unprofessional and unacceptable for a New York restaurant. Waiter was lovely, positive upbeat (although perhaps, overworked as drinks would come late) recommended some appetizers. the potato chips were decadent The broccoli was delicious entertaining guests from out of town who were visiting FIT. They enjoyed their filet mignon. I enjoyed my spring peas salad. The booth was great. The ambience is consistent and look and feel with other locations. Great addition to a historically, underserved neighborhood will come again.
Amazing friendly service and tasty food but very small portions.

Thank you to the manager who booked us the booth
And Bartender 4 to 7 martini hour

Good NYC location.  Had lunch in outdoor sidewalk area, was nice as they had the tables not on the edge of the sidewalk but next to the building, so there was some space between you and the people walking by.  I hate it when it seems like people are almost going to bump into you as they would put tables against the guard rail, good move Smith!  Service was good.  Food for the price was good. They had a cool looking bar around might try it for drinks.  Only comment would be given location and cost, they could use nicer chairs.
Love The Smith, food and service always great.   need to manage the reservation timing better, should be asked to wait 20min after your reservation time to sit
Very nice breakfast - plenty of coffee refills - nice atmosphere - great weather so we enjoyed the openness. Would recommend!

Waited 45 minutes for table reservation.
Every starter and enter was suspiciously spicy.
You only use spice that much across the menu when you have something to hide.
Love The Smith. Always a great meal! Food is awesome.
Always a perfect time. Staff is amazing and always a pleasure when there. Will continue to be my go-to favorite place to eat solo and with friends.
A little pricey, but always good quality.  Never disappointed.

It was Easter brunch so I'm going to blame a lot of the bad things on that but I go to The Smith (various locations) at least 10 times a year and usually all is excellent.  However, our table was in a horrible location directly across from the reception desk and the stairs to the restrooms - seemed like it was just added there.  Then after we ordered we got our food super fast and felt as if they were pushing us out the door.

Restaurant was clean, the service was cool but professional. Our Sunday brunch of pancakes and eggs Benedict was very good. There was a table of 14 nearby that was extremely loud that slightly dampened our experience. But they we’re having fun.

We are from out of town and we’re looking for a restaurant not where tourists go, so our tour guide recommended this restaurant.
We made reservations, good thing as place was packed.
I generally don’t like loud restaurants, and this was loud, but stuck it out.
I ordered 3 appetizers for my meal and my son had steak. The salmon tar tar was amazing calamari also excellent.
My son was pleased with his steak.

Place is nice but way too loud. You can barely talk with people at your table. The food was ok.
Extremely good experience overall. Food and ambiance was great !

Love The Smith. Been here many times and the food/cocktails do not disappoint. Went with a friend for brunch and we split a goat cheese salad and eggs Benedict. Both delicious.  Mimosa was quite tasty too! Service was great. When the restaurant is packed, it does get loud so it’s difficult to have a conversation.
It is very expensive. 22$ for five bacon slices???

I am a good and regular customer of this restaurant and the more I thought about and the 3 other diners reminded me that this was pretty unimpressive experience at the smith. Too bad because it often is my go to for pick up food for dinners.

Food was amazing! The ambiance is awesome! Our server was amazing. Unfortunately I can not remember her name but she's gorgeous and French.  Overall we had a great time. As usual, The Smith did not disappoint.
Consistent across the board in all locations in NYC.  My favorite Go To place.
Went before Rangers game. Service was spot on, nice menu, upbeat atmosphere and they moved things along as we had requested. Will definitely go back.
Amazing Mac & Cheese, amazing apple pie, great service
Great atmosphere, great people, great food make for a great experience all round.

The Smith really gave me everything I was seeking to celebrate my birthday. I was so happy to experience a restaurant post pandemic that still lives up to their reputation of good food. Thank you so much for a wonderful experience
Unfortunately, the food was ok.  They need to redo their selections for brunch.
Best dessert ever!!! (Something with Marshmallow and chocolate) But you have to share, not manageable by a single person!
This was at least my 5th trip to Smith Nomad.  Each time, including this one, the food is fabulous, the service is awesome and the ambience quite lively.  We will keep coming back....

When out of town friends say let's meet for brunch, you go to The Smith - Nomad.  Energetic crowd fit in perfectly with this reunion and the food was awesome.  Too many good options on the menu so we have to come back for more.

Host very nice 
Server very professional and friendly 
Service organized and quick 
Portion reasonable and tasty food
Everything is fantastic - I've never had a bad meal or even a meh meal - the whole menu is terrific, as is the service.
Very busy but the service was quick and Dan was very helpful re menu choices. It was the second time we’d eaten at The Smith Nomad during our 6 night stay and we’d happily go there again!!
Delicious food in a very cool, vibrant space. Cocktails were diverse and delicious as well!

The best meal we had during our 6 day trip to NY… we couldn’t fault anything! Absolutely fabulous!! 

The food was fantastic - it tasted so good, and the presentation was beautiful - and the team were amazing - so friendly, knowledgable and helpful. We were made to feel so welcome.

We will definitely be back next time we visit! And you should too!
The food was delicious and all the staff were friendly.
Very loud but good was good. Waitress took forever.
Very good food and great service! We loved eating here as a large family group, it worked out well!
Always a great date night. Food was amazing, drinks and the desserts wowww! Definitely recommend the chefs platter for dessert! Brings a little bit of everything
Everything was incredible!  Great restaurant to celebrate a birthday. I totally recomend ot!
Overall not a good experience, drinks were not the greatest , food not so good prefer Chinese take out and the waiter kept rushing for our order
Loved it! Will be back next time we are in the city!
Amazing experience!!! Food was delicious, service was impeccable!!
Love everything about this restaurant. I would definitely come back.
Service could have been much better. Food was OK, but Chinatown would have been a better option
Went there for an anniversary date and the experience was phenomenal.

First time there on Friday 4/14 and we loved the ambience, the food and drinks. We did not like our server Connie. She was rude, she wasted water one of us and table. We were drinking sparkling water and she came and refilled our glass with regular water while still drinking the sparkling.  She started telling us that since we came on the weekend it was busy. She was horrible and we will not be back.

The food very good The staff very kind but 
The music was very hight it was dificult talk

I have been there four times and am always unimpressed with the service. We were basically ignored last night and when we asked for desert menus , the waitress brought one and basically threw it on the table as she walked by
Overall it was a good time, the food took a long time to come out and had to wait a long while again to pay. But overall a nice dinner.
Food order was very prompt, ambiance was club like, lied music but good song.  Highl6 recommend if you want some good shareable size portions of food!
Solid food. Plenty of spices and flavors. The pre-fix lunch is great value
The vibe was really fun, food moderate, service wasn’t great.
Very nice place, upscale but not crazy expensive. Food is amazing and service is ok. Bar tender in waiting area however was very rude.
Staycation with our daughter! It’s her favorite restaurant. Food is always delicious! Waitress very helpful
Toujours aussi bien. Cuisine asiatique excellente et super ambiance. A ne pas manquer quand on vient à NYC.
It’s a good spot but you pay for the ambience. Good was good not great

Food was great, we were seated right away.

Fantastic food, great choices across Chinese, Japanese and Thai food. Super ambience.
Restaurant and bar staff exceptional let down by manager. Silly passport check for people clearly over 21!!!

Our waitress was amazing. She took time to enlighten us on the menu and asked if my children had any food allergy which I throughly appreciated. She also gave us non alcoholic mock tails that were extremely good
It was tasty but the services was adequate. Our server smelled like sweat.

Hostess team has poor customer service skills, lack of communication. Had to be compensated for by the bartending staff which proves it’s either a strategy to benefit their cost center or a way to try to distract from the overall bad first impression. Wait staff was attentive but kitchen presented meals only to find out that our guest of honors selection was no longer available. This should have been made known to the entire party upon ordering, not after all other guests were served. It used to have a phenomenal reputation but like many things over time is mostly resting on its laurels.
The food is amazing, and great service. Good fusion flavors, the drinks are really good too.
The music was great also.  the food was excellent, table service was Efficient

Great ambiance. Very loud and noisy.
Excellent sushi. Mediocre pad Thai.
Waiter very pushy.
High prices for value.

Great food, but the service wasn’t good. The waiter asked for our ID, which is fair. But when we gave him our driver license, he asked us for our passport, that we did not have with us. We felt like criminals, because he thought that our driver license was fake. It was a danish driver license…
Service was horrible, it was very slow and server was not happy to serve us. The chicken was raw and not cooked. People only go for ambiance and the name
Excellent service and the food was outstanding!!!
A glorified PF Chang’s, felt rushed and they just wanted the table back after 45 mins. Won’t be back.

Cute place for family dinner. Food is good; ambiance and service is friendly.  What’s not to like? Plenty of seating. Fun photos. We ate early and it was definitely a family with kids crowd at 6:30! Food came out instantly after ordering. Lychee cocktail was good.
Our server was incredible! We walked in and were immediately seated.
Hostess made us wait 30 min even though we had a reservation. It was a lunch booking. I think that’s ridiculous and unacceptable

Overall this a wonderful setting, great food, waiter was excellent, and overall positive experience. However, notwithstanding a fairly empty restaurant, 1230 reservation that i showed up for 10 minutes early and others showing up later being seated first, was required to wait to be seated until my guest arrived and then made to wait still longer.  That was not appreciated in a business setting
C'était ma deuxième expérience et j'ai adoré encore une fois. La nourriture et les consommations tout était parfait! Merci
Great atmosphere, food impeccable and service excellent
It was a pleasant dining experience. The appetizers were very delicious and flavorful, but the entrees were good but not exceptional.
The food and atmosphere were fabulous. What wasn’t fabulous was being seated upstairs away from all the energy of the main dining room. Maybe it was because we had a 12 year old kid with us.
Excellent food, excellent service. We will go back again soon
Perfect early dinner after watching a broadway show!! Delicious family style Italian food, wonderful cocktails, yummy desserts!
The best Italian food out there. Family style sharing of several courses.
Best Italian food anywhere. All dishes are great!
Tony's was wonderful!   Loved that we could order family style which was great budget wise as well as offering variety.   Calamari was some of the best ever!
Our server Nicole was amazing!!! So professional, upbeat and efficient. She was the best!!

Excellent wait staff (funny, well informed about the menu, great attitudes). Place was really loud on a Friday night because large groups of students traveling with their school were on our floor. Food was excellent and so was the wine.

Portions are for 2-3 people to share. My daughter and I shared the ziti bolognese which was good but had a slight gamey taste. Ambiance is fun but hard to talk due to the noise level. Overall maybe would go there with a group of friends but would likely look for some place else.
Pre-concert meal.  Great service for party of 14!  The waiter was great with recommendations.
We really liked the food and the friendly service. The portions were nice to share and it had an overall good price.

Breaking Passover
Delicious food, wish they had pizza
Spending the evening in NYC from NC for the day. It was an awesome evening.
Everything was great . Server  was super efficient and so nice

Authentic Italian food at a great location
Great dining experience

We were visiting NYC for my daughter’s 16th Bday and chose Tony’s Di Napoli for our special dinner. The food was excellent. Portions are enough for 2-4 people for sure. We ordered the prosciutto and burrata as an appetizer and it was like a meal of its own and for the price an absolute value. We had Rigatoni Bolognese as our main and took most of it home for later. Didn’t have room for dessert. I came here 9 years ago and it still delivers the same value along with quality food.
Great food. The waiter was wonderful! Had a great time.
We always go to Tonys when we’re in the city. city. You can’t go wrong at Tony’s food is always good.
Excellent dinner, amazing service and great drinks!
Everything was great as it always is! The food is always great and the staff is always great!

If you’re new to To G’s be aware that food is served family style.  Tony’s chicken was a nice combination of diced tomatoes, arugula and balsamic vinaigrette over breaded and fried chicken cutlets.  Very good.  The chicken Marsala with mushrooms was also very good. We ordered a child size portion of spaghetti and meatballs .  The kitchen staff must not have children because the portion was 3x what a child would eat.
Our waiter provided pleasant excellent service.
Fast, family friendly, delicious food! Great place to eat with the kids before catching a show.
Everything was wonderful. The wait staff were friendly and attentive. The food was delicious and perfect portions. Definitely going back!
Our first time to Tony's Di Napoli. Food was very good, service was excellent, the portions were large, and the price was reasonable. We'd highly recommend.
Excellent food, excellent service. Great prices and close to all things happening in New York. Put this place on your list.
We loved everything about the restaurant.  The food was great the service, ambiance and  experience was all top notch.

The service was fast, friendly, and our waiter even sang to the dining room which was really nicely done.  I’d come back just because the waitstaff was so kind.

The food was basic and tasted like it was out of a jar/shipped premade frozen and definitely not made in house.

Positives are the place is huge, you can get seated fast, and get food quickly but it comes at the cost of them needing to get lots of food out fast to a big crowd. It tasted like solid OK food court/cafeteria quality food. It is also priced accordingly for that quality for NYC.

If your looking for quantity and speed over quality of food you’ll be happy.

looking for a great home meal. look no further, this family style restaurant is the place to eat. large portions, affordable and the location in Midtown is around the corner from Time Square. Service is awesome and if you are lucky enough to have Nicole as your waiter. you are in for a great evening and fun experience.
Huge portions of great food. Perfect for a pre-show dinner.
Great value and great tasting food with courteous servers.
Great food, the ambience was very authentic, and the server was definitely very nice even if it was a little slow. Will be back

Our local friends suggested this place and we weren’t disappointed.  It looked, felt and smelled like an authentic Italian restaurant.  Appetizers and drinks were ordered and served very quickly.  The rest of the meal was delicious and plenty to go around our table of 7.  Very reasonably priced as well. A few of the servers even sang some old school Italian songs for the customers.  What a great experience and I will definitely be back!
Had a great post theater meal. Our waitress was perfect.
Wonderful night.  A bit loud but our waiter was fabulous and the food was delicious

One word … fantastic 👏👏

Great food. Great service.  Great evening
Easter dinner was fabulous. Seated early and service was top notch.

Food & service was very good.   Restaurant could use some updates, dining area in the back, wallpaper could be scrubbed, food stains & rips.  Light kept flickering.  Bathroom wasn’t that clean, garbage on the steps to the bathroom.
My dad’s 89th birthday was today. The service and the food were outstanding!

This is a first visit to this lovely and authentic Italian restaurant. The staff were very attentive and they made you feel welcome. The food was amazing with portion sizes big enough for the hungriest people. I could see some customers had come back again as the staff seemed to remember them and made them feel really special.
Good typical Italian restaurant, very big portion to share!
Veal was pretty good. Caesar salad was delicious. Tortellini was good but why scatter random peas on it I just don't understand. Linguine is the only pasta made in-house. Loved the setting.

name: Zou Zou's
addressComponentsLongName: 385 Ninth Avenue, Suite 85, Manhattan West Plaza,  New York, NY 10001

reviews.reviewsText: Celebrating a birthday and the entire staff made a point to wish her a happy birthday, with a special written birthday card. Very sweet

Our server was so incredibly rude. It put such a foul mood on the dinner. She was short and would throw down plates, spill water and say nothing, and flat out interrupt us with no grace or tableside manners. I was really shocked by her attitude and will not be coming back because of it. The food was great but I can find the same food without service that makes me feel unwanted and unwelcome.
The design is beautiful and the food is flavorful!
Our server was absolutely amazing and kind.  She made our experience amazing I think her name is Tatiana but I don’t remember.
Seeing old friends and catching up.
Great food, great service and great crowd!  Loved it!

Phenomenal food and space, but our server, Ayleen was what truly made our experience. The service she provided was incredible and she added just the right touch to our birthday lunch. She is an exceptional asset to ZouZou and if all their servers are as wonderful, it would be impossible to have anything but a fantastic dining experience there.
This is my second time dining at Zou Zou's and everything I've tried is fantastic.  The food is pretty healthy too which is always a bonus.

The food was great and well prepared but clearly our server was distracted and ready to leave for the day (or something). Very slow to take our orders and follow up/ she actually even apologized for this a few times.
We loved the hamachi (ordered it twice!) and the oysters. Did not love the chic pea burger.

Food, drinks and ambience was amazing but we were very disappointed by our service.  Our waiter didn’t even once come and ask how things were and everytime we needed something we had to ask other waiters
Kind of disappointed.. both the food and service fell short of expectations. The space is beautiful though.
I absolutely love that restaurant. Incredible food, best dips and broccoli ever. Plus it’s beautiful and has a good energy!

Dishes were fresh and tasty. Loved the dips and breads. Service was excellent. Tables are a bit tightly spaced, but not unusual for Manhattan restaurants where space is a premium. On the pricey side, but manageable for lunch.

So loud! Such a scene! I really wanted to like this place so much more than I did. Maybe something at the bar would be better, but my companion and I literally had to scream at one another throughout our meal in order to be heard.

They also said they take the full food order at once, but time out how they bring them to the table. That totally did not happen and we received three different courses at once. Felt rushed from the minute we got in until the minute we left.
Fabulous and innovative food!  Also, great location. Close to the train station.
Amazing. Perfect spot for a ladies brunch for my birthday.

Chicken kebab was raw- had to send back to be cooked.

Salad was overdressed.

Spreads good but overall very average culinary experience.
Once the staff knew it was date night they went out of the way to make it special.
Fantastic food, reasonable prices, energetic atmosphere - highly recommend
Always a pleasure dining here. Service was fantastic, as was the food. The restaurant is beautiful, and is a go-to for client lunches.

The drinks at the bar were a highlight. The dips pretty good and the chicken felt overpriced. The hosts seated us 20min after our reservation time, despite us arriving 15min early. They were rude about making us wait over half an hour, didn't proactively keep us updated on when we'd be seated and made no effort to address the poor service.
Amazing dining experience - Highly recommend the duck lamb chops, American Fried chicken. The chicken easily feeds four.
I went there for a business lunch meeting and the staff/service was top notch. The food was amazing and I would recommend to anyone.
Incredible ambiance, food, and drinks. Great service. Excellent vibe whether it be 6pm or 10pm.

The food was great, service very good, but the restaurant  was very cold...so cold that it made it hard to enjoy the experience.
Myself and my two friends are from the Allentown, PA area and coming into the CITY and having a different dining experience was what we were after. Since many other tables were available, perhaps I should have suggested that we be moved closer to the middle of the room. I did tell the server that we were very cold but he did not suggest changing tables.
I went for lunch with a friend and we loved everything we ate. We shared three dips and the Fattoush salad with a chicken skewer.  We also loved our cocktails. All around, an amazing lunch.
The food was amazing and our servers, Jayda and Tyler, were the best!

Reduced lunch menu but excellent
Would definitely go back & recommend
Poor service the host , the waiter, the food not like before and was lower level quality

I was nervous about going to Zou Zou's on a Sunday, but the energy was excellent. Diverse crowd, all ages, all types of fashion, great background music. My reservation was for 7:30pm and the restaurant was full. Had the best babaganoush of my life and the lamb chops were amazing! Not a big fan of the duck dish. All around a great place to go for a great experience.
Great restaurant and atmosphere.  Good for groups and beautiful space
Loved it all. We were seated on time, the service was attentive and professional and the food is always consistent and great.
Such a good spot near Penn Station. We tried the 5 dips and all had salads with added chicken, and it was great.
Took our parents who are picky and they loved it!!! Burger was perfectly cooked. Dips all delicious. Wine list top notch.
Great food and extra friendly service. Lively atmosphere too.
Loved this place. Good amazing & gorgeous decor!! The fattoush salad is delicious & so unique
Loved it, loved everything about it, would totally return but maybe try for a seat at the counter, it was a little difficult to hear at a table for 2.
Wonderful potpourri of flavors and beautiful presentation.  In the city for a several day visit and was hands down our favorite dining experience of the trip.

What a find!( Was helpful to know that Zou Zou’s is located in the Pendry Hotel.) Fresh, creative, beautifully presented food and wine,  served to us by a fabulous young man (truly wish I remembered his name!) Don’t miss the dips, bread AND crudités (yes, do both bread and crudités!) and definitely try the branzino with escarole!
Very nice res. Recommend!

The service was extremely slow!

The table was too small for a party of four to be able to have a comfortable dinner.

We arrived at 7:55 for an 8 PM seating. We did not sit until 8:45 PM. The bar was full. It was very difficult to order drinks as people were having meals on the bar and you had to order over people.

Once we sat down, the waiter was not kind/he was rude, and it was very difficult to get his attention to order and even to get our bill at the end of the evening.

Spending several hundred dollars on a mediocre/poor burnt filet is ridiculous!! I would not recommend this restaurant and this NOT one of the top fine dining steak houses in town.
There were some parties that were very boisterous, but our server Brad was fantastic and friendly. The food was also amazing and the value was great.
Excellent service, exquisite food and beautiful restaurant. 100% recommended
Absolutely the best steak around!  Bradley was our waiter and his service was impeccable.  Get the table side butter it’s worth it.  Can’t recommend this place enough!

If you want to like a steak and you are alone, Don’t hesitate.
Quality meats provided perfect steak and wonderful service also great ambience.

Food is ok but not money worthy. Service is little bit solid. 
It wasn't natural and I didn't think it was appropriate for a restaurant of this level.

I booked this restaurant as recommended by the Amex Platinum program.  I don't necessarily recommend this restaurant.  The price and quality ratio did not quite meet expectations.

Great food! Kid friendly too. Desserts were amazing. Wonderful kid menu. Filet was delicious. Oysters were super fresh. Table side steak sauce was unbelievable! Cannot wait to try the rest of the Quality restaurants. Thank you!
Ali the server saved my friend’s life with the Heimlich manoeuvre. What a hero! He deserves a medal.

odered an avocado crab appetizer. It is nicely dressed, but I found the kind of passion fruit sauce surrounding the salad way to acid, so it took all the flavor out of the dish.
The main was a steak, a generous portion and good taste with some brocoli, but I thought it being way overpriced. It is served as it's without any decoration or whatsover.
Suggested wines were good (served here by glass) also somewhat expensive.
So all in all, good food if you like meat, nice chic ambiance, good service, but a little bit dull experience for me. For the price paid, I think you can have it more pleasant elsewhere.
This was a great way to spend our anniversary. The GM on duty was so friendly. We will definitely return.

Very noisy
Food was expensive
The salad cesar is whitout chicken
The meat was really good and the people were super nice and friendly. We had a very good time and enjoyed it very much.

We ordered our steak medium-well because of the children. We knew that medium-well steaks tend to have less juiciness, but the meat was still excessively tough and tasteless. Additionally, the seasoning was overly salty. We do not mean to complain, but almost all of the service at our table (excluding the order which our server took) was provided by the busser, who even handled the bill. Of course, the busser was very friendly and kind.
Table in front of the kitchen very noisy and smelly we ask to change but try did not allow us to do it, meat too cooked

Food was great and drinks were excellent! We enjoyed great service but the restaurant was very loud. My wife and I had a hard time hearing each other sitting directly across from each other. There appear to be a couple of “quieter” spots in the restaurant but maybe you gotta tip the host to get them. Having experienced the noise inside, I’d probably opt for a cabin next time. Had the chefs cut porterhouse, creamed spinach and the corn creme brûlée. Cocktails were well made and reasonably priced for NYC fine dining.
The food was amazing. Service was even better. Our server, Monsur, went above and beyond. Will definitely come back.
Great as first time, tasty shrimp cocktail sauces, thanks!

We had an outdoor cabin and that was fantastic. A little more quiet, but great service. The food was absolutely amazing. Yes, it comes with a price tag, but I was completely from ne to pay this one. Thank you!!!!
The best food in our neighborhood! We love the ribs & chicken!  Service is always impeccable & everyone is attentive. Highly recommend Quality Meats.

Overall the experience was rushed and impersonal. The New York strip was great but paired poorly with cold sides of corn brûlée, spinach and potatoes.
Non committal perfunctory visits from wait staff who don't listen before disappearing again. Dinner felt frenetic and loud in the chaotic environment rather than refined and worth the price tag. Very few modestly priced wines on the list meant we had to order single glasses.

Not worth the splurge.
Dinner was awesome - steak was superb - will go back and recommend to others.
What a fun and energetic place to eat!  Food was fantastic and service was excellent!!!
Overall good food but unfortunately we could not get inside seating so had to settle for outdoor cabin. Not the best place to have dinner

We went to quality meats for my husbands birthday. I reserved one of their outdoor cabins and it was perfect. Quiet and private - room was heated and comfortable on a brisk evening. The food was very good- we shared the Tomahawk ribeye which was perfect for us. Sons had ribs and a filet minon- get the Caesar salad it’s unique and flavorful. They gave us complimentary sticky pudding cake for his bday which was their signature and delicious - would highly recommend this steakhouse.

Visiting town for spring break. QM recommended by a local and did not disappoint. Food was excellent and service top notch. Honey short ribs appetizer was off the charts, filet prepared perfectly and who knew broccoli could be so delicious?! Parmesan fries a must.

Highly recommend.
I do Quality Meats for my business lunches 10/10 recommend!
Great food and service! Shoved in a corner so not great ambience.
The food was amazing, as was the service. We had a wonderful evening with our group of 8.
It was delicious and the team did a great job helping us celebrate! We’ll be back!
Best experiment out of all the venues we’ve done our dinners at over the past 4 years

This is a solid choice for a great steak dinner in midtown at a reasonable price.  The interior is very cool with a lot of different rooms and levels.  Service was excellent and attentive and the food all high quality, as you’d expect from the name — oysters, ribs, charcruterie, massive porterhouse.  And the bill was reasonable for the quality and the location.  Definitely recommend.
Delicious food!  Attentive server who was knowledgeable about the menu.
I took my friend here for a birthday an it was amazing!
We were late due to traffic. They accommodated  pretty quickly.   Foods are always great!!!
The food was great but the noise of the place is imposible. Next table was so noisy that we couldn’t listen to each other at our table
Entire experience was lovely. Food and service was exceptional and our server, Michael, was wonderful.
Food was fantastic, service was good. It was super loud, though, and some woman next to us was literally screaming about spreadsheets and coworkers. Killed the vibe.
Steak was fantastic. Sides were also very good. Ambient environment was ideal for meetings.

Solid food as always but terrible service.  Table wasn’t ready despite many open tables around us. Server disapeared for 20 mins at a time.  Took over 30 mins to pay our bill and leave.  Had finished plates sitting in front of us for 15 mins+.

It seems like they were upset we didn’t order drinks since they asked three times and then neglected us.
We dont live in NY but we try to get to Quality Meats and/or Quality Italian every time we're in town.  Fantastic food, and impeccable service!

name: Lido
addressComponentsLongName: 2168 Frederick Douglass Blvd.,  New York, NY 10026

reviews.reviewsText: A jewel!! Everything was first class! Love it and I'm planning to go back often
I have gone to Lido many times.  This time the server seemed to be distracted and disengaged.  He was not disrespectful but more unbothered.   I expect more from them.

Love this neighborhood gem. Great food, good prices, excellent value and the service is always so nice and friendly. I go here all the time. I order the same..the warm kale salad, the pasta aribbiata and they never disappoint.

The food was amazing and Lido was the perfect atmosphere for our Easter Sunday brunch. Ben, our server, was great! My only issue was the bottomless brunch ended at 3:30 and our reservation was at 2:30. I wish we would’ve been warned of the time the brunch ended before making our reservation. Overall, everything was perfect! I have a new favorite neighborhood restaurant.
I was in a party of four, and we had an excellent time. The waiter happily explained each dish, and helped us choose. The food was top-notch and I heartily recommend the restaurant.

We had a bottomless brunch reservation and we were seated promptly. Service was great, attentive server and friendly staff. Happy Lido is in the neighborhood, sorry it took us so long to give this place a try. Will be back for sure. The food was excellent.
very nice italien-like place with excellent food, even gluten-free
I enjoy coming here! I always order the short-rib hash because it tastes divine. I also had a glass of Prosecco which was just right!
Great food, service and ambience.  My mother and I reconnected, by chance, in Lido’s with a friend that we hadn’t seen in over 20 years!  So glad that we were there!
As usual: efficient, friendly service, delicious food, upbeat ambiance.

After coming here multiple times int he past, I was really disappointed by this most recent time. For the second time coming here, we were in and out in less than an hour. We used to come up here for celebratory brunches after racing but for the cost and how much we were shuffled out; it's not worth it. What most disappointed me was when I had my fork in my hand and I took a moment to chat with my boyfriend in between mouthfuls and the server asked me if I was done with my food. There was still food on the plate and my fork is still in my hand. Just not worth it with the cost of food; waste of money.

I gave Lido a overall 3 based upon the front desk. They think they are a high end restaurant (actually even the high end restaurants don’t do this). When I arrived a few minutes before my guests they would not seat me. They said I had to wait. However usually one is offered the bar. Well there was no room at the bar and they didn’t offer it. They use the bar for food service. So I had to go outside and wait for my guests. When they arrived they said oh you came back.  I told them I do this once and will never return. They didn’t seem to care. The food was good but not good enough to go through this. The waiter was very good although it seemed he was the only one.
Great vibe.  Excellent food and service.  My spaghetti was pretty average but everything else they I and my party ordered was  exquisite. Definitely look forward to returning.
One of the best in south Harlem. I recommend it highly. Even though the noise level was a bit energetic I lived the entire experience

Lido has a great vibe. Authentic care for their guests makes you feel welcome when you walk in the door. Food and drink are great. Love te arugula and pear salad, and the squid ink pasta. Highly recommend
I’m from DC and loved, loved my first dinner at Lido. Quintessential neighborhood restaurant with soft jazz and great food. —RS
Fantastic place for Brunch. Great good and very trendy vibe.
