Excellent neighborhood place. Good food and selection. Noise level was pretty energetic but not unbearable.
Delicious.  No matter what you order on the menu,  the food is always delicious.
Generally good. Restaurant was busy.  Service was slightly slower than expected.
Food was good. A little too much sauce on the pasta for me, but tasty.
Our favorite brunch place in SOHA. Food and service excellent as usual.
We were on the “heated” patio which was COLD against the plastic window. The food, drinks and service were excellent.
Everything was amazing. Lamb chop portion size was a bit small for my husband but delicious.
Always amazing!
Our server was very nice, cheerful, and made us feel very comfortable
Everything was perfect. Wonderful server, great ambiance, nice patrons and tasty licio us food.

Felt rushed throughout our lunch experience, the waiter was also not very friendly. Last time I was there I had a bad experience with the waiter being rude when I pointed out that the pasta was  VISIBLY burnt…he didn’t care to do anything about it, so I no longer see the point of purchasing pasta dishes from them— I think the attitude towards guests is pretty consistent, so I may only come here for drinks if friends really want to go.
I went today to celebrate my birthday at Lidos. It is one of my favorite restaurants in city. My friends and family love coming here to enjoy the meal.

Love love love Lido’s. It’s become one of my favorite places to eat. Vibe is so chill and it’s great for any occasion. Drinks are so tasty and well curated and food is top tier. I recommend to any and everyone, such a gem in Harlem.

All staff are friendly and personable, and the place was hopping--completely full--when we left at 12:30. Get a table right at 10:30 am if you want a quieter brunch experience. Diverse, stylish and friendly clientele. Food was terrific.
We’d forgotten how great Lido is.  We’ll be back!
Had not been back to this place in a long time.  Brunch was really nice and they were very accommodating.  Wait staff was excellent
Literally some of the best food I’ve ever had. I was literally incapacitated from how good it was. Absolutely amazing and will come again!

A neighborhood restaurant with great food, service, and ambiance. We were there for Restaurant Week, and every course was wonderful. Food was far richer than we normally eat, making it special -and everything was delicious. ‘Outside’ space was heated and very comfortable. Very highly recommend!
I've been to Lido several times before, and they never disappoint.  The food and service were excellent, and I highly recommend this place.

Lido is a great local restaurant. Food is normally delicious. This visit during restaurant week was not so good. Salmon cakes were undercooked. Potato and kale mash was cold. The apple tart dessert was amazing tho. All in all I will come back many times to Lido because I believe that maybe the chefs helpers had an off night cause it was very busy. Service was excellent!

Good local spot. Food always great. 
Good martinis.
The ambiance and service were great.  The food was good.  I would recommend it to a friend.
As always, the staff and waiters are amazing, food is terrific, best spot in Harlem (and maybe the City).

Many of the dishes were excellent but the fish - especially the halibut, was overcooked. I know it’s difficult to cook fish perfectly, but the fish was tough and lacked the delicacy that good cooking enhances. The eggplant/zucchini chips were AMAZING.
Service was good. Everyone was happy w meals but me. The octopus had too much onion and capers - overwhelming the main attraction.

Really loved dining at Elea, the music is upbeat and the lighting is dim, which makes for a fun dining experience. The lychee martini was delicious as was the dip sampler. Portions are fairly large, where we had plenty of leftovers. The staff was really welcoming and attentive. Would return !
Great experience! Variety of options for vegetarians!
Really excellent food and first rate service in a beautiful environment.  Highly recommend.

Given what we'd heard from others, we had high expectations for our first visit to elea. Unfortunately, they were not met.  Some of the food was very good but others such as the spreads were average compared to other Greek restaurants in New York and some of the entrees were greatly over salted.  The service was friendly but very unreliable.  We went long stretches with wine and sometimes water glasses not being refilled.  We liked the ambiance but doubt that will be enough to bring us back.

Service and food were excellent. The grilled octopus is a must! The whole party enjoyed their meal and we could actually hear each other talk, unlike so many places nowadays. A plus was the manager who made sure to go to each table asking how the meal was.

Very good indeed , Great good and service , very accommodating with number of people for the reservation , tentative care outside (patio) brunch entrees are  great for both value and quality . We will be back definitely after our weekend “training “ session . Thx

We love Elea and eat there all the time!!
Delicious salads, octopus, dips..
But lately, Sat nights have a DJ upstairs which can be very nice but at times is just way to loud (like a wedding) and we’d wish they’d keep the sound level down a couple notches so that we don’t have to yell at each other to hear!

Amazing food as usual!
We are frequent guests at Elea but lately the noise level has been super loud due to a DJ.
We do like the DJ but the noise level should be brought down a couple of notches.
Lately, it sounds like a Bar Mitzvah or wedding and we must scream across the table to hear!

I’ve been here before for brunch and dinner and the service was great. I don’t know if they were just having a off night but our waiter was non existent we had to flag down other waiters to get more drinks and asked three different ppl to get the check.
This restaurant presents well made, tasty entrees in an efficient manner making it an enjoyable place to dine. Prices are on the high side.

Elea never fails to please the palette or the patron. This is a neighborhood gem and one of my favorites. Farro Islands Salmon and Grilled Shrimp are perfection. Go early if you prefer quiet dining. The DJ starts the evening party at 9pm. Always fun and lovely no matter what time you do!

Elea is a wonderful place to meet friend(s) for dinner. Lively, but not so noisy that you can't have a conversation. Very attentive service. Food is very tasty and, if your friends like to share dishes, there are so many good options.

Love Elea... the Cretan Negroni is a great cocktail to start. Their fresh pita bread is maybe the best I've ever had. We have yet to find something on the menu that isn't fantastic. I highly recommend this restaurant.
Our cosmos did not taste right but our service quickly replaced. The second ones were much better.
We felt rushed at the end after finishing our mains. We felt pressured to either order dessert or leave,  even though we had only been there for an hour and ordered a ton of food and drinks.

Please get rid of those horrible paper straws! They just don’t work!
It makes it hard to enjoy cocktails when the paper straws disintegrate in minutes.
Such a nice night

Nice neighborhood spot! Good service. Food was fine, but not hugely memorable. The dips (hummus, fava bean, and a third I can’t remember) all basically tasted the same. The spanakopita was decent. The mousakka was okay, we took the leftover to go and never got around to eating it, so you can conclude it wasn’t hugely memorable. 
We were there to celebrate a birthday, and it was surprising that they did nothing even though we didn’t order dessert—not a candle, not a complimentary cookie, nothing. Would’ve gone well with the “neighborhood gem” brand if they’d made some gesture. But overall quite nice for the sparse west 80s.
It’s always good, and always fun! We will be back soon!
The food was delicious ! A really awesome restaurant week experience. The staff was so kind, exceptional service
great  service
Always excellent food and great service. We would highly recommend Elea to everyone
The food and service was good. There are a lot of better options for Mediterranean food.

Great food as always
Bubbly ambiance
Outdoor structure where we were seated was very cold. Curtains did not block the strong wind. And the floor was leaning significantly so the table was wobbling and leaning as well
Excellent food and drinks! Service could have been faster. Would def recommend to all

We went to Elea to celebrate my husband’s birthday; the experience did not disappoint.
The food was exquisite, the staff helpful and the service prompt, friendly and professional.
The evening was a delight; a lovely setting, delicious food, superb selection of wines and after dinner liquors; it does not get better than that!
Lovely meal, nice ambiance, great service, reasonably priced for Manhattan. Wish we lived closer, we’d definitely go more often. A new “go-to” spot when we are on the UWS for sure.
Food was great, service impeccable as a the atmosphere very nice.  Will definitely be coming back.
Good neighborhood restaurant.  Always something nice to eat… good ambiance and service

I have been wanting to return for the consistent amazing Greek food and friendly staff. The specialty drinks were delicious and complicated, made perfectly, and the salads, Elea chips, chicken souvlaki and calamari were delicious. The staff were attentive and lovely. I look forward to returning soon!
Food, service, ambiance were all fantastic. Highly recommend.
I had a lovely birthday dinner at Eléa! Food and drinks were excellent and the staff were very nice and pleasant. They even surprised me with birthday drinks and sparklers!
Always delivers. Had a wonderful lunch with the ladies, and it’s always a promising time with great food and ambience. Friend was impressed and will be back again.
Have eaten here several times, both for dinner and brunch and have never been disappointed.  Highly recommend it, especially if you want to go upscale on the West Side.
Great all around!
very good diiner. Music was loud

This is a treasure to have in the neighborhood and many of the people who return are looking for good food cooked and served in an innovative manner by a service staff with an interest in food.  The atmosphere in the restaurant is one of good cheer and warmth as if one were going to Mama's kitchen.  A lovely experience with a good wine and liquor selection.
6:15 was the children’s hour. The restaurant was filled with children who were behaving like children. I will go back at a later hour.
Late birthday celebration for Mom and daughter. It was a very nice experience at Gyu Kako. Food is always good and moderately priced. Thank you for a lovely experience.

The waiter we had wasn’t attentive to us at all he came twice and that was it I felt like a ghost in the restaurant and it was also hard to hear when they were explaining what the meat was and what the proper time was to cook it
The staff is very friendly and the food is delicious as well as the atmosphere. Greatly recommended.

This was my first time experiencing a hotpot type experience and I am glad this location is where I went as a first timer. It was a small wait for my reservation, but once I got there. It was amazing!

Going again with friends, soon! Not even a month after I took my mom there I’m going back!!! 😂 see you soon Gyu-Kaku!
First time having KBBQ, absolutely loved it.

We  ordered the food 4:30, instead of happy hour price they charged original price, the chicken wings we ordered came in so late and one of the piece was cold , are they recycled from leftovers ? Very disappointed.

We got one of the combos for two, and they were out of one of the more expensive cuts of meat, and instead of asking us what we would like to double up on for the others, they gave us the cheapest cut of meat as the one to double up on. The food quality was passable, but not exceptional. The service was almost nonexistent. This place has such a great reputation, but it must be from out of towners or someone who hasn’t traveled much.
Great experience , food magnificent. Great pricing,

Server was excellent!  Food was wonderful!  Plenty leftover between by date and I.  Definitely made for a special Valentine’s Day.

Thank you.
Jack

This was my second time coming here and like the first it was good. Great and friendly service as well as amazing food. Waiters are always checking on you and even the bathroom was very nice and clean. 10/10 would recommend

Arrived 15 minutes early and the host forgot about us and ended up waiting for 45 minutes after a few times of asking if we’ll be seated.
Other than that the food and the wait staff service was amazing!
All good but slow service due to how popular and crowded it was
I lov the food
Los tragos no estaban bien preparados, la comida tardó más de lo que esperaba.
Amazing food and service!!

Family in from out of town Everybody Loved it!
Great mix of food and the service was excellent!
The food is always delicious! The waiters/waitresses could get better at customer service. You often have to hunt them down to try to ask for something. Otherwise I recommend
Fast service and friendly staff took us right away
Super fun family dinner!
The new hostess needs to be friendlier other then that everyone else is great.
De loin le meilleur repas!!! Super service!!! Qualité de la nourriture exceptionnel!!
Prices are super reasonable. And food is great.
La comida excelente pero el personal deja mucho que desear, mala actitud de las meseras

I gifted my son tickets to the BASQUIAT exhibit and the WWE Holiday Tour! I know he enjoys cooking and I knew this experience would be awesome. He had the very best time. Has been talking about how he grilled his own food and that it was amazing. We came early after a mix up and the hostess was super accommodating and seated us early - we are grateful. It was a bit busy and so the service was a little slow but we really didn’t mind. My family got to enjoy each others company and enjoy the moment!
A fun family or group experience trying different kinds of meats and cooking them to your liking.

Everything was great. It was my Christmas present to my kids since we moved back to NYC. My only issues was the placement we were seated, granted I didn’t say anything but we were seated by the door and it was freezing outside and everything someone came in, the cold air blow directly on us. Other than that, everything was fantastic. I wish that had more seafood options and vegetable options on their menu.
Excellent food and Service.
Restaurant très agréable en famille. On peut faire griller soi-même les morceaux de viande. Budget correct pour une famille de 5.
Always a fun place to go for a casual meal !
Birthday celebration was great!
Great place my family loves it hope it continues to keep doing wel.
It was great the sever Anthony was awesome great food and drinks one of our favorite spots
Always a great go-to. Great good and service.
High quality experience
Would have been better if not for the little kids running around the aisles.
We went to Gyu Kaku for my son’s 14th birthday. The food was great and it was so much fun! Service was excellent. It was the perfect place for this occasion.
Extremely poor customer service at the front and not accommodating family with young kids.

One of the cuts of meat was very tough and not enjoyable. I told one of the servers and she didn’t say or do anything. Not even a suggestion. Like she shrugged it off.

I’ve been her many times over the last few years, I was disappointed.

This was my first time dining in at Gyu Kaku. The door staff was receptive and welcoming. I loved the ambiance of the restaurant and we were the only table in our section. Our server, Arturo seemed like he was on the back end of a long day at the restaurant and I get it! He went on to explain the menu and how the food is coursed. Straight to the point no frills type of service. If I was a tourist, I probably would of felt a little rushed to close out the night. Stella Artois are $7/bottle. Arturo also swapped our grill top for a cleaner, less burnt one.

The apps were phenomenal. Soups, salads etc. Proteins were seasoned well. The idea of cooking dinner table side is engaging and fun. I will be back to try the meat lovers option.
Food was delicious!!  We were seated right away. Kid-friendly.
Tasty brunch sat outside at the Carnegie Diner, attentive staff, decent menu and tasty food. Enjoyable experience. Thank you!

No real benefit in having an OpenTable reservation.
We just got on a list once we got there.
Thank you for the absolute best French toast of my life! The staff is amazing - can’t wait to go back.
Carnegie Diner has delicious food.  Very busy so make a reservation.  Cute atmosphere.  Service was not great.  Recommend eating here.
Great place to eat with my family after a great day if sightseeing.

After a relatively short wait, even though we had a reserved table for 5, we were seated.  The staff, who were so terribly busy, were so accommodating to our wishes and took the time to explain the menu when asked.  Our orders were taken and surprisingly the food came out quickly and as ordered.  As a restaurateur, I was impressed.  We will definitely return.  Thank you to the wonderful Staff.
Food was good but felt rushed, needed to ask for more coffee and just felt a bit manic all around the whole place.
The food was very salty and expensive! Definitely no value for money!!
Crowded, noisy, slow service, big food but not tasty or cared for. Fast food in a crowded chaotic setting, skip it . Not the real deal

Great atmosphere. Good menu choice. Waitress was fantastic - really helpful when my son wasn’t happy with his pork chop. Loved the food! Would like to come bank to try the 24 layer chocolate cake a it looked amazing!!!

The experience was whatever. Not the worst I've ever had, but certainly not the best. I had a long hair in my salad which the server was apologetic about, but that was as she was asking us to give up our table for other diners (my friend's husband was in the restroom and we were already gathering our children). She had already given me a hand to the face when I tried to get her attention because my coffee mug was cracked down the side and leaking all over the table. I understand a busy, touristy New York restaurant can be stressful (I used to work in one), but that doesn't mean you should sacrifice your customer service. The price we paid for our meal was definitely not worth the overall experience.
Wonderful brunch experience from the food to the service and atmosphere!
Don't confuse this with the Carnegie Deli that is no longer.
Delicious food and big portions. Very busy so make sure to make a reservation before.

We were there to spend money. They seemed to focus more on pushing people through than maximizing cash flow on each customer. The portion sizes are huge and tasted fine. The Desserts looked amazing, unfortunately they never asked us if we wanted any. They forgot a couple things on our order but took them off the bill when we notified them. Great potential here, if they figure out a good flow.

Busy and popular place.  Staff were very nice to talk to. Kitchen was super busy.  Our fries and onions rings arrived first while rest of our entrees came out much later and fries and onion rings were cold by then. Requested fresh fries and onion rings.... fries were great but onion rings for which we waited 15 minutes arrived as we finished our meal were the rejects.  Blobs of onion and batter stuck to each other and no one at the table  could eat.  Disappointing as cost was $10.  Server too busy to care and the 2 persons taking food from kitchen and giving to server for our table clearly do no quality control.  Wish I had taken a picture to post.  To top it off, we were charged for 2 onion rings!! 

We planned to go back the next day for breakfast but the experience the evening before deterred us.

The diner next to us was on his phone and very loudly conversing the entire time we were there.  He was obvious trying to attract attention as well as impress everyone near him.  Too bad management can’t or won’t try to do something about extremely noisy patrons.  It was impossible for other patrons to converse with their luncheon mates.
Delicious food. Packed place, make a rezy on weekend. Excellent service. A bit noisy.
Food was very good but that positive was offset by indifferent service.  Waitress was not attentive.  We had made a brunch reservation but still had to wait almost a half hour to be seated

Crazy busy place to go for brunch on Sunday.
Prices reasonable, your typical diner atmosphere in the city.

Overall, the family enjoyed the meal.  Good basic core items like burgers, sandwiches and salads.  However, a burger is $20 - $26, pastrami sandwiches are $24 - $30, and omelets are $20 - $24, just to give you and idea.  Expect if you’re a family of four, a basic meal with beverages, tax and gratuity will set you back $200.
We had dessert and coffee here pre-show. Fabulous!  We ordered cheesecake, chocolate cake and red velvet cheesecake. All were delicious. Best coffee I had during our entire trip!
The food and service is outstanding. Menu is lengthy. A reasonable deal for NYC
Service is worse than poor. Food quality is less than average.
This diner was close to our hotel and brought back memories of the Carnegie Deli from years ago. Food was great, portions generous and ambience terrific.
The pastrami sandwich wasn't great, just decent.  I did like all the accompaniments and the service was excellent.
Great place for a group before or after visiting Central Park. Food was outstanding

Loved last meal at Carnegie but this time the quinoa/spinach salad was just OK - seemed bland - as if no lemon or vinegar in dressing.  Salmon that I added was overcooked, and we received toasted white bread to accompany, which seems odd. My friend had the Greek Salad and rated as "so-so".  Maybe an off night? Or maybe should stick to deli fare..............
Ate dinner here before a show. Very noisy. Ordered fish. Was just ok. Too much money for what we got. On a positive note, we told the server we needed to make a show, and service was quick

Carnegie Deli was a great place to eat before a show at Carnegie Hall.  The food was very good although the servings were too much for us to finish. The carrot cake was outstanding! Our waiter was friendly and helpful.
The Bottomless Mimosas are served cold and delicious. The extensive menu, is NY Dinner big and the dishes we had were great
Great for “brunch!” Lavazza coffee is excellent. Very fresh fruit as a side, tasty pancakes (with vanilla perhaps?), beautifully prepared crepes. Very friendly and efficient service, even when busy!
Had a fantastic breakfast at Carnegie Diner. Staff was very accomodating and food delicious!
We waited 20 minutes on an "energetic" Sunday. VERY noisy. I will not go back because of that. I was looking forward to the Lobster benedict, but the lobster pieces were overcooked.
The best place for brunch or lunch on Manhattan. You must make reservations and eat one meal here while you are visiting NYC. Great sandwiches and desserts! We come here every time we visit!
Seated very quickly with reservation. Restaurant is busy and efficient. Good value for food portions. Overall an excellent choice for Sunday brunch!
Something for everyone, generous portions, excellent service!
Grandsons Juilliard recital was the occasion. Great service, ambience and food.

Waiter was inattentive and didn’t bring requested items in a timely manner. Toast was cold went meal was served. For the cost of brunch I would of expected better service and hot food. I would say don’t bother going here.
Very good Greek food in midtown. Excellent service but a bit pricey.
Amazing food and superb service. Great for a large party, it’s noisy but tolerable
Fabulous food and wonderful service! Extensive Greek wine list.
Estiatorio Milos NY always delivers quality food and service!
easter dinner - excellent food and wine and highly recommend
Excellent service and fresh seafood! Would recommend this restaurant!
Beautiful venue, great service, fantastic food! Thank you for the wonderful evening.
As always impeccable service & food! Rack of lamb was superb!
Met old friends . We all had an amazing time . Always glad to return
The prix fix for lunch is great . The quality  and freshness of the fish is also outstanding…

We went for my husband’s birthday dinner with friends and had the most fantastic meal. Everything was so perfectly cooked and served. They sat us downstairs and at first I thought upstairs would be better,  but I loved the downstairs decor and the noise level was a little better than upstairs. 
Though Milos is definitely a pricey place to dine, it’s worth it if you can splurge.  It did not disappoint on any level!
As always, excellent lunch and service. One of New  York’s finest!
As always fresh produce well prepared. The business lunch is a very good value for the money
Great food, friendly service.  Like the scale and decor

Most fantastic evening from the greeting as we walked in to the time we left! Food was delicious and the recommended wine unbelievable!  Service surpasses expectations every time we are there and we are from another city so not regulars at the restaurant.  Yet they treat you like family and couldn’t be any more pleasant!! Love this place!!
Absolutely freshest and best seafood in New York.
Loup de mer incredible!
Excellent octopus and grilled fish (balada). Service was also excellent
Food and service were amazing! They specifically asked if we were going to the theater after and timed it perfectly.
Es una comida increíble, muy caro, gran servicio, buen vino, es para ocasiones especiales. Me faltó opción de menu ejecutivo que entre semana no hay.
Food was amazing! Very attentive service! I can’t wait to go back.
We always love eating at Milos. Although the prices are breathtakingly high , the food is always very fresh and delicious.
Really nice please but honestly too expensive ……..

We had the $45 fixed priced lunch.  Seemed like a good deal—you get an appetizer, entree and dessert.  But the food you get is not typical Milos quality and size portions.  Mediocre fish, lame fruit plate.  Not nearly the quality I expect from Milos.  And $45 is too much—given the low quality food they serve at lunch.
We felt a little rushed.  Very politely of course

The 3 course fixed price lunch is outstanding value and the 3 courses (salmon tartare, grilled dorado and a cake) were delectable. Helpful rapid service in a place that my wife and I have come to love over successive visits to NY.
Delicious as always. Get the Tower. Fried Thinly sliced eggplant & squash  w yogurt dip. We sat downstairs because it was a little quieter. Wait staff was terrific.
Became a favorite for all four of us. Services was outstanding, as was the food and wine selection. Delicious!
Excellent seafood and service. Somewhat pricey however.
The fish just cannot be beat! What a wonderful dining experience!
Again all was nearly perfect at Milos from entrance to exit. Exceptional food and service of Milos is a source of joy in increasingly disappointing NYC dining.
A winner all the way around , everything comes together beautifully

High-quality offerings, esp. notable for the outstanding fish--both raw ingredients and preparation (classical Greek & other).  Relatively expensive, but not surprisingly so given the quality of the operation and its elegant premises in a very high-rent district of midtown Manhattan.
All plates were first rate.   Wonderfully prepared fresh seafood.   Not inexpensive, but a very worthy Saturday night selection for fish, and of course eggplant chips and saganaki!
Excellent food and service.  Flawless.  A bit pricey….
Absolute perfection. Expensive but worth every penny.

We enjoyed what food we received, but after 1 and 1/2 hours had to leave before our entree was served. Our waiter was very kind, but the food was not served in enough time to enjoy it. Very disappointing.
Our favorite Greek restaurant and one of our top 3 in NYC.

Does not get much   better!!   Had not been back in a while ...they did not disappoint.  Excellent service and outstanding food from apps to desert. Love the process of selecting fish for the table from the ice trays!!  Found some good wine on the list (great Greek selection) for reasonable value.  Definitey expensive...but worth it.

I ordered something the waiter obviously either thought was overpriced or just too expensive for me (the lobster salad) - it was so embarrassing, I never really got over it and couldn’t really enjoy the experience. The bread was fabulous. The scene was very finance bros coming up for lunch. *yawns*

French Roast remains a neighborhood standard and great place for brunch. Easily recommend the omelette station and mimosas are also quite tasty. For inside seating, try to not sit too close to the server station as it is much louder  there.

My companion and I both enjoyed our entrees very much. I ordered the Capellini with shrimp while she ordered a very traditional hamburger with French fries. Both were great and we enjoyed dining at one of their outdoor tables on a warm Spring afternoon in Manhattan.
French Roast is always my 1st choice for dining out on UWS.  Chef is terrific, service, the best! Always a lovely time out.

Your food never disappoints! From your crispy calamari to moules, French fries, arugula salad, seafood pasta and hamburger— all were super delicious!

And… our waiter never missed a beat while showing a sense of humor along the way!!!
yummy omelettes! excellent service.  Probably eat here at least once a week!

I am a frequent flyer. The occasion involved a birthday and the celebrant wanted her usual favorite, coq au vin, which has been, heretofore, the best on the upper westside. Let's just say it was a mysterious conglomeration of undercooked vegetables and overcooked meat in a very strange tasting 'sauce' (hint: liquid smoke, not red wine). The restaurant was amazing, took it back, did not charge. Bravi. Rest of the meal was ok, not up to the usual standard. Arugula salad was limp, sour dressing. Bread = brilliant. French fries (also a BD request) were chewy, not crisp, suggesting reheated or old potatoes to start with. No complaints from others present about their meal and the wine was fantastic. They won't lose my business, but since you ask, now you know. Perhaps a new, tired or lazy chef.

When it comes to a night out with friends, French Roast New York has all the makings for an unforgettable experience from start to finish. The warm and welcoming host, to the attentive General Manager Sam Belanger who went out of his way to make sure everyone was taken care of, down to the bartender crafting a fabulous mocktail for one of my sober friends - everything was above and beyond!
 
The ambiance alone was enough to make us feel like we entered a Parisian bistro spot right here in New York. To make the night even more special, our waiter helped us select some staples from the menu and some specials which included a delicious beet root salad, Escargots en Croute, truffled hand-cut fries, house Chicken Liver Pate, Halibut with creamy polenta that was cooked to perfection and Duck Confit over basil pistou risotto - mouthwatering! To top off this amazing culinary experience, we were treated with a succulent profiterole accompanied by singing from both the GM and staff. French Roast New York is an absolute must-have on your New York restaurant list - five stars all around!

Excellent food and cocktails, great atmosphere, amazing staff. Very accommodating! My favorite UWS spot!  It’s also a great holiday spot for those who stay in town or are visiting. I recommend reservations Friday night thru Sunday night.

-B Jackson

This was my first time back since 2020 and I was delighted to find the ambiance unchanged and the food as excellent as before.  French Roast is a true bistro -  the same traditional menu prepared with consistently and reliably well.  It is once again my go to place for lunch on the UWS.
Best omelettes  in town! I and always great coffee!
We LOVE French toast. Favorite meal is outdoor brunch.
The first time I was disappointed.
Food was good, restaurant is lively with noise but not so loud that you can' shave a conversation. Traditional French brasserie menu. Not stuffy. A solid choice for dinner.
A neighborhood gem. No wonder it’s been around for decades!
Solid neighborhood spot that never disappoints -- and the mixologist is amazing!
Great upper west side brunch site. Sit outside and bring your dog.

I went for a Pat Lafreda burger which has always been great at other places.
This was very mediocre and fires were burnt.

Love the neighborhood place, the servers, the arugula salad with grapefruit, chevre, pear and slivered almonds...  AND I got my burger and fries done to perfection, just the way I like. The creme brulee is top notch too.

I eat here at least once every couple of weeks and yesterday service was really bad. Took 20 minutes upon seating just to get coffee for one. Wine and cappuccino for others in Party took another 15 minutes. And then long wait for meal . Looked like there were not enough servers
It's a gem and we are so happy to have this wonderful restaurant in our neighborhood.  there are so few like this which have wonderful food and a friendly atmosphere...
straight forward. delicious. A neighbor classic still going strong.
Excellent spot for Brunch. Close to central park. Attentive service and delicious food. Options to eat inside or the adorable seating outside cafe style. Highly recommend!
Not family friendly — tight space for high chairs and no place for small folded up strollers
Place was full on a rainy cool evening. I had the Cassoulet and it was delicious!  I recommend it!
Another lovely meal with great service. Love the cocktails and standard brunch options- haven’t had a bad meal yet, and I’ve been coming for years.
Great food. Too noisy inside but intend to return in nicer weather when we can eat outside

We go to the French Roast because the food is always good
The staffing seems a little understaffed for a Sat
brunch
delicious but too noisy

Valentine’s Day at French roast felt special.  When we arrived they were running late for our reservation so they gave us complimentary drinks at the bar.  When we were seated I got the prix fixe menu and my husband got an entree.  We shared dessert.  There was a good amount of food, and all was delicious. They really know how to do Cale tines day well!
Terrific Brunch menu. Great selection and good value.
We have had brunch at French Roast for over 20 years…. It is always good …. A warm, friendly neighborhood place!
Seemed understaffed Friday night. Sat at table but was served by bar tender—who seemed to be working for two. He really hustled but we had to wait for each course and the restaurant was busy
Hood deal for restaurant week. Was crowded and noisy but good and service was very good
Bustling bistro with French fare and Happy Hour specials.
Very pleasing Parisian atmosphere.  Well-presented and delicious hamburger and luxe Caesar salad.  Friendly staff.

One of our ‘go-to’ places in the neighborhood!  It’s always reliable for a good meal.  The restaurant week menu had some great choices.  We enjoyed the lobster ravioli starter, salmon entree and the lava cake dessert was one of the best we’ve ever had!  And the burger and fries is always a great choice.  The servers are all very friendly and attentive.  We really enjoyed our visit.

Went fir restaurant week dinner, calamari melted in your mouth, profiteroles were awesome, my friend had the french onion soup which he thought was delicious and the cheesecake for dessert, we both had grilled lamb loin since it is something we do not usually eat, just enough food and well prepared, going back again.
Great French cafe after a Sunday matinee a block away. It was a crowded brunch crowd but food came quickly and was delicious.
A great place for brunch. There are a lot of choices so everyone can eat what they feel like eating. The food was good, really good service, fun atmosphere for Sunday brunch.
Good outside place with heat lamps especially for breakfast or lunch
Food was really good and the fish was super fresh. The cooked food (appetizers) were tasty.  The prices were super reasonable. Highly recommend.
Outstanding quality at an incredible price point. Couldn’t recommend more highly.
Would highly recommend. Awesome. Great lunch special.

Great as always
Food price and service never disappoints
Always super fresh, delicious and perfectly prepared/presented. Never had a bad experience here. Highly recommended!
The food is always excellently prepared, tasty, and high quality. The service is friendly and efficient. Prices can’t be beat at lunch. Great value. A real neighborhood treasure.

Made reservation for 4 at 12:30pm on Monday. We got there at noon and they were to able to sit us immediately.

We are impressed with the quality and their lunch price is a steal.  Very nice and clean restaurant with friendly service. We all enjoyed our lunch very much.

We didn't order dessert as we want to try Levain cookies which is only a 5 mins walk away. Perfect lunch and we will absolutely come back again when we are back in New York next time.
Food, ambience, service … outstanding! Wonderful meal as always.
Decent price for lunch. Variety of nice Japanese appetizers. Worth trying.
We loved this place. Neighborhood feel and delicious sushi. It really exceeded our expectations. The service was great!
Dad in town and he loves sushi. Everyone loved their orders. I had one of the best omakase selections ever.
This place is the best. The rice is perfect and the fish is fresh.
Amazing quality. Some dishes are best in town. Some you can’t find anywhere
Always a treat for us, quick service, delicious food and good price
I love this place. I go there pretty often.
Great lunch special at a consistently good restaurant
Its the best Sushi on the West side.  I'm a long time fan.
We had the Omakase which was exceptionally good. Delicious and fresh food with fantastic flavors. Service was good.
Had a great meal. Well priced, fresh, good service. Would definitely go back
My boyfriend and I enjoyed the lunch specials and had a really nice time. The food was fresh and the service was pleasant. Great price point too!
Good balance and quality and price!! One of my favorite spots

Food was phenomenal but server acted like she hated her job. She never came to the table to refill drinks or check on us unless we asked her to come. When we did ask she acted like we were bothering her. That made what would have been an extraordinary experience a little disappointing. Kudos to the chef however as the sushi was incredible.
Food was absolutely delicious-it’s rare to find sushi places that also cater to vegetarians but Sushi Yasaka exceeded expectations
Favorite sushi place
Birthday celebration. Sushi are always so fresh. Great value
Always amazing quality sushi and all food overall.
Always very solid. Efficient. Large sushi/sashimi/roll selection. All very fresh/authentic. Great place.
Some of the best sushi anywhere, even in comparison to places that are much more expensive.   No particular atmosphere, no particular perfect service.  Just very very fresh tasting sushi.
I went with my son for a Valentine’s Day dinner and it was just perfect.  The service is consistently good and efficient but the quality of the food is what keeps us coming back.  Really excellent!!!
Excellent lunch specials. Delicious and great value.
Such delicious sushi and lovely neighborhood vibe. Love it!
We are so fortunate to have this place in our neighborhood
Exceptional sushi at a fair price, nicely served. Only complaint is structurally high noise level.
I love the sushi. Yummy want it today.
Still the best in the upper west side, by a mile
Restaurant is great. Great sushi for an affordable price. Really worth it. Will be coming back.
Sushi is really fresh! Portions are pretty small so not necessarily as much food for what you spend compared to similar Japanese restaurants in the area.
High cost performance.
Definitely needs a repeat.  One of our fave Japanese food spots in the City!
The meal was delicious and very good quality of dish. Ambiance was also nice. Would highly recommend!
The food was wonderful and we were able to adjust the spice level to our personal preference!

Bustan is consistently delicious! I usually order several of the small and medium plates to share with at least 2 taboon breads (so amazing!) Danny the Host and Louis the bartender could not be nicer nor more accommodating. seating is comfortable (especially at the bar!).
Bustan is more than a neighborhood favorite - its truly a destination to seek out.
Great restaurant with awesome food. Start with 700 degree cabbage!!!

Absolutely amazing ! When. We come to NYC Bustan is always a stop ! The food is always always amazing.  We crave the menu and look forward to coming back!  Thank you Bustan for your constant delicious menu!

The ambiance, service, and food were great. Everything we ordered was delicious - the highlights were the eggplant carpaccio & hummus along with taboon and pita breads. The Israeli salad was very light and refreshing, and the Moroccan fish was flavorful albeit small despite being in the “large plates” section. It was a little strange that we were told to order everything all at once as opposed to small plates first followed by the larger plates, but the kitchen paced it well so it worked out. All-in-all, it was a great dining experience & we would return to try other menu items.

Excellent service and tasty food.  Menu warns that the tradition is food sharing and so the plates are identified as small, medium, and large.  Good advice.  Salad was especially unique and tasty.  There is a smaller heated garden room in the back of the restaurant which will be less crowded, warm, and quieter.  Not fancy or uppity, but great food at reasonable prices.

Appetizers were terrific but the entrees took 40 minutes and were so overcooked we left most of them. Very disappointing because it started off so well. Seemed odd since it wasn’t packed & other tables got their food much sooner. Probably wouldn’t go back.

The food here has always been incredible. There is not a single bad item on the menu. The wait staff and bartenders are all very friendly. Come here for the food, drinks, and ambiance - and then keep coming back! 10/10 must try!
Food is superb.  Service excellent.  Location great.
Incredibly fresh and delicious food, friendly service, charming interior and bAck patio!

We made a 5:30 reservation for a pre-Broadway dinner and it was delightful. We elected to sit in the garden (which was very warm and covered) which was nice as it was a bit quieter than the main restaurant and we wanted to chat.  Our waitress was very attentive, cocktails were great and the food was very tasty. We liked that the plates are designed family style for sharing so you get to taste a lot of things without leaving a lot of food behind.

We absolutely loved the experience. The food was incredible and comes in shareable sizes. Can’t recommend the Moroccan fish enough! The staff was very kind and super apologetic towards seating us 10 mins after our reservation time.
All the dishes we had were inventive, fresh, healthy and a treat.  Great for sharing.  I will go back.
Delicious!!
Fabulous. Always love this place. Spicy feta to die for.

the food, as always, was excellent.
However, the music was way too loud and the noise level was unpleasant.
Cute restaurant.  Great small plates and larger plates were also delicious. Service was great.  Rare to find such a combination.

First time; recommended by neighborhood friend
Amazing unique dishes; lamb crockpot n the taboon bread r keepers
Very tasty and delicious food. Very reasonable as well. A neighborhood gem!

I am in NYC for the United Airlines Half.  We saw Bustan listed as Mediterranean in my search.  My wife and I were pleasantly surpised when we got there to find it was an Israeli restaurant.   Sophia, our waitress, did an excellent job guiding us through the culinary experience.  The smoked trout special and taboon bread made a delicious appetizer.  My wife had the Lamb Kebab Halabi.  She said it was over the moon.  I was torn between the branzino and the whole Dorade entrees.  After discussing with Sophia, I  decided on the whole dorade.  It didn't disappoint. 
It was exquisitely seasoned and the taste was tantalizing.  We finished the culinary journey, by sharing the flourless chocale cake.  The whole experience was unbelievably great.
Consistently good creative dishes in a nice environment with a cozy vibe.

I would especially like to commend the server Juliana.

She was efficient, warm, friendly and diligent. The restaurant is fortunate to have her on their team.

Have always been a fan of Bustan and the food from the Mediterranean fish to the amazing taboon bread and the tuna crudo are always a treat. But this is the first time we were not happy with our server. Usually the service is warm and upbeat and we've commented what a good job the restaurant does at hiring staff, but last night's server had a clipped just-being-efficient attitude. When our first round of appetizers was delivered I realized I'd ordered the wrong salad...wanted the gem salad instead of the Greek. Before the salad was even placed on the table I acknowledged my mistake and asked if it was possible to exchange the salad. "I'll ask the kitchen," our server said, "but we won't be able to serve this one. We'll have to throw it out!" I wasn't asking for an admonishment, just if I could switch the salad. (which she did do.) The other disappointment was that we were sitting in the back patio area along the 'tent wall' and it rained heavily during our meal. The floor beneath and around our table flooded and by the end of the meal we had wet shoes and our feet were cold and out umbrellas on the ground were soaked. That's not likely to happen again...but along with the server, it did not make for as warm and lovely an evening as we usually expect from what's a favorite neighborhood restaurant.

Food was top notch.
Udi who I believe was manager was charming and quite helpful.
His presence added to a great meal.

The food start to finish was superior and we were a party of 6 so ordered a wide variety.  The service was extremely pleasant and prompt but Danny the host was outstanding. He welcomed us and did his best to find us  a corner table for us to enjoy!

Overall we had a great culinary experience, our waitress was very good and knowledgeable about the menu items. Food was delicious.It was however very disappointing to have a negative experience with one of the hosts, he was rude and patronizing and had an aggressive response to being touched on his arm….. surprising to say the least how he reacted.
We celebrated my daughter’s 30th birthday and had a great meal. The service was wonderful and they brought a lovely complimentary dessert to share.
Very consistent food quality! Delicious!
We had a great experience. The food and the service was exceptional. We will definitely return.

Exceptional food, the flavor of every dish was outstanding.
 Ambiance was beautiful, the crafted wooden chairs and table were impressive.  And the service is excellent.
Delicious food and great service does not disappoint
Love sitting at the bar for dinner. Good amazing , charming bartender! Crafted margaritas!
Food was amazing and the service was the best. Such a cute cozy place loved everything.
Amazing food and great service. Drinks were great too!
Great Israeli/Magrebi restaurant on the UWS.
Everything was unique and delicious. Great experience.

I called last evening to ask if I could include another person  in my party and to change the time. The restaurant was very busy but they were very accommodating! Great food as always. The appetizers were excellent. I am a big fan of the salads and fish and they were excellent as always. Great experience!
The best I’ve ever been. The food and service was amazing. Waitress was so friendly.
Everything was spectacular!
Ever dish bursting with taste. Superb food

Our reservation was honored on time.   We were seated at a small table and had a pleasant helpful waitress.  The Salad Nicoise was delicious and very generous, the grilled chicken salad was tasty but not as generous a portion.  It was hard to talk as the noise level is very energetic.  The entire staff does their jobs quickly and efficiently.  This is a lovely restaurant in the theater district with a good menu and the feeling of a French bistro.  It is someplace I will return to again.
This is the perfect place for brunch before catching a Broadway show.   The food and service are great, and the location is hard to beat.   It's an easy walk from Moynihan Hall.
Always a fine meal. Service was a bit underwhelming this time.
Friendly hostesses. Oyster special was fabulous, as was the baguette with butter & olive oil dipping plate. Entrees were too salty. As the place filled up, it got extremely loud.
We had our Wedding meal with our daughter! Amazing food, amazing service! Thank you

One of my standby restaurants when attending the theatre. I was joined by friends who had not been there before and was pleased to see how much they enjoyed the afternoon. Always a lively room with a classic French bistro menu and an attentive staff.

Food was just ok, we had higher expectations.  The duck breast special was good, the short ribs just average, and our glasses of wine (Cote de Rhone) were mediocre and would expect a nice such wine from a French bistro.  Good service.

Marseille was definitely a wonderful  pick. The lamb shank with mashed  potatoes and spinach was mouthwatering delicious. The meat was so tender. The service was outstanding and the ambiance was perfect. I would highly recommend it.
Excellent food!! Steak frites are amazing.  As is the seafood pasta. Ambience is charming.  A small piece of France in nyc.  Highly recommend this place.
Great place, excellent food, excellent service. A bit noisy for a conversation.
Amazing food, real french touch, but with terrible service, slow and confuzed. And the restrooms real dirty. A shame

Visiting NYC for the first time with my 18 year old daughter and we found this place online. It did not disappoint, our server was attentive and the food was quick and delicious. It has an upbeat atmosphere and a great location.
Have not been there since before COVID.  Was always a regular.  It is as good as ever!

The oyster happy hour is wonderful!
Food and service was excellent.
Will definitely go back.
We enjoyed a wonderful brunch at Marseilles!  Food and service were excellent. Atmosphere has a nice NYC buzz!  Highly recommend!!

This is a terrific French bistro.  Pleasant ambiance, friendly and knowledgeable staff, nice selection of wines by the glass, and delicious food.  On this visit we had the trout and the special shrimp salad.  Both were perfectly flavored and nicely presented.  Marseilles is a regular stop on our restaurant rotation thru Midtown.

We sat outside, under the heat lamps, for an elegant pre-theater dinner on a chilly Friday night. From a subtle bouillabaisse, a veggie risotto, to a satisfying steak frites, everyone in our big group found great options.  We were all served piping hot food at the same time.  Service was friendly and attentive and we were plenty warm.
My friend and I had dinner before the theater. Everything was on time and food delicious! Most importantly our waitress was the sweetest. Amazing service
Nice dining experience. Service and food were excellent.

We ate at Marseilles before seeing a show. It was the perfect walking distance to the theaters. Great ambiance, great food! The French onion soup was amazing, as was the roasted chicken and the steak frites! The mashed potatoes served with the chicken were delicious!!!! It was a very chilly day so I tried their spiked apple cider (hot drink) and it was soooo yummy!
Great oysters for happy hour and a wonderful bouillabaisse.
Nice ambiance, good lighting, perfect service and friendly. Delicious food and good portion, also a very extensive variety of drinks to offer.

We started with the escargot, which was delicious. We were there for lunch, so we had the duck confirmed served shredded on sour dough grilled bread, which we enjoyed.  For dessert, we splurged on chocolate pot de creme and baba au rhum which was surprisingly light and delicious. We thoroughly enjoyed our visit.
Our waitress Kate was amazing and really made the experience
Great meal and overall experience with my daughters before heading off to a play!
The best onion soup! Fun place with terrific food and service.
Great atmosphere, service was good. so was the food

Wonderful brunch for seven people !Food was delicious ,service was efficient and charming, and round table perfect  for a large group  !Only minor complaints were that some of the mixed drinks were low in alcohol content and noise level was very high at full capacity!
Muy rica comida, muy buen ambiente y buen servicio
Had a large table of family for an early dinner and it was great.
We love Marseille especially for brunch....the food is always deliciously fresh and tasty, the drinks are excellent and the ambience is very cool!

We have visited Marseille several times before and this visit did not disappoint. Firsdt of all, we had excellent service  from our waitress, Hannah. She was so welcoming and, while a busy Saturday lunch crowd, we did not feel rushed. Diverse menu with great options. Entrees  were  delicious.
Charming decor, fantastic service, great food and drinks
Loved it! Such a lovely meal and great, welcoming service!
My first time and worth the experience.  Planning to go back.
The portion of dish is proper for 4 people. Wine is good

The special chicken was supposed to be deboned with a leg. Three legs and a wing section came. Not as described but they did offer to change it.
My lillet was all ice no alcohol and my friends drink was not as requested
My pasta dish and the oysters were excellent

Another outstanding experience.  A wonderful end to a great day. The menu is varied and always tasty. the braised beef was excellent. the service courteous and efficient. a substantial wine list. Just my favorite after matinee restaurant.
Meal before a broadway show
The food was delicious and service was excellent. I love Marseille.

The service, setting, and food were all outstanding. Best Ethiopian food I've had (but I haven't experienced much of it, tbh). I shared a lamb dish with two types of lentils and had a ground chicken sambusa. The sambusa was the best appetizer I've ever had, accompanied by two delicious sauces, one green, one red. The red tasted heavy with paprika. I couldn't quite place the flavors in the green one, but not like the green chutney you'd find in an Indian restaurant, which is what you might expect by visual inspection. I also had two cups of Kenyan black tea. I'd go back to NYC just to eat here again.
We had a birthday dinner at Massawa. It was amazing. The food was great as always. The staff is incredibly kind and accommodating, and helped make this a special occasion. Highly recommend!
Wonderful aromas, delicious food, kind servers. Loved it!

Food was impeccable! And the ambiance is just as great. We really enjoyed our meal here. People are fantastic, however service can be faster and cocktails can be better. But value for money (esp happy hour prices) is great!

The food was delicious. I tried the rose,ginger,lemon and mint mocktail. It took way too long to receive the drink.I didnt get it until my food arrived .The waitress did apologize for delay. The drink wasn't very pleasant. I would suggest adding a simple syrup or either taking out the rose water. The rose water leaves a horrible after taste( tasted like hair products)overall it was a beautiful ambience and I enjoyed the food.That was my first time going there and I will be back but not for that drink.
The food is amazing and reasonably priced.
Perfect location for dinner celebration

Haven't sampled all their food -- the vegan sampler (which seemed popular with other tables too) was filling. Those not used to injera with hands might need to adjust, though the staff was happy enough to supply cutlery.  Service very pleasant, but some staff needed reminding.
The food was absolutely amazing! It took a while to come out but was very much worth the wait. I also loved having the Ethiopian wine for the first time.

Great ambiance and delicious food! And we like the way they integrate technology, patrons scan a QR code and we basically place the order through our phones and Pay for it through the phone too. Waitresses are mainly there to bring us the food/drinks, clear the table, and check on us throughout the night. But we don’t place the order itself with them.
Food was delicious, drinks were delicious. The staff are sweet. The decor is cute. Bathroom was clean. The bartender made a requested drink very well. Brilliant experience. Would go again
Amazing food and environment!

was at columbia
for a basketball game and found this place near gym
delicious food, helpful staff
Lovely spot for Ethiopian food. Nice atmosphere and good food.
Nice ambiance but I would recommend other Ethiopian spots in the city fist.
Excellent food, service and a very warm and welcoming team especially the manager. Ad a local, I will say that you don’t often find this warmth anywhere in Manhattan.
Loved the food.  Service extremely slow and unorganized
Great food with good portions. A nice atmosphere and friendly staff.
Good for a three generation party
Lovely restaurant. It was the first time for us in an Ethiopian restaurant and the food was delicious.
Love it! Really authentic Ethiopian food!
Massawa is such a lovely place. The food is delicious and service was top notch. We enjoyed it very much. Will definitely come back!
Great experience. Excellent ambient and the food was delicious!
The family who owns Massawa are the best! Their food rocks and they serve you with the biggest smiles and a warm, welcoming vibe permeates the restaurant.
Delicious food, calm atmosphere
Love the food.  Sunday nights are really great with live Jazz.

Restaurant was very noisy at 7:30 PM due to almost all tables being filled, which made it very noisy.  Service was very slow but friendly. Prices were reasonable. Food was very good, especially the vegetarian items on the menu.
BEST ETHIOPIAN FOOD IVE EVER HAD IN MY LIFE !!!!!!

The service was great. It was busy, but the server was on it! The food was really good! If you haven't tried ethiopian food, it is quite the experience! The carrot cake was warm and moist and deelish! The coffee is strong just FYI!
Seemed somewhat understaffed, so service was very good but somewhat erratic. The restaurant was busy and on the noisy side just from the conversation. The food was excellent.
Took my mom here to try Ethiopian food for the first time.  She really enjoyed it, and thought that the food had a depth of flavor she had never experienced before!
Excellent food. Nice atmosphere. Lots of vegan options
Very different but very good food in a part of the Columbia neighborhood needing more original places like this.

The food is amazing, but a vegetarian lunch for 3 for over $60 is a bit steep.  Food came out quickly (really instantly) but we had to wait 10 minutes for our water glasses to be filled and staff was not always available.
Food is great. Ordering is by phone and there is very little staff to answer questions or to help customers. I’d go back, but with lower expectations.
Very good food and service.  Will bring friends here.

The food was incredibly tasty and delicious, the servings were good.  However, unfortunately, the service level was very low, as we waited an hour for appetisers to be brought to the table and little to no utensils were provided.  For the price, that was quite disappointing.  High marks for food, low for service.  Also, avoid the Mangotini....
Absolutely incredible food.  And I had the vegan sampler.
Friendly staff, good and tasty food, good menu choices.

Made a reservation for lunch and drove quite a distance to introduce my daughter to what had been my favorite restaurant for 30 years.   Discovered that the lunch menu (and prices) was not available on Sundays.  As this was not what we budgeted for, we had to leave,  having made a wasted trek into NYC, including costs of gas and tolls.  The waitress,  who was the only worker, was unable to offer anything more than a call from the manager another day.  Very disappointing.
